Summary: Little things... like it was 30yrs old and no maintenance man...  Eat across the parking lot at the Denny's. The walls are thin enough to tell if the woman next door was wearing white cotton panties or black silk... and their bed squeaked... but it was only for about 90 seconds...

The room looked OK upon walk-in, but smelled AWFUL.  Like a mix between wet dog, smoker, and food.  One of the bedside lights was bent to the side and didn't work at all - even after trying a new bulb.  The shower head was misty and barely rinsed me off.  Towels smelled like they had been outside for awhile.  Mattress was very hard (much harder than "firm"), the desk was wobbly/about the crumble, and the luggage rack was missing one of the main straps, rendering it useless.   My first evening was OK, despite the smell of the room.  However, there was a loud party next door on my 2nd night which lasted 4 hours.  The walls seemed very thin.  I had to blast white noise from the TV just to drown out the hooting and hollering.  Then they brought the party right outside my door, where

This hotel is in a great location, and close to a freeway, also plenty of food available in walking distance. We stayed here with our Team for a sporting event at OC Great Park. Less then 4 mins away.   This hotel needs a complete renovation. For one it's in Irvine, you would expect better. 2nd it a Wyndham hotel you would expect better. 3rd it's so close to a huge youth sporting complex, you would expect better.  The bathrooms were awful! My daughters refused to shower because it was so dirty. The walls were dirty and moldy, the tub was not clean. The ceiling was peeling off. The floors were disgusting, we made sure our kids wore their shoes until they got to thier bed for the night.  These carpet ls have to be a sanitation issue!  The pool gate had no mechanism to keep in

I guess you get what you pay for, but didn‚Äôt think a hotel in Irvine would be this bad. Carpet had stains. Window panes so thin and had gaps in them I could hear I-5 all night. Bed was uncomfortable. Breakfast and service was fine.

Summary Heading: quick stop while driving to Baja
Summary: Staff were informative, professional and room was clean. Good to have wifi while travelling and good to have access to hot water, coffee and breakfast. Good to have two beds while travelling with our adult son, and have a full bathroom.

Summary Heading: Bed next to train tracks all night.
Summary: Tired of hotels only looking out for their own best interest. Filling up the most undesirable rooms first and leaving the best ones available for last minute more expensive reservations. My night was nothing but trains going by every hour on the hour. I woke up in the morning and realized my bed was 10 ft away from train tracks only visible when the sun came out.

Bathroom had rust and mold and paint peeling off walls. Soap and lotion only, no shampoo or conditioner. Room had heavy perfume sprayed in it when we got there that gave me a headache, the door was outer (motel like) and not fully sealed, so the high way traffic, trains, and restaurant across the street were loud. Bed was old and not super comfy. Breakfast was decent. Staff seemed friendly.

Summary Heading: Billing dispute to get my money back. $75 deposit added without disclosure.
Summary: My original estimate gave no mention of a $75 deposit on top of room bill. I was not aware till he ran my credit card and I got the higher amount in notification sent to my cell phone. Once I checked out I expected it to clear but I waited over a week and ultimately had to dispute the bill through my credit card company to get it back. Service desk was unsympathetic and kind of rude. Blamed corporate and got defensive.  Was simply a hassle. Compare them to a small cut above Motel 6. Bad experience.

The rooms were still under construction - there was dust and dirt everywhere - elevators were not working - very dirty carpets with stains and dirt....our stay in regards to cleanliness was not satisfactory...

room was musty, hallways hard trash leaking bags ,carpets dirty, air-condition unit missing cover. reception rude augmentative. Elevator was dirty, pool was extremely dirty  there is no way you could use the pool top and bottom. bed had stains . had o sleep in my clothes

I was extremely disappointed with my room and the hotel. The hall ways were dirty, the room was weathered. My son didn‚Äôt feel safe. It‚Äôs was an uncomfortable stay. The breakfast was a joke. It was a waste of my money.

I was offered and accepted $25 for the rude mistreatment, detailed below, that I received during my entire stay. My credit card was credited $27.50.  But my deposit was not returned and there were no damages to the room as I extensively documented after removing my belongings.  They kept $27.50 of my deposit to make it look like they had returned it in two separate payments, but it really amounted to stealing the compensation payment I accepted to stay there.  The mistreatment involved assigning me a room not yet cleaned. In retaliation for requesting one that was, I was assigned a room that reeked of human feces.   When I complained about that, the desk clerk told me that he would personally inspect a third room to make certain that it was ready. He lied. Instead, he broke into

Clean. Staff friendly and helpful. Physical plant getting old and in need of refurbishment. Property needs capital improvements. Exterior is old and tired. Landscaping looks its age. Old. Room was clean. Everything worked. It just is an ok place to stay but not even close in quality to the newer LQ locations..

Front lobby very run down, dirty, dark. Sketchy. Room was dated with old and mismatched damaged furniture. Halls same. Old nasty paint and carpet. All aspects sketchy and gross. Found a clean, new, fresh and lively hotel for the same price at Holiday Inn in Lake Forest. I was really disappointed with this La Quinta. I've stayed at La Quinta many times in other states; never seen one that looked so rough.

Part of the charm of this place is the converted industrial space housing the pool, gym & rooms.  The exposed concrete walls & curved room corners provide a charming aesthetic.    Unfortunately, that‚Äôs where the charm ends.  No room cleaning is provided, dirty towels and trash litter the hallways(for days).  The trash cans near the elevator are overflowing, as are the outdoor cans.  The gym floor begs to be vacuumed, including random wall screws providing walking hazzards.  The rooms appear clean on the surface; however, mold growth in the shower is clearly evident & definitely needs to be addressed.  The carpet is peeling off the wall in areas.  Its really unfortunate because this place could really be a nice place to stay with proper management.

Clean rooms, well equipped. Helpful front desk and service. Very good value for this area, though somewhat noisy if the fan isn't used at night to mask it. I enjoyed it as a quick getaway from home when we needed to accommodate extra guests. Good food options (Knowlwoods, Denny's and Jack in the Box) are within easy walking distance.

This hotel is frickin awesome!! Yes, it's a little dated, but they turned a historic rock silo into a hotel, beaming with historic images everywhere! It's like staying at a Motel 6/historic 1020s - 1940s museum. I'm sad we missed much & will return to find the areas posted in other traveler's pix. We can't wait to return just for the unusual ambiance. üëç

Beds are extremely sunken in , like having a number around the bed. Pillows old and washed so much they are knits if fiber fill. Bathroom ceiling was peeling and moldy. Crown molding around room was terribly dusty.   Only positive thing I can say was the air conditioning and television (very limited channels) worked. Wi-Fi was spotty at best. Told I could come to front desk area and connect with no problems.  Worst place I have ever stayed. Definitely needed updating.

The hotel room and hallways were very dirty.  Requests to have our room cleaned as the posted sign said were denied.  We were told we should check out at noon each day and check back in at 3:00 if we wanted the 3 rooms we booked cleaned.  We checked out after 2 nights of a 7 night stay and went to another hotel.  The LaQuinta brand has been damaged beyond repair.

The newer building to the front of the property may be nicer, but we are staying in the ‚Äúgray concrete silo‚Äù to the rear which perhaps was a former prison? Carpets are horribly stained, and I just hope I don‚Äôt catch anything here. Someone at the corporate office is asleep at the wheel because this is a joke.

Summary Heading: Don't stay here if you need sleep.
Summary: A train ran outside my room every 30 minutes. And it was close and loud. The plumbing was horrible. You had to hold down the handle and wait for momentum to build before it would flush. The shower wouldn't drain and would fill up while you took a shower. The beds look like they came from the '80s

Couch is so dirty we had to as for a bed sheet to use as a cover before we felt comfortable sitting on it. One bed had two different kinds of hair in it before we even tried to use it.  This place is disgusting.  Never come here.

Summary Heading: Train goes by every half hour.
Summary: Our room was practically on the train tracks and the train goes by every half hour! There were poor breakfast options, overall hotel looks dirty, we had a decent room. Location was good for our baseball tournament.

Summary Heading: Love trains? Busy Parking lot with Turo rentals? Minimum breakfast? You'll love this place.
Summary: Situated between a Dennys, a loud car wash, Interstate 5 and a major railway line, you'll be treated to a symphony of madness. Enjoy people watching as Turo rentals come in and out all day at the parking lot, enjoy the basic breakfast of carbs and sugar. Marvel at the spotty network. All for you for the low low price being offered!  The yellow building has poor noise insulation, maybe the grey concrete building is better but its right on the train tracks so who knows.

This was a terrible stay at the Windham spectrum irvine ca  I had a clogged restroom I had to unplug and I could not us the bathroom the entire stay I had to go down to the lobby from the 4th floor ever time. I don‚Äôt remember a worse experience with my family

Summary Heading: Love this hotel!!!  Be sure to eat breakfast next door too!!
Summary: I LOVE this place - always stay in the silos and get the King or Executive King. My pekingese loves it there too - Rooms are good and the shower is fantastic! I love staying there and like i said - be sure to eat the best breakfast in the entire world next door at knowlwoods i think its called.

Room smelled like smoke, was dirty with peeling paint and very noisy.  Basically, one of the worst and grossest hotels we‚Äôve ever stayed at.  Person at front desk understood and agreed when we told him we were going to another hotel.

Do not stay here unless it is all you can afford. Worn out is teh best way to describe teh hotel.   it is not actively 'dirty' and None of my family got sick eating breakfast, nothing that would make me walk out immediately etc. Staff is doing best they can.   that said, stay elsewhere unless you need a cheap place to crash and bring a sleeping bag.  TV service and wifi  was pretty good too actually.

Much better hotels close by that are not a rundown. I was disappointed with the rooms as well as the pool. No service on the hot tub for what looked like months, and the area around it was falling apart and filthy. Rooms are dark with dirty windows, refrigerator broken, tub stained. Also, the property is next to train tracks and it very loud. It woke us up and was so jarring they my son thought it was an earthquake. I was very happy to leave.

Great experience with everyone we came in contact with. Super friendly and helpful staff. Breakfast was amazing. Lots of fresh varieties to choose from. The dining area was super clean and well stocked.

Room faced the train tracks and ran often throughout the night. Unable to get consistent sleep.   Room was motel quality and walls were paper thin so could hear everything that my neighbors were doing  Checkin process was slow and staff lacked customer service

Nice spacious room, I find that being in a former grain silo is poetic, like sleeping in a museum.  Location is convenient right at the highway entrance.  The only problem is if you have a noisy neighbor in the room above you: you hear heavy steps in particular, and the floor cracking, which can be disturbing if late at night.  I'll ask about it next time I visit: is it possible to have a quiet room, or quiet area?

The Elevators did not work. I had to carry my luggage up stairs to 4th floor. Their was no offer of help from the hotel staff.  The hotel staff offered a room on the second floor, but they acknowledged that the room was next to a railroad track.

Check in and check out was quick. Staff was very friendly. Breakfast was limited to a continental breakfast with limited fruit options, but plenty yogurt varieties available. The room over all was clean except for the dresser. The dresser had been wiped and had lettuce dried lettuce on it. the shower also had a few hairs on the wall. Other than those two things the room was clean. Beds were comfy, with plenty of fluffy pillows. Plenty of open space in the room. The room was aesthetic style contributed to the historic appeal of the building.

Summary Heading: Closer to tracks, parking lot and freeway
Summary: The hotel was located by the tracks with runs until almost midnight and starts again at around 6am. The rooms are dingy looking and the amenities in the room are broken. The only good thing about the stay is the front desk staff are nice.

Summary Heading: Cool Historical landmark left in poor condition
Summary: We have traveled with La Quinta frequently and have stayed at this particular location in the past. The facility and rooms are in desperate need of cleaning and updates.  It appears that since this is a old mill building the management feels they can operate it with the facility being in poor condition.  Elevators, Ice machine not working our entire stay. Rooms all outdated with musty old carpet, windows drapes and bathrooms from the 1960s. Shame

This place was not good.  The carpet in our room was the filthiest hotel carpet we had ever experienced.  The walkways and exterior areas were very dirty.  The bathtub  did not look clean--I would have never used it for a bath.  The bed was fairly comfortable, but the furniture was a bit worn.  The 'grab and go' breakfast was a joke (a couple of very sweet and unhealthy bars),  and there were almost no amenities (ie coffee, shower cap, etc) in the room.  The crowd that seemed to stay at this place was very young and noisy--a group of young men hung outside our walkway (so just outside our room), smoking, eating and talking into the wee hours of the morning.  In the morning there was a mess of chips and cigarette butts outsisde our room.   The location of this hotel is good so it

Stayed four nights with our pet.  While the design/nature of the building (a historical agricultural building, which we thought was cool) precluded direct exterior entry/exit access to/from our room from the outside (for convenience of taking the dog out), the facility was pleasant & comfortable & the location very convenient..

Summary Heading: Hallways, elevator and carpet in rooms need desperate cleaning
Summary: Very dirty inside & out,  ghost town! Needs maintenance desperately! Breakfast should be called grab a snack n go.  Building behind main hotel have separate entrance, with no guidance and no employee around to assist, appears to be an old abandoned warehouse. Front desk attendant took a guest call while checking me in, guest requested extra towels. Attendant asked guest to come to the front desk with their dirty towels in order to provide replacement! How tacky is this!

Window in room was so dirty you could barely see out of it. It was super loud with a train running right outside our room window. This is Motel 6 experience if that‚Äôs what you‚Äôre looking for.  Unlike other La Quinta stays.

My stay at la quinta was one of the worst experiences I have ever had. The constant noise was unbearable. Very bad design layout. Should have built , at least, a sound wall barrier between tracks and building.

Check in at night was slow. Overcharged for the smallest room on property. Never got housekeeping. Bought cleaning supplies to clean own bathroom. Cancelled my reservation without reason n cops called

We didn‚Äôt feel safe at all while on the property. Multiple domestic disputes all over the place made it feel really uncomfortable. We also witnessed a police room raid while we were in the parking lot. Having other tenants hanging around outside staring at everyone made coming and going an uneasy experience. We were also lucky enough to have a girl drugged out sitting in front of our door when we checked in. Not to mention the roaches and food on the ground.

Old and dirty n smiley room. People stand on the hallway smoking!!!! One of the worst hotel I ever stay in my life.  Ask to change room  , they give me a room worst than the last one !!  La Quinta hotel chain quality on their hotel is very inconsistencies!!!

I'm a Dimond Member and booked with points and because I did was given the worst room and when I asked the front desk they told me that's the room to people who book with points, and did  nothing to resolve my issue.

Silo rooms facing the train tracks are out of an I Love Lucy episode. Trains run just outside the rooms and constant noise even at 1am. Rooms dark and musty, the view out the window was fuzzy due to the grime on the outside. Bedside lightbulb was out; room phone broken. Didn't bother with the free breakfast because the room quality was so poor. Bed was clean and comfortable and staff friendly. Used to stay at this hotel but not any more. Even the normal bath items including lotion and shower cap weren't offered.

We stayed at the hotel just one night, me and my family. We are 6 people. The hotel was good, clean and very nice location, near the restaurant, grocery store and gas station. Our room was apparently clean and fresh and had everything we needed, refrigerator and microwave, extra towels and extra sheets. We had a simple but complete breakfast. The staff was very friendly. Very nice hotel and good price

Summary Heading: La Quinta Irvine, California, a rare gem
Summary: KIKI  was Spectacular, and we will go back to this particular La Quinta, in Irvine, as long as KIKI orchestrating the synchrony of facts, of the busy hotel La Quinta, that my family and I became fan....  I, who have a profession as a hotelier for more than two decades of my life, specifically in training of customer service to Spanish speakers, in las   Vegas and surrounding cities, I humbly acknowledged that KIKI is a a rare gem to find.... Involuntarily I had the opportunity to stay at the reception for about an hour and I realized that she has such a nice and pleasant positive power impact towards all employees and guests, that made me very impressed... she is absolutely perfect in all aspects, being in the front of the battle is not an easy task.  Her professionalism is

Looks nothing like advertised. Carpet were filthy and heavily stained. Mattress was very old with a huge dip. Pillows were old. Blankets heavily stained. Loud from train, stairwell, and parking lot.  Doesn't feel very secure - outdoor access direct to room. Everything was severely outdated. Fruit flies in room.

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay near amphitheater
Summary: Interesting place to stay. This place used to be a bean/grain silo and warehouse in 1949. It‚Äôs listed in the National Register of Historical Places.   The entrance is located off of Burt Rd behind a Denny‚Äôs so you won‚Äôt see it right away from Sand Canyon.  The lobby is your typical La Quinta. The staff was polite.   The rooms are nice but here is where it gets interesting. The grain warehouse is now a three story building made of concrete. The walls inside the hall and rooms are exactly that. Plain, grey concrete.   Another very important thing to know is that the transit train tracks run directly behind the building. So if your room is in the tracks side, you‚Äôll hear the whoosh sound of the train from 7am-12am. It wasn‚Äôt noted on my reservation and I was told about it when I

The room smelled unpleasant, the carpet & bath tile floor was sticky, the AC didn‚Äôt work well & the room & property needs significant updating. Great location & nice pool. I won‚Äôt be staying there afain.

Pet friendly and pretty nice overall . I stayed in the silo building behind the main building. You need a key for entry and the elevator is slow as heck but otherwise OK. The room was kind of an odd shape. Traveling with my dog and I always try to get him as far away from the door as possible because people walking by will cause him to bark. Unfortunately, due to the shape of the room we were still close to the door and it was kind of hard for him to settle in but he did ok . I went to the breakfast one day to get a cup of coffee. The desk agent would not allow me to get my coffee because my dog was with me. I offered to go and get his service dog credentials and was still turned away. I spoke with the night desk manager about it and she promised that they do obey the law with

Service was good, did have a/c issue , door latch issue and showerhead issue, but  most of the time outside of room, latch was fixed, shower head had to be done twice, and a/c worked for a day than went back to not being cold, but they did address issues

Hotel is located right next to an active train it is also located right near a 24 hour car wash with extremely loud fans ‚Ä¶..the carpeting in the room was stained and disgusting, looked like blood but it could‚Äôve been dog urine‚Ä¶‚Ä¶. who knows?  the breakfast was bare when I say bare !there was no food trays out at all‚Ä¶‚Ä¶ there was a few yogurts a couple of packaged muffins, coffee and that was it  Got a full refund for the night. ‚Ä¶‚Ä¶staff was nice.

Summary Heading: A lot of value for the money
Summary: We stay at a lot of LaQuinta‚Äòs .  Our room was located in the mill.  Beautiful room.  Employees we‚Äôre friendly and accommodating. Their  continental breakfast was a paper bag filled with processed items.  I passed .  I miss their regular Continental breakfast. Which was waffles, pancakes, scrambled eggs, sausage, etc. i‚Äôm hoping they will bring it back soon.  This is why I‚Äôm only giving it a four-star

Before booking my hotel room I specifically asked to be on the first floor because I was having surgery. Check in time came and I was put on the fourth floor. Staff offered me first floor but with one bed. Was traveling with another person so it didn‚Äôt work out. The hotel is next to a train which woke us up every time. Beds were not comfortable at all. Didn‚Äôt enjoy my stay.

Old. Could use some serious cleaning - especially on the exterior walkways, etc. Train track is right behind the building - be prepared for some rumbling if you are a light sleeper. This hotel should not be more than $100 per night max.

Summary Heading: Train Noise don‚Äôt waste your money
Summary: The train noise was bad. My room was 6 feet from the passing train. The last train was at 12:30 am and the first rain was at 4;30 am. 3-4 hours sleep. Should only pay for 3 hours.  The Management know of the problem but they just take your money anyway,  The breakfast was non-exssitant.

Considering it is a 2 star hotel, was a great experience.  You have to understand this is not the Ritz Carlton and keeping that in mind and the fact that it is a 2 star Hotel it was overall pretty cool to stay in the old Mill... I had no problems and really did enjoy my stay. I found the staff friendly and check in with Andrea was very friendly.  Love the location

The rude management makes this hotel worse than it is. Hotel is in a great location and housekeepers and maintenance stuff are really hard working and nice. Jose the maintenance guy is really helpful too. However, the management (Ms. Ke. Ke.   ‚Äì not sure about spelling) and some people in the front desk are just so incredibly rude. When we checked in, we had two reservations as we decided later on to extend the stay. We were told by front desk that we can stay in the same room when we checked in. However, the day when our reservations were supposed to change ‚Ä¶. we are sleeping with our 22-month toddler (around 2.30 PM) and I hear knock on the door. I open the door and there is this woman telling/ almost shouting: ‚ÄúYou are checking out!‚Äù I am looking at her like what is going on.

Dirty carpet, faucet dripping all night,  pillows  smelled like cigarettes even though it was non smoking room. When we came in we had to open the door all the way because room smelled like Pine Sol and Lysol was spilled all over. Would not stay there ever again.

Summary Heading: Nice clean hotel for a short stay
Summary: The price was better than most of the hotels in the area and they didn't charge for parking which was a plus.  The room was clean and wifi works.  Breakfast was minimal.  We booked the place for breakfast and the pool.  The pool had a problem and was closed, the breakfast left us hungry and we went next door.   There's a place right next to the hotel that had a really nice breakfast menu.

We stayed in this hotel many times before pandemic and we are dissatisfied that the quality of service went significantly down after the pandemic.  The front desk staff  is not trained properly. They are bothered when you ask them for anything you need. You get the feeling that you are doing something wrong just asking to schedule housecleaning which must be done 24 hours ahead of time or asking for extra bedding feels like stuff is inconvenienced by it. Also, the breakfast is not a breakfast at all. Coffee, juice and bag with fruit cup, cereal bar and muffin. Try to eat it every day if you are staying for two weeks.... We understand you have to make adjustments for pandemic but at this moment it feels like cost cut , especially since CA is open since June 15. Overall, we are

The La Quinta at Irvine Spectrum isn't the newest property in town, but it is well maintained, generally very clean, and the staff are very friendly and helpful.  Also, it's right next to a Denny's, and the world's greatest hamburger joint, which has some interesting history inside.  Definitely a good value for a stay in "old Irvine".  Some individuals may have trouble with the nearby railway track, but I sleep with earplugs, and it was no problem for me at all.

Ugly unfinished terrible looking building with unfriendly staffs.Do not waste your money and time there!filthy,dirty rooms.The hotel is situated between freeway and railway.The whole room shakes when trains are running by.

Weird rooms inside old silos.  Dated and rather poorly maintained property.  Supposedly brown bags breakfast service, but none seems to be available.  Noise from nearby train track could be annoying.  Rates are OK and staff is friendly...
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your review.  We appreciate the feedback  and will share with our Staff so we can improve.

Summary: First room had a partially working A/C and terrible smell coming from the toilet. After extending for one additional night I moved to a different room.  Second room there was an odor that smelled like anti-freeze which wouldn't go away. There was also a pungent food smell. The remote to the TV was broken and I couldn't adjust the volume.  I spoke with the front desk more than 5 times and was promised that "everything would be cleaned and disinfected". After leaving the room for an hour I came back and nothing had changed. The microwave and fridge area were not cleaned as promised either.  I then reached out to the front desk and was told that there was a different room available by Andrea. I entered the third room and clearly someone had been smoking indoors for the past few

The room I was given needed lots of improvements and looked like something out of a bad movie. Shower needed a good cleaning. Wires hanging out of the wall. Internet didn't work. Someone was smoking on the balcony that I had to walk by with less then three feet to separate us. Noise from the 405 freeway even with window closed and AC on.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your review.  We are sorry for the problems you experienced.  We appreciate the feedback and are working with our Team to improve.

Summary: Not nearly as nice as all the other La Quinta‚Äôs I stayed at. The rustic silo has a unique feel and has potential I‚Äôd they would carry the decor and lighting from the entry thru the hallways and into the rooms. It abruptly went from chic rustic to eerie jail cell. More attention to hallways and room decor and detail is needed!! I won‚Äôt be staying here again. Just too dark and creepy.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your review.  We are sorry you did not enjoy the Silo Building.  We appreciate the feedback and will share it with our Corporate Team.  We do hope to get some renovations and upgrades in the future.

Summary: Staying in the old grain storage building was a unique experience.  Having dining available within walking distance is a plus. Even with Metrolink and Amtrack next to the building you could not hear the trains inside your room.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your review.  We are glad you enjoyed the history of our Silo building.  We hope to see you again on your next visit to Irvine.

Summary: I stay at this hotel often for business and actually look forward to it as kind of my "home away from home"!  I noticed that others have complained about the historic part of the hotel who did not like the "cement walls"!  The historic building is actually my favorite building to stay in, not only because it has a secure key-entry lobby but I love the big rooms with a slightly round feel, for their uniqueness and because to me they have a good "feel". Maybe it's because I've spent many years staying in hotels around the world and I enjoy something different!  The staff at this hotel are always upbeat, kind and professional when I arrive and always willing to help if I need anything.  I also enjoy the fact that the Great Park neighborhoods are very near, (just a couple minutes
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your kind review.  We are glad you enjoy and appreciate the History of our Silo Building and that our location is convenient for you.  We look forward to seeing you again on your next visit.

Summary Heading: Pay very close attention to where and what this building actually is.
Summary: The images on the booking site I used were of a separate building in front of the actual hotel building. It literally looks like a medieval prison. It's a huge, domineering concrete slab with scary looking windows. A bit of a disappointment, but I can live with that. Come to find out, it's the same on the inside. Cement walls. Smelly carpet. Even if this was a Motel 6, I would have been mortified. I'm not a complainer but this was absolutely the weirdest, worst-smelling, and scary hotel I've ever stayed in - so bad that I nearly turned around and walked out, but didn't feel like dealing with the hassle as I was only going to be there briefly on business. The receptionist however was lovely and I can't discredit the appearance of the lobby and all that. It was just like a total

I was in the area for work and this was close-by the worksite. Friendly, helpful and courteous staff. The room was well designed for a working office and quiet in spite of nearby aircraft flights. Will stay again when in the area.

The day manager was rude and unfriendly. I received poor service during my one night stay at La Quinta which I reduced from a planned 2 night stay. The was put in a remote building that was cold and unaccommodating. Moreover, La Quinta is not very close to the Spectrum.

Summary Heading: Friend was not allowed to extend his stay
Summary: my friend and his mom were staying there and when they went to extend their stay, management refused and said that they did not want to have to take the extra time to clean the room because of their service dogs. this is illegal.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing  your feedback.  We apologize that your friend and his mother were not able to extend for whatever reason.  We are ADA compliant and also pet friendly.

Summary: I arrived on Friday 9/18/2020 @ around 5:10 p.m. I was greeted with a warm smile & a welcome from Andrea. She was professional, accommodating & cheerful. She checked me in with and gave me tow room petitions with full description of both. I was in room 200 for the first 30 minutes if my stay. When the rest of my party arrived we ended up moving to room 145. What an amazing room that was, it was clean, quiet & very comfortable. I will definitely come back to stay at your property again soon. One memory I took with me was Andrea's professionalism, smile & her laugh. Great asset to your team......
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your review.  We are so glad to hear about the warm welcome and professionalism you received from Andrea.  We are so fortunate to have her on our Wyndham Team.  We will definitely recognize her Job well done.  We hope to see you again on your next visit to Irvine.

Summary Heading: La Quinta Hotel gives the brand a black eye
Summary: The lobby of the hotel was standard but when I got to the hotel room, I was very disappointed. The only reason I did not walk out was because I arrived late and there was no where else to go. The room look like a podunk hotel on the fringes of some desert town in Texas.  The furniture was old and run down and the carpet was not clean. I could not walk on this carpet for fear that I would catch something.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, we are sad to hear our hotel did not meet your standards. We hope to have the opportunity to better serve you in the future.

Summary: We stayed in the historic part of the hotel. The room was beautiful and extremely large perfect for family. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful during our entire stay. Hot breakfast consisted of waffle makers and instant oatmeal I was hoping for more hot options but all in all I was very satisfied with my stay. I will definitely stay at this hotel again
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your review.  We appreciate the kind words and are glad you enjoyed your stay.  We hope to see you again on your next visit to Irvine.

Summary: I checked in and got a nice room, everything seems to be clean and comfortable. I lucked out with the trains being on the opposite side so I didn‚Äôt hear any noise. No issues, I‚Äôll come back if I‚Äôm in the area
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your review.  We are glad you enjoyed your stay.  We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: Super nice people, clean room and the bed was good. Love LaQuintas for being pet friendly. This one is in a cool old grain elevator so loved the repurposing of the building. The only downside is it sits right next to train tracks. No horns honking but many passenger/commuter trains going by. They didn‚Äôt run in the middle of the night, so I didn‚Äôt find it to be too big of a deal, but they do start up pretty early in the morning. Fridge, microwave in rooms is a big plus!
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing the review from your recent stay.  We appreciate the kind words.  We are working with our Corporate office to better sound proof the rooms.  Thank you for the feedback.

Summary: Guest room unsatisfactory. The carpets were so dirty I did not want to put my suitcase, shoes, slippers or anything else on it. The bedspread/comfortable was stained and tattered. On adjusting the pillows, I found a lipstick stain which was visible at the top of the pillow and stains on the pillows. Trust me, they were visible stains I did not touch The actual pillows to look further.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your stay.  We apologize you were not happy with the room.  We will share your comments with our Team so we can improve and prevent this from happening again in the future.

Summary: We often stay here, great location, clean and dog friendly. Not much else to say  but they want me to expound for at least 200 words for some reason so you can stop reading now. I'm a retired air traffic controller so I'm used to clear and concise but that doesn't work here!!
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind review.  We got a kick out of the required 200 words.  We hope you enjoy your retirement.  We look forward to seeing you on your next visit to Irvine.

Summary Heading: Interesting Place to Stay with History
Summary: It was a very good experience with a clean room, friendly staff, great price and good breakfast. The history, displayed on the inside walls of the silo building, was very interesting, especially to my husband.
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful review, we are so happy to hear you enjoyed our location and the history of our Silo building. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: The La Quinta staff was very friendly and helpful.   Check in and out were extremely efficient.   The unique style of the silo rooms were a fun variation to the run-of-the-mill appearance and feel of these standard roadside hotels.  Breakfast was probably the weakest feature with limited offerings and hard boiled eggs as the only protein option.   We would definitely stay here again when traveling to Irvine.   Everything was meticulously clean and parking was both adequate and easily accessible.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review we appreciate the feedback. We are so happy to hear you enjoyed our historic building, we hope to see you again soon.

Summary Heading: If you like loud trains, this is your dream!
Summary: The noise from the trains roaring by throughout the night was intolerable. The tracks were located about 15 feet directly behind the building with trains passing full speed in both directions at least every hour or so. There was no mention of this when I made the reservation, and only a slight mention at checkin, although it was after midnight with no other rooms available and too late to make other arrangements.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, we are sorry to hear about your experience with the train noise. We are glad to hear our front desk did mention it to you prior to check in. We hope to have you stay with us again in another room location situated further from the train tracks.

Summary Heading: We loved the rooms and FREE Parking, plus the history of this hotel is very cool!
Summary: My family and I came for polo games... and we were excited to have found this hidden gem in the middle of Irvine.  The rooms were unique, and everyone at the front desk was super friendly.  One person, I believe her name was Dorothy, was especially helpful and welcoming.  I love that she said, "Just give us a call if you need anything;" it made us feel really special and cared for.  : )  The next time I come to Orange County with my family, we now know where we are going to stay.  Thank you, La Quinta of Irvine.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your wonderful review, we will be happy to share your kind comments with our team.

Summary Heading: Check out lady at the desk was absolutely wonderful. Thank you again.
Summary: I was on a business trip with my company, and I believe this particular girl worked during the night. She ended up checking me out the next morning and when I tell you I absolutely loved everything about the check in and check out process I really enjoyed myself. She was genuine. Willing to help find us the best places to eat. Every time she saw us it was ‚Äúhows your day going‚Äù have a good one. ‚ÄúIf I needed anything please don‚Äôt hesitate to call‚Äù She checked up on us to make sure we were all alright. And we are absolutely going to be back. Love love love it!!! Thanks so much Alaysia! Loved it. Breakfast excellent. The best fruit I‚Äôve had in a while. Clean & quiet rooms. I really enjoyed my stay. Thanks again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful review! We will be so happy to share your wonderful comments with our staff. We can't wait to have you back.

Summary: The reason for my stay was to be close to where I was having outpatient surgery. I had to be at the surgery center at 6am and my home is 47 miles away. So to not have to get up so early, I booked the one night stay. I found the location to be quaint and seense, in spite of the frequency of the "train" passing through. My chauffeur (sister-friend) and I were not disturbed by the barely noticable noise.
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful review, we are happy to hear our location was just right for your stay. We hope to see you again soon under better circumstances.

Summary: The hotel is in a great location of Orange County South.  The problem with this property is that its drabby looking, not safe looking, very dark at night, and un-comfortable.  The hotel needs to be brightened up, the interior hallways need to be warmed up and the rooms need help.  Would we stay here again?, No.  It has a un-safe feel and the rooms were a cold feeling, with many items that did not even work, such as the microwave and the refrigerator.  The shower-tub area and the toilet had bad lightning and no grab bars on the shower walls.  Not a good thing if someone were to take a fall.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, we are happy to hear we are in a great location. We are sad to hear you did not enjoy the historic vibe in our historic Silo building, additionally we have many rooms available that are ADA accessible that have railing in the showers if you need them for your next visit. We are thankful that you have reported an issue with the refrigerator and microwave as your comments help us to improve and maintain quality. We hope to have you back with us for another stay.

Summary: Check staff rude / check out staff clueless / rooms old and smelly / train goes by about every hour and shakes the bed and room.  Booked this hotel for a month but stayed only 1 night.  Worst hotel stay ever!!!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience, we are sorry to hear of your front desk and train experience. We hope to have the opportunity to better serve you in the future.

Summary: If you just want a place to lay down your head for the night, this place will fit the bill. The location works for access to nearby places. But boy! they don't tell you that there are train tracks right next to the hotel, and the whole building shakes when the trains pass. Also not to mention they don't even give you a bottle of water in your room. On the plus side the breakfast was filling and the building was interesting.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are glad to hear we were just the right fir for your stay. We hope to see you again.

Summary: Concrete bedrooms that used to be silos and a grainery make for a quiet stay. Just a simple place, but had everything needed for a comfortable stay. Plenty of towels, plugs , lights, pillows and very roomy.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share the review of your recent stay.  We appreciate the feedback.  We do hope to see you again on your next visit to Irvine.

Summary: The location was perfect for us. I felt like we were in a decent area. The staff were outstanding. Very lovely people. The service was outstanding.  However, the smell of bug spray in the rooms was followed by finding a dead cockroache and silverfish in the bathroom. There were no security cameras in the hallway that I could see, the door didn't automatically close, and plugs would not stay in the outlets (we had to prop then up or they'd fall out. The carpet was stained to the point of being dingy and there bedding had stains as well. The staff did the best they could but the owners need to step up their game.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, we are happy to hear our staff was outstanding. We sincerely apologize about the state of your room. Please rest assured we have taken measures to address and resolve the issue. We hope to have the opportunity to better serve you in the future.

Summary: This hotel is part grain silo.  It makes it fun, as the rooms are different.  They are clean and quiet. You can hear the trains, a little, but they offer earplugs.  Honestly, I have never worn the earplugs and I do not wake up. The staff is always helpful and the parking is ample.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your review, we are so happy to see you enjoyed the history of our Silo building, and to hear our staff is always helpful. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: Big beautiful  rooms.  Very  unique room in an old silo.   Many nice restaurants  around the hotel. Really close to irvine spectrum.   I recommend staying in the silo.  The breakfast  is good but, Knollwoods restuarant  have great food
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, we are so glad to hear you enjoyed the historic building. We can't wait to have you back for another stay.

Summary: Our room had stains all over the carpet, and was the smallest room with a king bed that we ever stayed in at a La Quinta.  Our room was on the back side of hotel.  Beware...metro train runs day and night about 10 ft behind the hotel.  You will hear and feel it go by.  We stayed at this hotel partially because we have dogs.  Grass around hotel marked "no dogs allowed".  No place to walk dogs for potty or poop.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, I do want to assure you that we don't have a single "No Dogs Allowed" sign on property, though I cannot speak for adjacent businesses. We do have designated area's around the hotel for your pets to do their business, along with clean up stations.

Summary: We stayed there last year for two nights when I had hip replacement surgery and again this year.  It‚Äôs close to the hospital, easy in and out, very clean, beds comfy, handicapped accessible except for no handles in the tub.  Very pleasant environment, one building is a renovated grainary.  Very cool. We didn‚Äôt eat breakfast either day but it looked like the usual hotel breakfast.  The pool looked nice.  Train tracks are on the west side and are used almost all night long so ask for rooms on the quiet side.  There were two restaurants next door.  We ate at Denny‚Äôs the second morning because I needed protein and had AARP discount.  There is a strip mall just a few minutes away with some wonderful restaurants including a brewery.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your stay.  We appreciate your loyalty and were happy to see you again.  We hope we continue to be your hotel of choice when you visit Irvine.

Summary: This is the second time this year we have stayed at this location.  Enjoy the industrial chic appearance of the room and, even though it is by a railroad track, it is not at all annoying.  (Our first stay, we couldn't even hear the trains.)  Also, it is pet friendly which no additional fees which is becoming more and more rare.  All staff are very welcoming and helpful.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your stay.  We are so glad that you enjoyed the industrial appearance and of our property and that our location works well for you.  We hope to see you again on your next visit to Irvine.

Summary Heading: I like the feel of this place
Summary: I really like this hotel especially their back building it has a very rustic type of look and it's really cool they do have a freight train that drive through there several times a day but I really don't mind it at all. they have tried their best with double or even triple they hav
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your 5 star rating. We are so happy to hear you enjoyed our historic building. We hope to have you back with us again soon.

Summary: This staff was as good as you'd find in a 5 Star hotel. Front desk made the check-in and check-out experience fast and easy. They even volunteered to answer any questions about the location and the area in general which allowed me to get to my meeting quickly.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, we appreciate your feedback. We will be happy to share your kind comments with our staff who I'm sure will be thrilled to hear about their 5 star service. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: My husband and I stayed for the weekend. We were assigned to the old historical building. We were pleased thg hat the staff member changed our room away from the train tracks. Staff were all very nice.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, we are so happy to hear you enjoyed our historic building and that our staff was able to get you your desired room. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: I was in town for an event and needed a reasonable place to stay. I was originally booked at another hotel but I realized that La Quinta was $50 cheaper a night, AND included free parking and breakfast, neither of which was the case at the other place. It seemed like a no brainer to switch hotels. After I made the switch I read some reviews that talked about the train noise so I was a bit hesitant when I showed up to check in. The man at the front desk could not have been nicer and he quickly reassured me that I was staying in the old granary section of the hotel and away from the tracks and honestly I never heard any train noise.  My room was definitely a bit "odd" but if you like the industrial chic type look you'd get a kick out of it. It was circular and the wall were all
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, we appreciate your feedback. We are happy to hear that our prices were reasonable. I want to assure you that we do not allow pets into our breakfast room, only service animals are allowed to go everywhere the owner goes. We do hope to have you back with us again.

Summary Heading: They made and extra effort to check me in...!
Summary: I really did enjoy my stay there and the history that they display about the property. Along with the near by restaurants and shopping areas. made it very convenient to acquire travel necessitates and food.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay.  We appreciate the kind words.  We are glad our location was convenient for you and that you enjoyed the history of our Silo Building.  We hope to see you again on your next visit to Irvine.

Summary: Always clean... Always friendly... I've stayed here quite a bit, the process are decent considering it's in the heart of the OC. Close to malls, shops, beach, airport, eateries, etc. . Everyone is extremely nice and the area is quiet.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review. It is always appreciated to hear how friendly our staff is. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary Heading: Nice staff, but rooms are motel grade
Summary: Very nice staff.  Room had stained carpet and mold smell. Dingy appearance. I loved the quality of staff but based on what‚Äôs I saw in the room I would keep in mind my other options.  This place needs to up its game and at least be clean as far as carpet etc.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, we are so happy to hear of your experience with our staff. We look forward to having you back with us.

Summary: Having to be next to the train passing area is horrible no sleep at all, they should really do something about that, also the walls on that area could be painted or something looks like unfinished work bad view.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, we appreciate your feedback. We are sad to hear the unique features of our historic building were not enjoyable for your stay. We hope to have the opportunity to serve you again in one of our other room locations for your next visit.

Summary: Staying here right now. Check-in was fast and easy. The desk clerk was helpful and very nice. I‚Äôm in the silo building. It‚Äôs cool in a quirky kind of way. The bed is comfortable and the room was quiet the first couple nights but last night I could hear music coming from somewhere in the building. My room faces the parking lot so I‚Äôm away from the train tracks and haven‚Äôt heard any trains go by at all. I had their complementary breakfast today and it was decent. Waffles, cereals, muffins, yogurt, etc.  The room is a decent size, and has a large mini fridge, microwave, and coffee maker. There is a Denny‚Äôs, and Jack-in-the-Box nearby. I think this is a good choice if you‚Äôre on a budget.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, we are happy to hear you enjoyed your stay and that the front desk staff were helpful and nice. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary Heading: Love staying at this La Quinta
Summary: We always like staying at this La Quinta!!  We love the old Grainery section because these rooms are so quiet!  They also come with a refrigerator and a microwave!  We choose the side away from the railroad tracks, so we don't hear the trains at night.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, we are so happy to see you enjoyed our historic building. We look forward to having you back with us.

Summary Heading: Don‚Äôt stay on the train side
Summary: Great hotel if you are not on the train side of the property. The train side is extremely loud as the tracks are literally right outside the window and it goes all night! Otherwise the property is super nice!
Manager Response: thank you for your review. We are glad to hear our property was "super nice." We look forward to seeing you again.

Summary: The location was great. Close to freeways. Staff very friendly However the windows did not have privacy due to a clear drape on them. Felt a little uncomfortable. The beds need to get replaced they were a little uncomfortable to sleep in.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, we are sad to hear you did not find the beds to be comfortable. We have purchased new mattress and are looking forward to implementing them. Additionally all of our rooms come with black out curtains for privacy. Please ask us for assistance for your next stay. We look forward to seeing you again.

Summary: The hotel had a extremely professional friendly and knowledgeable staff. Check in was quick and easy. Room was spacious  clean and very comfortable bed. Bathroom was spotless and had an abundance of bath tools.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We are so happy to hear you enjoyed your stay and your wonderful comments about our staff and cleanliness. We look forward to seeing you again.

Summary: Stayed for a business trip. Location is OK, right near the Spectrum. Bed was not comfortable at all. Apparently the standard room is near the trains, but the front desk staff moved me when I checked in (just make sure to ask before you check in). I didn‚Äôt have any issues with sound...my room was quiet. It‚Äôs not horrible but it‚Äôs not great. Close to a Denny‚Äôs, Jack in the Box and a gas station. There are better places but the price is ok.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your stay.  We apologize that the bed in your room was not comfortable.  We will share your feedback with our Team so we can improve.  We do hope to see you again on your next visit to Irvine.

Summary: Not clean and very noisy neighbor there was something bast above our headboard nobody had cleaned up and I had to sleep u see it.. also our neighbors were so noisy one night I didn‚Äôt get any sleep I‚Äôm seeing if u could give me a couple free nights to stay at your hotel again probably a different location
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, we appreciate your feedback. When experiencing an issue please inform the front desk of it immediately, we are always happy to resolve any matter. We hope to have the opportunity to better serve you in the future.

Summary: Our room was right next to the train tracks which were busy 24/7. Very noisy. To the hotels credit, they did volunteer to move us the next day but they were fully booked the day we checked in. We booked our room months in advance so I would have thought we'd have gotten a better location in the hotel. Breakfast was OK but there was a Denny's in only a couple hundred feet and it was better.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our property. We are happy to see our front desk staff was able to give you a different room location more suitable to your needs. We hope to see you again for another stay.

Summary Heading: Discounted customers are second class here
Summary: If you get a discounted room, they place you next to the train tracks which means you will not be able to sleep. I won't be staying here again. The other rooms apparantly get to listen to the freeway noise.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, we are sorry to see our location was not a good fit for you. We hope to have the opportunity to serve you again in the future.

Summary: Friendly staff. Great location. Pool is clean. Restaurants on property  very good.  Great access to freeway .good location to mall ang great park.  A little noise from the train,but nothing overwhelming. Highly recommend
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your review.  We appreciate the kind words and are glad you enjoyed your stay.  We hope to see you again on your next visit to Irvine.

Summary: Room was clean and neat. Staff is friendly. Staff was helpful in getting room I was hoping for. I wanted / requested room in same building as reception. Breakfast is good. Internet connectivity was good.  We got parking on the same side as room.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your stay.  We are glad to hear that our staff was helpful and your room was clean and neat. We appreciate your business and hope to see you again in the future.

Summary: The room was nice for the price.  Breakfast was good..  Laundry facilities were nice on each floor. We were checked in quickly and the pool was good.  We were not bothered by any noise. We were able to get a room by the rest of our group.  The front desk was very accommodating.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, we are very happy to hear our staff was accommodating and our prices were just right. We look forward to having you back with us again.

Summary: It was an Awesome trip other than my fur-baby having heat stroke, in which the gentleman who checked us in was genuinely concerned. I also really enjoyed being in the very old building, it was like being in the past, which made my stay an adventure. FANTASTIC!üëç
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, we are so happy to hear you enjoyed our historic building. We are sorry to hear about your "fur-baby" getting heat stroke, we are happy to hear the staff was concerned and attempted to help. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary Heading: Skip this location. Find another hotel
Summary: The place smelled like mildew and smoke. I had to cover my nose Everytime I entered the building. This specific location is right next to a train. It went ALL day and ALL night. It scares you Everytime it approaches and it so noisy. Bring ear plugs. Better yet probably don't stay here. The breakfast was okay (nothing special) and really busy.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to tell us about your experience at La Quinta Inn & Suites by Wyndham Irvine Spectrum. I am sorry that your experience did not meet your expectations; please allow me to express my sincerest apologies.   Your feedback is very important to us, and I am saddened to hear that about the smell, we will take care of it. Please rest assured that we are taking the appropriate measures to address the problem and prevent any future occurrences. Here at La Quinta Inns & Suites, we continuously strive to meet your needs and expectations.   We appreciate the time you took to share your concerns, and it is our hope that you will give us the opportunity to better serve you in the future.

Summary Heading: We ended up not even staying
Summary: Please be aware when booking this hotel that the train tracks are literally right outside of the window and to ask for a room as far from the train tracks as possible.  Also request a room in the older section that looks like a hotel.  We were booked into a room in the new industrial building. Now I‚Äôve never been inside a jail cell or a coal mine but I imagine they look exactly like this room. We walk in and I was so freaked out I knew I couldn‚Äôt even spend one night there. I told my teenagers we weren‚Äôt staying.  We were going to stay the night after a concert and ended up driving home. The staff was very nice and accommodating and gave me a full refund. Other people might think the dark concrete rooms are cool but honestly I found it creepy.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are happy to hear our staff was nice and accommodating.

Summary: Probably ok if your stuck for a place at 2 am.   Property is old and tired and needs a facelift.  Staff was great.   Clerk put us away from the train tracks on back of hotel. Right off the freeway and two restaurants nearby
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, we appreciate your feedback. We are happy to see our staff was great and gave you a room with your desired location. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: From the time we checked in and by the time we checked out, customer service was outstanding.  All the staff were professional, friendly and respectful.  The Suite that we stayed at was beautiful and clean.  We enjoyed the swimming pool and spa also.  Everything was perfect!!!
Manager Response: thank you for your review, we appreciate your feedback. We are so happy to hear of your wonderful stay with us. We look forward to having you back with us again soon.

Summary Heading: Had better stays at La Quinta in other locations
Summary: La Quinta sets the bar high and when problems arise, they are very noticeable no matter how small they are.  That being said this is a unique location but also an older property.  Breakfast differs in that there is no breakfast meat offered such as bacon, sausage, or ham, along with no scrambled eggs.  At my previous stays at other La Quinta properties, this was the 2nd location that I encountered in the past year where the breakfast menu was smaller.  At least they did stock up when as needed, which met my expectations.  There was a minor but loud disturbance in the parking lot that lasted for almost 2 hours in the middle of the night.  Despite all the problems, I would still book a room here in the future.  The staff was friendly and helpful.
Manager Response: We received your review and apologize for the problems you encountered with the noise in the parking lot and the our breakfast selection.  We appreciate your loyalty to La Quinta and am sorry your stay fell short of your expectations.  We have shared your review with our Team as well as our Corporate.  We do hope to do some renovations in the future along with enhancements to our Breakfast.  Thank you for the feedback.

Summary: If you are looking for a place to lay your head and don‚Äôt care about cleanliness, view etc book it. The beds are comfortable. Unfortunately the water pressure leaves a lot to be desired, the fan didn‚Äôt work in the bathroom and worst of all, sewer kept backing up into our bathroom sink.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay.  We apologize you experienced a problem with the plumbing in your room along with the cleanliness.  We are very sorry and have shared your review with our Team so we can improve and prevent this from happening again in the future.  We appreciate the feedback.

Summary: My wife and I had made the reservation months ago.  We stayed seven nights.  It would have been a lot of trouble to check out and check into another place, so we stayed.    We did not have any housekeeping service for two of the seven nights/days.  Because the room was on the first floor and faced the parking lot, we kept the drapes closed.  Combined with the concrete walls, this made the room dark all the time.  The carpet had stains.  There was lint on the floor that remained and indicated that the floor had not been vacuumed.  The door to the building didn't close and seal unless pulled hard - poor security.  We also found a very large cockroach in the hallway; I killed it.  I found a small silverfish  crawling on my computer that last day.  I killed it too.  Would never stay
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, we appreciate your feedback. We are very sorry to hear you experienced any kind of pest activity, as we do spray on a regular basis to prevent any from entering the hotel. Please rest assured we are taking measures to prevent any future occurrences from persisting. We do hope to have the opportunity to serve you again in the future.

Summary: We loved this place! Silo hotel rooms unique and clean. Pool was extremely clean. Staff terrific. Only suggestion, add some meats and scrambled eggs to continental breakfast. Close to shops and exit/entry ramps for highway.  Staff was friendly and inviting. Rooms were clean. Under beds clean.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel, we appreciate your feedback. We are happy to see you enjoyed our unique historic building as well as our staff. We look forward to having you back with us.

Summary Heading: Could use some updates and better breakfast.
Summary: Cleaning ladies were awesome and the front desk woman that checked us in could be more courteous. The hotel could use lots of updates. Breakfast was terrible, honestly the worse of all the hotels we have been to and we have been to a lot.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are happy to hear you found our room attendants to be "awesome." We will be happy to pass along your encouraging remarks and work to improve our check in process. We look forward to seeing you again.

Summary: So, began my check in, and the front desk people were very friendly, They gave me a room on the 4th floor, great no noise above. had to get back in car to get to my room because most of the rooms are in a separate building. Took the elevator up  and came to a dark hallway that looked like it had been last renovated approximately 1985. Went down to my room and looks like the last guests had just left the room, full trash, unmade beds food containers. So, I called down and was told oops, We'll move your room. Moved my suitcases again down the hall. The room was hot, I noticed the air was off so, turned it on and left to go have dinner. Came back over an hour later and the room has cooled slightly but, still quite warm. I call down to the front desk and they seem to be becoming
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, we appreciate your feedback. We are sorry to hear of your initial check in and the follow up with the AC unit. Please rest assured we have taken measures to address your concerns to prevent any future occurrences. We hope to have the opportunity to better serve you in the future.

Summary: Do not stay here. Hotel is right next tot the train tracks so every time a train came by it was super loud and even shook the room a little. Trains came at all times of the night.   What was even worse in our case was terrible service. A La Quinta Irvine Desk employee told me to cancel a booking I had made through a third party vendor because this employee told me that they would book me a room through the hotel directly. When I arrived at the hotel and had no room for the night [which I understand was a simple mistake on the employee who falsely communicated this to me] instead of apologizing, giving compensation, or admitting that I had been given false information, the manager and desk workers kept trying to explain to me the situation and blame me for having cancelled the
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We are sorry to hear of your experience with the train noise and your third party reservation. Please rest assured we are working closely with corporate to reduce noise and keep the charm of our historic building and following up with the individuals you spoke with.  We hope to have the opportunity to better serve you in the future.

Summary: Frankie and Ronnie were extremely helpful and followed through with making new accommodations for us. The room we received at first was near the elevator and too noisy but they moved us at once to a new room.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are very happy to hear that 'Frankie and Ronnie were extremely helpful.' We will be happy to pass along your remarks. We look forward to seeing you again.

Summary Heading: Too much noise in the night as it is beside railway line, dirty carpets and poor breakfast
Summary: Too much noise as it is beside railway line, dirty carpets and poor breakfast. I could not sleep the whole 2 nights there. Also breakfast was bad with the eggs having a vinegar smell and nto edible. The carpets were dirty too. Rooms were big though.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to leave a review. We are sorry to hear your experience with the noise from the train, however we are glad to hear you were satisfied with the size of the room. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary Heading: One of the worse experiences I‚Äôve ever had
Summary: I arrived late night and I was given a room next to the rail train just to begin with the guy in the counter didn‚Äôt bother to mention that.. it began to work at 5 am keep in mind I arrived there at 1 am I was a little over 3 hours into m my sleep when it woke me. The air conditioner in the room made more noise than what it really worked
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your review, we are sorry to hear of your experience with the train and AC. We are working closely with corporate to reduce noise and keep the charm of our historic building. Please rest assured we are taking measures to prevent any future occurrences. We hope to have the opportunity to serve you again in the future.

Summary Heading: The worst la Quinta I ever stayed in
Summary: I was so disappointed when I drove in this dump it was the worst I ever stayed in you‚Äôre in the back alley the train that runs through there and look like a old Motel six with the name just changed Irvine has so much to offer do not go there unless you‚Äôre desperate it‚Äôs overpriced where it is Do your research before you stay anywhere when you are a woman that is not the place
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback, we are sorry to hear you did not enjoy your stay here with us. We do hope to have the opportunity to better serve you in the future.

Summary: Horrible stay didn‚Äôt get any rest the train is horrible and it sounds like it‚Äôs going thru your room would not recommend to anyone if you want a good night rest.We worker had no idea what he was doing.
Manager Response: We appreciate your feedback, we are sorry to hear you experienced excessive noise due to the train. We hope to have the opportunity to better serve you in the future.

Summary Heading: On the train rails not shown in their pictures
Summary: The hotel is built right beside train rails that goes by at night several times.  They are not showing you this part of the hotel on their pictures.  Stay away !! There are other much better hotels at their rate.  The hotel smells bad from moisture .

We have stayed at this hotel for the 4th of July and New Years. Our dog is afraid of firework sounds. Irvine doesn‚Äôt allow fireworks. We live 15 minutes from here. Hotel is comfortable and fairly clean.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are happy to see that our location is a good fit for you. We look forward to seeing you again next year.

Summary: Lobby was nice but the rest was very unwelcoming. Raw, unfinished concrete building, especially inside made my kids uneasy. Massive depression in the beds made sleeping difficult.  Breakfast was decent
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are sad to hear our historic building was not appealing to you, for future stays we would be happy to place you in our other building. We do hope to have the opportunity to serve you again in the future.

Summary Heading: Very Frequent Guest Review >20 stays: Overall Average - Management is Very Bad
Summary: The rooms are okay, but the carpet needs to be cleaned and/or replaced. Some of the showers and faucets leak/drip, the elevators tend to be very dirty. Overpriced for what you get, especially since it is next to the train track. The silo rooms are roomy and rather cool if you appreciate the architectural uniqueness and creativity. The rooms in the main building are smaller very ordinary and not the best for privacy. The train side of the building can be a bit loud but the parking lot side isn't bad and surprisingly tolerable.  The manager, Maureen, is horrible. I was quoted a price by the reservation line (where it's stated that they "guarantee the BEST rate") and then charged $30 more at the front desk. When I disputed the issue they refused to honor the first rate and when I
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our property. Have a nice day

Summary Heading: Convenient, but a little run down
Summary: The bathroom was clean.  The carpets need to be replaced.  The beds are only double sized, not queens.  The staff were very friendly and helpful. The outside of the hotel needs to be painted.  The elevators are not very conveniently located, but it is only two floors.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We are happy to hear you enjoyed the friendliness and helpfulness of our staff. We look forward to seeing you again in the future.

Summary: Room clean but dark. Opening drapes for light highly comprised privacy. Pool area needs much improvement. Not a heated pool, no ambiance to relax.  Lobby personnel friendly. Very average not worth $$$.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, we appreciate your feedback. We are glad to hear you enjoyed the friendliness of our front desk staff. We look forward to having the opportunity to serve you again in the future.

Summary: The La Quinta  was a great place to stay. The staff was friendly the free breakfast was good and so convenient. The kids really enjoyed the pool and the location was perfect.   La Quinta will be our hotel of choice any time we are in Orange County.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are happy to hear you enjoyed the pool and staff, and that the location was a good fit. We look forward to seeing you again.

Summary: Maureen the hotel manager very nice! Everything was great except the pool was not available while we were there and the bed was old and uncomfortable. Breakfast was ok. Very clean hotel. Not alot of channels available on TV.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our property. We are sorry to hear of your bedding situation, we are taking measures to assure that does not happen again. We hope to see you again in the future.

Summary: The hotel is built 20 ft from train tracks that are used all night. When I booked the room no mention was made and prices don't reflect that you are sleeping so close to the tracks that the bed shakes.

Hotel very accommodating and friendly.  Nice size room great king size bed.  Breakfast could have offered more of a variety  hotel is a quite away from the airport but free shuttle is offered.  ..........
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, we are happy to hear our hotel was friendly and accommodating. We look forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary: The rooms were clean and comfortable. Nothing too fancy. The breakfast was continental, but had plenty to choose from. The staff was friendly. We did not notice the noise from I-5 next to it, but made it convinient.
Manager Response: Thank you taking the time to leave a review. We are happy to hear of your experience with our staff. We look forward to seeing you again.

Summary: Me and a group of fellow coworkers stayed here over a night. We were exhausted once we checked in and were expecting to get a good nights rest. We were woken up 3 times because our room was literally sharing a railroad track. Room shaking and loud. We did not rest well. We were expected to have rest for our 8 hour training the following day. We will most likely not return.
Manager Response: We appreciate your feedback, we are sorry to hear of your experience with the train. We do hope to have the opportunity to serve you again in the future.

Summary: OMG!!!   Great stay!!! Will definitely stay here again...Staff is so accommodating, even when I checked in at 8am...  Great breakfast and if you want something else to eat Jack in the Box and Denny's are right outside...But who can complain about waffles, cereal for the little ones, oatmeal, muffins, fruit, bagels, toast, and of course coffee, orange and apple juice...  With my Wyndham Rewards I get discount with La Quinta, that's probably why I was upgraded to a better, nicer room the second time I stayed...Will refer this place to anyone that needs a place to stay in Irvine...  Close to the freeway and gas station...
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful review. We will share your comments with our staff who I'm sure will be encouraged. We look forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary Heading: Stressful, upsetting, frustrating and insulting is how I describe my stay here.
Summary: I didn't receive the service I paid for.  The staff was condescending and questioned my honesty when I reported that the room had not been cleaned two days in a row. They pointed fingers back at the third party booking agent as responsible to give me compensation for their inadequacies. I received no receipt on check out so I could confirm any charges on the credit card provided. It ruined my trip.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to tell us about your experience at La Quinta Inn & Suites by Wyndham Irvine Spectrum. I am sorry that your experience did not meet your expectations; please allow me to express my sincerest apologies.   Your feedback is very important to us, and I am saddened to hear that your time here was less than enjoyable. Please rest assured that we are taking the appropriate measures to address the problem and prevent any future occurrences. Here at La Quinta Inns & Suites, we continuously strive to meet your needs and expectations.   We appreciate the time you took to share your concerns, and it is our hope that you will give us the opportunity to better serve you in the future.

Summary Heading: Noisy room with extremely bad service
Summary: I am a platinum member and they downgraded my room without informing me. Rooms doesn't look like the one shown in pictures and are not even painted. It's next to train track so you near loud noise all day\night. Other folks were complaining about the AC not working as well, luckily it was working for us.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to tell us about your experience at La Quinta Inn & Suites by Wyndham Irvine Spectrum. I am sorry that your experience did not meet your expectations; please allow me to express my sincerest apologies.   Your feedback is very important to us, and I am saddened to hear that your room was downgraded.
