Everyone at the front desk is very courteous and made the stay pleasant, they made it easy to book extra nights when we needed to. Lots of different options for breakfast given and the location is very clean as well !
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to give us a review.  I will make sure to share with my team!  La Quinta Irvine

Summary: Renovated grain silo!  Artsy California chic atmosphere in an inexpensive hotel.  Supurb service!  I never hugged a manager before but everyone went beyond to help my daugher prepare for a big championship meet (they found a scale, got an early breakfast snack ready, big good-luck wishes). After she won we changed plans and stayed at LQ instead of the resort we had planned. THAT GOOD!
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to give us a review.  I will make sure to share with my team!  La Quinta Irvine  P.S.--Thank you for the hug!!!

Summary: Regular visitor ~ every two or three months.  Stayed once in the new building - silo building is superior and a unique experience.  Also like setting - convenient to I-5 but in low-traffic area with nearby services.  Big plus is that my small dog can be with me.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to give us a review.  I will make sure to share with my team!  La Quinta Irvine

Summary: Looking for a room very late at night, many hotels didn't even answer.  The night manager met me at the door and expedited the check-in.  Great property with a Knowlwoods next door, and open for breakfast.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to give us a review. Happy the night team could help you out!!  I will make sure to share with my team!  La Quinta Irvine

Summary: I am not a picky traveler.  I have literally never written a review for a hotel, but I am spending my precious time to try to save someone the same misery I had at this hotel.  Think horror movie.  The concrete makes the rooms seem more prison cell than hotel.  I realize they were going for "Magnolia Farms Grain Silo" but they missed by a country mile.  I felt like I was staying in an unfinished basement.  See pictures.  The hotel was literally 10 feet from train tracks.  I was awakened every 30 minutes by trains.  The trains could not have been louder if I had been riding on them.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to give us a review. I am sorry you did not like the natural concrete walls of our 100 year old converted grain silo. The trains can be tough some nights depending on their schedule.  I will make sure to share with my team!  La Quinta Irvine

Summary: I love to take baths and hesitate in hotel rooms because they are never clean to my standards.  La Quinta is always clean and ready for bath time.  Thanks again for your attention to detail.  I will be returning on my next business trip in April.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to give us a review. Happy you got to enjoy a bath.  I will make sure to share with my team!  La Quinta Irvine

Summary: Made a reservation and arrived late. They told me that since I was a later arrival, all of the rooms in the quiet building were issued so I would be in the building that backs to a train track that is active.  So they would lower the rate or I could go elsewhere. WTH?
Manager Response: Thank you for your direct and genuine comments.  We really appreciated the feedback. Rest assured we will be looking into the comment you have made about your experience with our front desk staff.  We hope to continue to have you as our guest, and look forward to another chance to serve you. Your comments are taken seriously and we will take steps to make the guest experience even better.  Respectfully,  LQ Customer Care

Summary: The location is great, directly off I-5. It made our trip to legoland very easy.  It's also very cool to sleep in the silo room.  It was very spacious and had homemade curtains in the window, nice decor.   A cool burger place right next to the hotel too   What we hated was everything else.  There was no/extremely weak ventilation in the bathroom.  The windows opened but there was another window so we got no air flow.  The AC/heater leaked in the middle of the night onto the carpet.  There was a broken tile in the bath, I was worried my kids might cut their feet on it. And we never even got housekeeping.  Stayed 2 nights, no fresh towels, toiletries, no beds made, etc.  Staff wasn't rude but wasn't really friendly either.  I would not stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to give us a review.  I will make sure to share with my team!  La Quinta Irvine

Summary Heading: Great for pet-friendly passing through, maybe not extended stays...
Summary: The hotel location is incredibly convenient, which we liked, but the amount of Irvine Police activity in the parking lot was disconcerting. We saw at least one arrest made, multiple tickets, and a lot of patrolling. I had an officer actually cruising me in his squad car while I was walking my dogs in the parking lot one night. It's just unsettling that PD presence is so necessary. And it was necessary. This location seems to attract some less savory folks for drug/alcohol binges or something. I was in town for fertility treatment and will not stay there again because it's not the nicest environment. It's fine for one night passing through or something. La Quinta prices and pet policies really can't be beat. We love not being shoved in gross 'pet only' rooms. However, for a
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to give us a review.  I will make sure to share with my team! Your feedback is vital for my teams success!  La Quinta Irvine

Summary: we arrived in the middle of a huge storm so we were happy to get off the road. Room was all fine. Comfortable and clean. Room was quite and bed was fine. There were different and distinct wings of the hotel - not sure how different each was. This was easy access on/off freeway.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to give us a review.  I will make sure to share with my team!  La Quinta Irvine

Summary: LQ asked for my feedback and for suggestions.  Rather than write a review, I'll share with you what I shared with them for improvements:  Make sure housekeeping staff wear HAIRNETS!  I posted pictures on Yelp of the gobs of hair on the wall in bath.  Also, a regular pest service would help.  I was on the third floor and there were ants!  The woman at the desk was ignorant of my repeated request for the location of the elevator and kept referring me to the location of the stairs.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of your experience with your guest room. At our property, we often utilize guest reviews to help us improve our hotel operations. We‚Äôve reviewed your feedback with our hotel team and are now actively taking steps to freshen our hotel. We appreciate your time in reviewing our hotel and look forward to seeing you during your next visit to the area.  Respectfully,  LQ Customer Care

Summary: Excellent if you stay in the Silo building. Other buildings are older. Good breakfast, good location. I always stay there when in the area. I would recommend this property without hesitation. Rooms are generous in size in the Silo building and the architecture is creative.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to give us a review.  I will make sure to share with my team!  La Quinta Irvine

Summary: I actually enjoyed the commuter train passing by the back of the hotel. It passed by in about 3 seconds, and I never heard it at night while I was sleeping. The converted grain silos made it a very fun and unique hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to give us a review.  I will make sure to share with my team!  La Quinta Irvine

Summary: To be fair, we stayed here for a memorable night eleven years ago so maybe we had some rose colored glasses on.  Or, quite possibly, time has taken it's toll.  Either way, this location is very run down although I will say they had a delightful handyman touching up paint one morning.  While the customer service was decent and continental breakfast is always a plus, the rooms in general left much to be desired.  We had to change our original room due to an excessive smoky smell.  Our second room shower had a very difficult time draining.  And while yes, I'll admit the fam and I have become hotel snobs over the last decade, the three and a half star rating was a major overreach.  I wouldn't suggest this location for anything more than a quick stay over on a drive when you have
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to give us your feedback on our property. We are always striving to improve our property and genuine feedback is the best way for us to do that. We hope that you will visit us again the next time you are in the area.  Respectfully,  LQ Customer Care

Summary: There is a mass transit train that travels 30 min. If you're a light sleeper I would recommend other accommodations.  The staff was very helpful and the rooms very clean.  They also have a shuttle and good continental breakfast
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to give us a review.  I will make sure to share with my team!  La Quinta Irvine

Summary Heading: We had a 3 night stay at LaQuinta Inn
Summary: The lobby and the Breakfast room were very nice and clean and served a nice variety of breakfast goods. The only problem I had was the outside door of the handicapped room on the first floor, We could see light coming in on all sides of the door making think that if someone wanted to break in one good kick would have opened it. We had no problem but I was a bit nervous.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to give us a review.  I will make sure to share with my team!  La Quinta Irvine

Summary: Our stay at this hotel was great ! Hotel is clean and comfy. Rooms are spacious and beds are soft and easy to have a good nights sleep.Staff is incredibly friendly and very helpful !  2 staff members in particular ( Victoria and Oscar ) were extremely nice and went above and beyond just doing their job. Access to freeway and area attractions was easy.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to give us a review.  I will make sure to share with my team!  La Quinta Irvine

Summary: The facilities were clean and safe. There were a few major things the check in clerk like there is a continental breakfast and the time, check out time AND THERE ARE COMMUTER TRAINS THAT RUN ALL NIGHT AND DAY and offer an option to be on the other side of the building. The sofa bed was loud could move a muscle without waking others. The sofa made the same awful sound as the sofa bed when it was sat on
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to give us a review. I am sorry about the trains, they can be tough depending on the freight schedule. I will make sure to share with my team!  La Quinta Irvine

Summary: I am a weekly business traveler to the Irvine area. In my opinion there is no better value hotel in Orange County.  Nice clean rooms, great staff, continental breakfast and free parking.  Love the historic silo building. Ron, Shakil and Sarah make my weekly check-in a breeze.  Thank you
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to give us a review.  I will make sure to share with my team!  La Quinta Irvine

Summary: When we arrived at this location, we though the hotel was not finished yet. the reason is that this hotel  used to be a bean and grain warehouse and it was transformed to give it a industrial look. It took awhile to get used to this style, which a truly did not like. Then hotel is located right where the train passes by so you will go to sleep hearing the train until midnight. There is nothing spectacular about this Quinta Inn but the location is good. It is close to Laguna Beach and to shopping area. Continental breakfast is OK. If you will be gone all day, this may be a place to stay to sleep only,  and you will have to be very tired to not hear the train passing by at night. So just keep in mind, the look, the train and the price.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to give us a review.  I will make sure to share with my team!  La Quinta Irvine

Summary: Great Hotel  So cool to be staying in an old historic silo.   Staff were always friendly and eager to help.  Saw reviews about train noise but we did not hear any of the trains go by.   Can't wait to stay there again.   Might want to take a power strip with you to charge your electronics
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to give us a review.  I will make sure to share with my team!  La Quinta Irvine

Summary: The locale is close to the freeway and the concept is interesting. The staff was really friendly and helpful. The breakfast choices was really terrible for the location. I have stayed in a lot of hotels and the breakfast is pretty standard. It was less then most La Quinta's. I walked over to Knollwood for breakfast and it was good and inexpensive for the area.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to give us a review.  I will make sure to share with my team!  La Quinta Irvine

Summary: I had set up payment for my employee to stay at this hotel a month and a half ago apparently they have a corporate policy that they can not take CC over the phone so now my employee has to come up with the payment. I am a business owner and know that we are able to take CC over the phone. I wanted to make sure all was taken care of for my employee since she is there to learn not worry about costs
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  I am sorry about your employee. We just have to be very careful with Credit Card Fraud. We try to protect our guests as much as possible.  Thank you,  La Quinta Irvine

Summary: Very disappointed with the quality of rooms for the price paid! The location is excellent but overall very dissatisfied with the rooms. The breakfast was the exact same everyday and lacked in quality. Adding variety would help
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to give us a review. We are looking at breakfast options in the next year.  I will make sure to share with my team!  La Quinta Irvine

Summary: The Room stunk, and the bed was so used that it was like sleeping in a hammock. You could not turn over. The view was of the Freeway. This building was not attached to the main La Quinta hotel, and called the Grannery, a hayfield warehouse for hay which it originally was probably. I will never use your service again.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to give us a review.  I will make sure to share with my team!  La Quinta Irvine

Summary: Unique hotel redesigned using historic grain silos, rooms were spacious and clean;  staff was friendly, efficient and helpful with all needs and questions.  Nice to have a hotel that is pet friendly and does charge a fortune for a pet.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to give us a review.  I will make sure to share with my team!  La Quinta Irvine

Summary Heading: Good location for business in Irvine
Summary: We stayed at this location for several days. There are train tracks close by but we only noticed a train once. Front desk staff were friendly and helpful.  Clean room but the maids did not always resupply the essentials (towels and coffee).
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to give us a review.  I will make sure to share with my team!  La Quinta Irvine

Summary: Staff was amazing! Denny's and Knowlwood restaurants nearby were fantastic! Plenty of grass to walk our dog! Lot's of shopping centers are nearby.  The trains are not a problem if you stay in the main building.
Manager Response: Timothy C.,  Thank you for your comments.  I will share with my team!  See you next time!!  La Quinta Irvine

Summary: The hotel (at least part of it) has been converted from grain silos. Amazing and intriguing reuse of historical structures. If you like places that are a bit out of the norm, and have character, history and personality, then this is for you. (But make no mistake, the hotel is clean, modern and functional too.) Convenient location too, with restaurants and mini-mart/gas-station within walking distance.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to give us a review.  I will make sure to share with my team!  La Quinta Irvine

Summary: The matress in room 233 was a weird size, 74" by 74", not the eastern king we requested. The breakfast was not well-stocked on CHRISTmas eve and CHRISTmas day. Otherwise, this was a wonderful experience at this La Quinta.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to give us a review.  I will make sure to share with my team!  La Quinta Irvine

Summary: We always  stay here because it has always been a great experience for us. Great price, Always Clean, Great staff, Nice Breakfast in the morning, Just a great place to stay. We have tried other Hotels but none of them compare. We always recommend this hotel to all our friends and family.  Thanks
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to give us a review.  I will make sure to share with my team!  La Quinta Irvine

Summary: Overall hotel is good, but the price is really expensive. For same money you can rent via airbnb and will get better service and location. Irvine is really expensive place. Hotel located closely to I-5 that is big plus. You can easy reach any famous place in OC in 20 min. Anyway service is really fine, every day cleaning, friendly reception and nice breakfast with waffles, fruits and some snacks.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to give us a review.  I will make sure to share with my team!  La Quinta Irvine

Summary: Victoria H provided excellent service and went above and beyond to get assistance with semi truck parking.  Thank you so much Victoria.  I would recommend this hotel for any out of state truck driver looking for a hotel with truck parking.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to give us a review.  I will make sure to share with my team!  La Quinta Irvine

Summary Heading: Interesting hotel but beware of back of hotel
Summary: The hotel is interesting because the front is a normal hotel and they expanded it by converting a giant cement grain facility into rooms which I found very nice and interesting at the same time. The one problem is that the backside of the cement structure has train tracks about 10 feet and the trains sound like they are coming through your room so it's very noisy.  If you are not on the backside of the cement addition, it's fine.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to give us a review. I will make sure to share with my team!  La Quinta Irvine

Summary Heading: Best Valued Hotel in all of Orange County
Summary: La Quinta Irvine California is a wonderful place to stay. All staff members are polite and curious, the building historic and interesting, the gym is well supplied, the Wifi is free and the breakfast is complimentary. I couldn't ask for any more; especially at their great valued prices.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to give us a review. I will make sure to share with my team!  La Quinta Irvine

Summary: we came in a big group of 12 rooms.  1 person was checked into a dirty room; i.e. bed not made, towels on the floor, etc.  1 person was checked into a room that had lipstick and dirt on the towels.  1 person couldn't check in at all because reservation couldn't be found even WITH the confirmation number.  WORST of ALL, the hotel is right next to the train tracks (literally right next to it) and the train shook all the rooms... ALL. NIGHT. LONG.  THEN!  They overcharged the rooms and charged some of us twice.  Had to deal with it afterward.  WHAT A NIGHTMARE!
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to give us a review. I will make sure to share with my team!  La Quinta Irvine

Summary: This is a great place to stay especially if you have a tournament at Great Park just on the other side of the 5 freeway. Get some great rest before Tourney play and comeback to recover in the hot tub. Shopping at the Spectrum is a couple exits South, but I prefer to go North a couple exits for less crowds at the center off Jamboree.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to give us a review. I will make sure to share with my team!  La Quinta Irvine

Summary Heading: Great stay in an historic hotel
Summary: This is the "coolest" La Quinta and for that matter just about any hotel I've ever stayed in.  At first I was surprised at the accommodations, not fully understanding the significance of the building.  After reading the history of the granary building and walking through the property, I had a greater appreciation for it and have told many people about it.  Being in the construction industry, I understood the challenges faced in transforming this building into a hotel and keeping the integrity of the historic feel.  If you're in this area, I would definitely stay here, it's an experience!
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to give us a review. I will make sure to share with my team!  La Quinta Irvine

Summary: We lived in Irvine for three years, but never stayed here until this trip.  We stayed in one of the silo rooms - the outer wall was all concrete, the actual silo wall, while the interior walls were regular drywall.  Quiet location, away from other development.  Train track right behind the hotel, trains always run, but it doesn't wake you up at night.  A/C was a bit noisy, but other than that, we loved this place.  Staying in a historical hotel that used a structure that's a part of Irvine's history was very cool.

Summary Heading: Going off the rails on a crazy train
Summary: Room and window were 10 feet from train tracks - not joking - your night is filled with the loud screeching, vibrating, engine rumbling of several fast moving trains that will shake you to your core every hour throughout the night.

Summary Heading: GOOD TIME IN LA QUINTA INN
Summary: I had the opportunity to stay in La Quinta Inn hotels during the last weekend , one more time.  Great hotel with good service and good staff.  Strongly reccommend for my friends.  My Dog really like to stay at La Quinta Inn as well !!!

I can see how some found this charming as the structure and rooms are unusual and decor is pretty nice for this price point but  there are some deal breaker issues here.  I checked into my "non smoking" room only to be met at the room door by disgusting, full on recently smoked in stench that would have permeated  everything left in the room in a minute. Went back to the front desk and voiced my concern- no apology I might add. They then said all they had was something on the non quiet side. How noisy could it be thought I.... Well after a few minutes in the room a freight train rushed by that- kid you not- is 10 feet from the window. You don't just hear it; the entire building shakes and these trains appear to run all night. to operate a hotel at that proximity appears to be a

The rooms in the silo are very unique and quiet 13401176y47yt80hy178ty1h78fh13480fyfy7fy1fhhhbvyu7y7ygy7527778er787078025289tu892y5gjiguh0278g5y9h24u8gh29ugh2780g9248gh0725yg25hg82rfhu2rhg2f8hgh80hu2hf80erfui0rhf82f782hugf223h89fh028hf2gf78025h
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for giving us your feedback.  I will share with my Team.  Thank you,  Hotel Manager

Summary: This is the only hotel I stay at when I come to visit my mom in Irvine. The staff is always very helpful and nice. The rooms are always clean and the rates are reasonable. They allowed my pets to stay for free. Its located in the same parking lot as 2 restaruants. One is open 24 hrs. There is also a gas station right across the street. The only thing I would recommend if you have a hard time sleeping is to not stay on the train side of the hotel. Another plus is the free breakfast in the morning.

I always opt to stay at this hotel because of its unique history and design. It has a reasonable rate for its location and the design is a huge plus! Great staff, nice choices for food within walking distance and love the rooms in the old warehouse.

My experience was very good and I like the history of the hotel plus I like gym and easy use of wifi. also the front desk clerk was extremely helpful as well as the housekeeping staff. very clean room only downside was there were ants in the room I did notify housekeeping and front desk no one cane to fix or clean room but my experience outweighed it all
Manager Response: Hello Ms. Victoria B  Thank you for your candid response. It was our pleasure to serve you and we look forward to be here for you on your next stay.  Guest Relations Ambassador  Franklin Atonya

Summary: Needs minor updating some of the night staff is rude and do not follow up on simple requests. The hot tub hasn't worked the past 3 trips and the towels for the pool are always out and asking for extra towels/hangers etc is next to impossible. I get better service leaving a note for housekeeping who does a great job over some of the 'managers'...and they are mostly the ones at night who are rude and dismissive to guests. The younger staff seem always eager and polite but some of the older managers can't be bothered at all it seems.
Manager Response: Good Morning Ms. Christine K,  Thank you so much for your candid feedback. It is our responsibility to ensure that our guests are treated with great care. It hurts me to read of your experience during your stay with us. I apologize on behalf of my staff for the inconvenience of customer service that you received during your stay. I will personally make an effort to ensure I follow up with this that is doesn't happen again.  Please fell free to call the desk directly and ask for me during your future stay. I will make it my responsibility to ensure your next stay is comfortable for you.  Guest Relations Ambassador Franklin Atonys

Summary: Staff is friendly and overall place is clean. Just needs to get rid of carpet in the entire hotel and replace with vinyl, wood floors or carpet. They look and smell of dirt, mildew and musk. There is a train on the back side, but barely runs through the night, was able to sleep through it.

Summary Heading: Unique La Quinta Stay, With A Few Wrinkles
Summary: I stayed here last night. Big plus LaQuinta is dog friendly. This location is pretty unique in that the building we stayed in was an old grain silo in a historic building. This was nice and the cement walls and other historic touches made it nice. What was not was that the rooms on the back of the building are adjacent to train tracks, super close, within a few yards. The sound is very loud. So if you want a more restful night and and improved stay I would opt for a room that faces the parking lot. That is the major thing pulling my review down to average. Another comment I will throw out and this applies to most hotels in this range, ie Best Western why it it so hard to make fixes in the room to improve aesthetics. The TV in our room was on a dresser with a black top it was

If you stay here make sure you stay in the newer portion of the hotel. The old hotel is apparently made of cheap cardboard as you can hear everything in the surrounding rooms.  This is an issue when, as it happened on our stay, someone throws a huge party until 4 am.  Manager did reduce the bill but even with that discount I still wish I stayed elsewhere.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to express your concerns regarding the experience that you encountered during a recent stay at our location. We are very sorry that you had such a negative experience while staying with us.  Rest assured that your comments are taken to heart and we will do everything we can to improve. Thank you for sharing with us.

Summary: There was a leaf blower being used below my window both mornings of my stay.  It went on for a half hour or more both days.  I work nights so was very unhappy to have my sleep disturbed.  The first morning the person that answered the phone said they would talk with the person using the leaf blower.  They did and the person finally stopped.  The second time I was told that there was nothing they could do.    When I checked in after a very long drive I asked about getting the best rate.  The person that checked me in did not mention either the AAA rate or the government rate.  The next day I was on the website and I noticed these.  When I called to have these applied to my account the manager said she could not do so for the first day because my payment had already been posted.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  This is definitely not the kind of experience we want our guests to have.  I'm so sorry about the issues you encountered with the noise and the billing. I hope you will allow us an opportunity to redeem ourselves should your future travels find you in the area again.

Summary: The refrigerator is not working so I informed the front desk for the problem. There were no replacement nor change of the room. So we paid the price and stayed with the broken refrigerator. The manager refused to give us discount on this even though the refrigerator is broken. So basically, we were forced to stay for the broken refrigerator room with the full price since no refundable for cancellation. Definitely a bad experience, and is NOT going to return back to this hotel.
Manager Response: Hello, I apologize for the inconvenience with all that you went through on your recent visit with us. We do value your trips to LQ as well as your feedback. This will be taken care of looked in to.  Guest Relations Team

Summary Heading: Always a nice place to stay
Summary: I've been staying at this place many times on business and its always been a great place to stay. There rooms are always clean and amenities are good. There are restaurants near by and the staff there is always nice. Thanks LQ!

Summary Heading: Room not clean , cat order, sleep with window open
Summary: Go to Costa Mesa La Quinta , much cleaner hotel with better breafast.  Staff more helpful. My room had a terrible odor and the bathroom was not clean.  I did not even shower in the morning , afraid to use the shower.  If you like cold breafast they have it , but no eggs or meat.   Like I said try the Costa Mesa La Quinta it is much nicer the rooms always clean and the breafast and breafast area is much nice.  The cost is the same.

Room had sand on the bed and sand all over the windowsill and air conditioner.  Obviously not cleaned and the bed not made after someone was there.  There was urine and a pubic hair on the toilet seat.  Not cleaned either.  The hotel is falling apart with very old furnishings, bathrooms,etc  I would not  stay here again!Train runs by all day and night which shakes the building like an earthquake.

Summary Heading: Not Always A Negative Review. (GOLD MEMBER REVIEW.. FYI)
Summary: We just want to say, "THANK YOU!" on behalf of my Family. To the staff member whom ignored policy. Removed the excuse that would have allowed him to give poor customer service. He simply said, "come on in, you have a couple minutes before breakfast is over." I did not get his name. however he worked on the morning of 9-26-16 in the breakfast area.   We were extremely pleased.. even knowing there wasn't much food to choose from. The consideration on his part meant more to me and the family. Thank you again.    His actions were well  deserving of a positive review. We went about our day at Disneyland. Just note: I live in southern Cali and chose to stay here to avoid the drive or any closer hotel to the resort. Wife and I had recently stayed at this hotel to attend a concert. back

Perfect for pet owners, close to many amenities in Irvine, friendly staff.  I always stay here when I visit.  Continental Breakfast, cable TV and comfortable beds.   Bring your own waste bags for your pets if you stay here as they don't always have available.  There is a Denny's next to it, gas station, Jack in the Box and restaurant.

We are familar with this site of an historic barley and bean grainery. They converted the property into a unique hotel. The local historic society required certain elements to remain and so the property has some rustic features that make it interesting. The hotel is maintained well and the rooms were clean. Staff was very pleasant and efficient. Though the breakfast was minimal, there is a chain restaurant and a locally favorite hamburger restaurant adjacent to this property. I would suggest asking for a "silo" room, the room we had was very quiet. To clear one thing up, it is not a single silo, but a a group of approximately 36 hexagonal silos laid out in a honeycomb manner.

_Clean room and comfortable beds. _The parking could use and ground could use a little more up keep. _ Need a little bit better security and lighting, especially the back lot. Other than that, This seems to be a good value.

Summary Heading: Terrible customer service, don't go if you like to sleep
Summary: Check in was a nightmare. I had just driven 6 hours from Phoenix after working since 7am and I was exhausted so I was not in the mood.  I was originally sent to a room which was apparently someone else's. They were not in the room but their stuff was. Good thing I don't have criminal tendencies, but then I thought, what if the situation was reversed and some stranger accidentally checked in my room when I wasn't there or came when I was un presentable. Not good. The second room I was placed in smelled of cigarette smoke which was not good since I have asthma and had to cycle 100 miles the next day. The receptionist seemed flustered then told me there's nothing they could do since they were all sold out. Told her when I made reservations I did not agree to a smoke filled room.

the hotel is clean, reasonably priced and very well located. wi-fi, light breakfast a couple of pluses...  i've stayed many times and always enjoy coming back. if you are a light sleeper stay on the 'non-train' side.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to give us feedback. The trains can be very tough. I will share your comments with my team.  Thank you,  Hotel Manager

Summary: This hotel is OK.  Everyone was very nice.  I was not impressed with cleaning of the room.  I also didn't like that there wasn't a caf√© on site.  I usually stay at a Marriott Courtyard which always has a caf√© and a snack area.  After a long day of work I like to be able to relax at the hotel and not have to drive around looking for a place to eat - or if I want a late night snack having to drive somewhere to get it.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to give us feedback! I will bring up your comments on the cleanliness in my team meeting in the morning.  I wish I had the ability to have caf√© on site also....very cool idea.  Regards,  Hotel Manager

Summary Heading: Good Enough for a Short Stay
Summary: The rooms are fine and the staff friendly. Make sure you ask for a quiet room and use the earplugs (property right by train tracks). Security sweep after hours would be nice to keep others guests from loitering and holding conversations outside of their rooms.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to give us feedback! I understand your thoughts on guests walking around at night. I will work with my team and see what we can do. Hope to see you soon!  Regards,  Hotel Manager

Summary Heading: My New Home Away From Home!
Summary: I stayed here for almost 2 weeks already and I am still happy with this place. Trust me, I would love for the carpets to be cleaner and there were no pets allowed unless in designated areas, but the fact that the staff like Freddy greets me and my family with a smile whenever we go to breakfast or wash clothes or just running another errand, I feel welcome and you don't get that from some of the other hotels I have stayed at in the past. Which also shows me that their employees must be happy there because I never see them bickering only helping one another out. God knows they never get paid their worth and the heat and long hours kill them slowly, but yet they are eager to make my stay here as best as possible. Also, I like the breakfast that is served every morning and it
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to give us feed back.  I will share with my team over the weekend.  Freddy will be happy to hear your comments.  Thank you,  Hotel Manager

Summary: We had to be switched (by our request) to different rooms THREE times the day we checked in. Room #1 had a heavy stench of smoke, the carpet in room #2 was soaking wet (sloshed when we walked on it, not knowing it was wet) and the nauseating odor of mold and mildew. There must have been a plumbing leak that caused flooding for the carpet to be that wet and it must have been there for some time to cause the mold/mildew odor that hit us as soon as we opened the door. Room #3 also had a strange, peculiar odor and the toilet backed up the first time it was used. It is a mystery how housekeeping would not have reported these conditions, unless no one had been in or checked the rooms for some time prior to them being assigned. We have been in better accomodations wilderness camping

Summary Heading: LOUD trains all night and incompetent staff.
Summary: Stayed here because I didn't want to drive home after a concert at the Spectrum.  Cute little hotel but LOUD because of the train.  There is nothing comforting about feeling like a train is about to run you over ... many times a night.  For $148 a night it was such a rip off.  I wish I picked a different hotel but lesson learned.  Maybe it is the look they are going for, but the place looks unfinished as far as construction.  If you have a different choice I would go with a hotel away from the railroad tracks.  ALSO, the front desk staff, even though very nice, was poorly trained and did not know how to handle my transaction and ended up charging me twice.  Then it took at least half hour for them to figure out how to reverse the charge and give me a receipt.  I usually don't
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Yes we are a historic building and can not paint the walls. The trains can be tough in the summer as their schedule varies all during the day and night.  I am sorry you did not enjoy your stay.  Hotel Manager

Summary: Very poor experience. The location is far from anywhere and no local places to walk to. Inattentive staff and poor room states. I had stayed at other La Quinta locations and always enjoyed it. I had never stayed at this one before and it was very disappointing.

My daughtr and I were in town for here orientation at UC Irvine for 4 days. We had stayed in town three other times at hotel Irvine but went with La Quinta for the value. The room and amentities were average and thats what I expected. BUT what made the stay GREAT was Patricia, Freddy, and Sara at the front counter.  Freddy could make anything happen, Sarah with the warm welcome and smile. But Patricia going above and behind with her making fresh sqeezed orange juice for my daughter. Cant get that at hotel Irvine...thank you for making the stay great with a personal touch.  I cant forget the crew also found my daughter's school ID  and they are going to mail it to us...thank you again La Quinta family
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Wow, I will share with my staff! and do something special for each one you mentioned. Thank you for sharing your comments.  Best,  Hotel Manager

Summary: Housed in old granary. Lots of concrete and metal and wood. Love this place. There is a high speed commuter rail that sits next to the hotel. Windows are double insulated and we barely heard the trains. Wasn't enough to disturb sleep and decor is very well done. Was very awesome place to stay.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for your feedback..........Its an awesome historic building!!  Best,  Hotel Manager

Summary: This hotel is an old grain warehouse and is on the historical registry. The concrete walls keep out noise from the neighbors. the carpets and floors are unclean and the hotel in the back feels dark, dirty, and dank. We left very early, but my room had not been cleaned by 3:00 pm. The manager said they had been very busy. They also did not clean up a breakfast that had been thrown by the back door in the morning. Don't forget to ask about the train.
Manager Response: Dear Don M,  Thank you for taking the time to give me and my team feedback. I will use this review in my morning meeting tomorrow so we may brainstorm on some ideas.  I am sorry you did not have a great stay. We will work on these issues.  Thank you,  Hotel Manager

Summary: We stayed here for one night, and thank God that it was only one.  I should have known I was in for something when the reception desk handed me earplugs.  I thought perhaps it was due to the proximity of the highway..but I found out the true reason 15 min after arriving and every 30 min after that.  The train tracks are literally 10 feet from the rooms and they run all night long.  On top of this the bathroom was dirty, we had to move nightstand to plug in the lamp, and we had to fetch tissues & toilet paper from the front desk ourselves (they actually told us to hold on the phone for a min so they could check if they had supplies available).    I usually don't write reviews but in this case I feel compelled because people need to know how bad this place is. I know the price was

I transferred to this hotel after an unsatisfactory stay elsewhere and was very pleased with decision.  First week stayed in the two-story building which was noisy from freeway but second week, stayed in 4 story building which is concrete-walled and NO traffic noise.  Front desk staff very friendly and attentive.

I just wanted to say thank you for hiring the best workers out there. Brendon and Diamond made sure my trip was worth while and made sure j was comfortable and my room was clean and I am really happy for the great service. I will definitely book a room with you guys again!
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to give feedback about our team!  I will make sure to share this with them this morning!  See you soon!  Manager

Summary: I have stayed at a few La Quinta hotels over the course of the past year. This time was no different from the last. The room was clean, the check-in process was simple, and the staff at the front desk were very friendly and a pleasure to interact with.

I read some unfavorable reviews of this hotel before booking but decided to go ahead and give it a try as it was affordable and available. I was pleased with my stay and had no problems. The rooms are comfortable and clean. Didn't take advantage of the breakfast or any other amenities.

Summary Heading: So bad it was almost Comical!!! Trains, Trains and more Trains
Summary: I travel for a living and so I have a lot of hotel experience. I knew that there would be comprises with hotel being the last inexpensive room available in the area for a short notice trip. I just reminded myself it was just one night. We were first given a room with wet floors. Second trip dragging our bags back to the lobby yielded a room that was barely clean enough to be acceptable but had a tobacco smoke odor. The property was not bad a little run down but staff was friendly and apologetic. Everything went down hill when we went to sleep. High speed trains passed outside our windows all night. The bed shook as they passed outside and the tracks are just 10 ft away!  No sleep at all...  People should be warned before they make this Non refundable reservation.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  I am sorry that the trains kept you up at night. They can be tough depending on their schedule. I will share your feedback with my team.  Thank you,

Summary: This hotel is clean and better than I expected from a La Quinta. Comfortable beds and quiet for being close to the  Freeway with a couple of restaurants in walking distance. Free cold breakfast. Good coffee
Manager Response: Dear William,  Thank you for your feedback.  I am going to share your review in my team huddle this am.  Thank you,  Hotel Manager

Summary Heading: They had a year to get better
Summary: We stayed for a Lacrosse tournament in 2015, it was just average then.  I left comments, and thought it may get better.  They actually have gotten worse.  While the room was clean, all common/outside areas were filthy.  Breakfast was a joke, nothing hot or fresh.  Also, there is a train that is less than 40 yards from West facing rooms.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to give the hotel feedback.  I will share your information with my team today.  We will continue to make things better.  Thank you,  Hotel Manager

Summary: Very nice hotel. Clean and the beds comfortable and roomy. I only stay in the suites that face the parking lot. Would not be able to sleep if in a room on the train side. I have been going here for years with my family. We like the  easy access to and from car. Pool and breakfast was very nice.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to leave the hotel some great feedback!  I will make sure to share with my team!  Thank you.  Manager

Summary Heading: not likely to stay at La Quinita
Summary: As a frequent traveller, I have known about La Quinta for many years.  Upon entering my room I immediately noticed a empty water container on the floor under the desk. I thought "if the maid did not notice it how well did they clean the room?".   Having a hotel just a few feet from two train track which have trains running all night was a stupid ideal.  Not only will i never stay at this La Quinta location I doubt I will ever stay at another.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback! I will get with our Housekeeping team to address your concern. We hope that you provide us another opportunity to right our wrongs.

Summary Heading: Not as nice as it use to be.
Summary: We have been staying at this hotel 2-3 times a year for almost 10 years now. This was probably our last due to the state of the rooms and staff that are unknowledgeable. We have liked it for the character of the rooms in the silo building and until now, rooms were clean and comfortable.  When we checked in the front desk lady didn't seem to know much about the property. She couldn't answer simple questions like "how often dose the train go by?" Not a huge deal. Got to our room and it seemed fine at first, but their was food left in the fridge and the bathtub was gross dirty, dingy, chipped and cracked. I asked for a new room. This one was better, the tube was still gross, but at least I'd didn't have chunks missing out of it. But when we got back that night I noticed that the
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback! Rest assured your comments will be used as a training tool, so that we can educate our employees on our historic location.

Summary: La Quinta allows you to bring your dogs at no extra charge so even if we don't have our dogs with us we try to stay at a La Quinta if it`s in a location near where we want to be to support them.   Nice hotels at a reasonable price.  Convenient location.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  I also have a dog and find La Quinta is a great place for pets!  I will share your comments with my team!  Thank you,  Hotel Manager

Summary: Linens on pull out couch were not clean, had not been changed. There were no pillows for this bed either. Night staff not compassionate about this issue. Although the hotel is unique in design and has history the quality for the price does not work.

Recently had the chance to experience this hotel. Chose the hotel because of their pet-friendly reputation. The locations and accommodations were excellent. The bed was incredible and the area was safe- the parking lot was even patrolled by the Irvine Police department (not an independent security group). Would definitely stay again!
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Yes, we have a great relationship with Irvine PD. We are a team.  I will make sure to share your thoughts with my team!!  Thank you,  Hotel Manager

Summary: Had a great stay at La Quinta (Old Historic Site) in Irvine. Friendly staff, good price, great room and accessible to I-5 and I-405.  My dog loves this place as they have green areas that are pet friendly.  The size of the room was above average, the pool was clean and perfect for a warm day!
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  My dog "Indy" loves staying at La Quinta's also...Glad you got to enjoy the pool!  See you soon!!  Hotel Manager

Summary: We had the wonderful experience of staying in the Silo (La Quinta's Old Town restoration project.  Unique, quiet and just plain interesting...a most enjoyable experience The location was perfect for our side trip north, as well as a service we attended
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for your awesome feedback!!  The Silo is so cool!  Great story!!  Best,  Hotel Manager

Summary: We stayed there for 3 nights.We were placed on the back building where the old granary was built on a two full beds and a sofa bed.Amenities are pool which I was able to use, a gym, a breakfast area for free breakfast that includes hard boiled eggs, waffle maker, tea, coffee, milk , apple and orange juice, cereals, bread and bagels with muffins, oranges and apples and yogurts. They have a quite big breakfast area. Overall I can say for the price and location (being near the Irvine Spectrum Mall) It's on the average.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to share comments on your last stay with us. I will make sure to share your feedback with my team!  Thank you,  Hotel Manager

Summary: For the price, I usually find that La Quinta hotels are the best value. This one is unique, being built in the silos. The silo rooms look new and fresh. They are rounded and have a nice modern design. The regular rooms are a bit older and run-down. Overall, what I usually care about most is comfort and cleanliness. I usually never have a problem with that at this hotel. The beds are always comfortable at la Quinta. The only complaint about this hotel is the train that passes by every so often during the day. If you are trying to sleep in the day, do not get a room on the "train side" of the hotel. It's very loud. Other than that, this hotel is great and the customer service has always been top notch. I always feel taken care of by the staff here.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience!  I will make sure to share with my team!!  Thank you,  Hotel Manager

Summary: This place is old and in bad need of a refresh. I tried the silo room but it was within 20 feet of a very busy train track. Luckily I got moved to another room which is quieter but is also right next to I 5. This place is kind of a dump. Tub is rusty. Countertop has caulking dried up all over it. Some of the outlets don't work. Would not recommend
Manager Response: I‚Äôve received your review of La Quinta Orange County - Irvine Spectrum (Old Historic Site). Looks like we dropped the ball on meeting your expectations.   I appreciate your feedback; this is definitely not the experience we want you to have when staying with us! Your feedback will help us improve our operation.   Rest assured your comments will be shared with our team, and it‚Äôs through comments such as yours that we‚Äôre able to improve. Thanks again for your time, and hope we‚Äôll see you back with us at La Quinta Inn and Suites once again.   Sincerely,

Summary: Hotel needs renovation. I stayed here with my parents and our stay was worst than Motel 6. I booked this hotel because I saw nice renovated rooms online while booking. When we got our room, it was old. Curtains were torn, sink and bathtub were so dirty. Sink water flow was very slow. When I turned on the bathroom light, light bulb blew out. Bathtub was so black and dirty. When I asked for better room, of course I didn't get one. According to the price I paid, room was worst. I do not recommend this hotel until they fully renovate everything. Front desk staff wasn't friendly at all. Wi-fi was very slow.
Manager Response: Wow! It really sounds like we dropped the ball on this one. I'm sorry that you were unhappy while staying with us. I would like to speak directly to you about this. Would you please email me at lq0663gm@laquinta.com? I look forward to hearing from you. Sincerely, La Quinta Customer Care Team

Summary: Nice hotel near the train and old grain towers. Very architectually interesting room. Clean. Comfortable. Affordable for the area. Close to the highway. Pet friendly. We slept on the "quiet side" We have heard the train side can get loud. We heard nothing. Perfectly quiet.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback! We share your appreciation for the architecturally-interesting layout of our historic silo building. We hope t see you again in the near future!

Summary Heading: Average yet unique. Warn your kids! Great customer service.
Summary: The good and the bad from my opinion.  Based on reviews I read here I asked for a silo room, high floor, away from the tracks.  Even though our room was on the first floor, the location was fine (especially with our dog) and I only heard a "choo choo" once - no rumbling or any train noise.  Sure, our view was of the parking lot, but that's basically what I asked for, ha! I was excited to stay in a silo room, it was large, (2 doubles plus a pull out sofa) but my family was horrified at the silo idea...?  My teenage daughters said they felt like they were in a prison cell or a psych ward.  oops!  I guess I should have warned them.  I thought it was fine - a unique and hip experience, but...they did not.  The bathroom tile needs to be cleaned, and/or updated. Two of our lights were
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback! I'm so glad we reunited your daughter with her ring! We hope to see you again in the near future!

Summary: I use to live in Irvine and this was always a hotel I wanted to stay at.  It's very unique with the grain cylo conversion, but value rooms are located in a separate building on site (just FYI). Hotel is showing some signs of it's age.  It is conveniently located just off of I-5 and close to shopping (Spectrum) and many restaurants.  The free breakfast was pretty decent, but had minimal choices.  This would be a good option if you want to save a few dollars and get out of Anaheim but still close to Disneyland.

extremely noisy due to trains, sounded like they passed through our room every 30 minutes until the middle of the night!!!!!! DID NOT GET ANY SLEEP ALL NIGHT!!!!!! Was never told when booking that the trains were extremely noisy and was laughed at when we complained the next morning to front desk.
Manager Response: We sincerely regret the disturbance.  Our location can mean extra noise activity, as much as we try to contain it.  But mostly we regret that we were unable to resolve the issue to your satisfaction while staying with us. I will share your review with our management and front desk staff.  Thanks,  LQ Customer Care

Summary Heading: IF YOU WANT NOT SLEEP TRY IT !!!!!!
Summary: the place is a old warehouse , the train runs all night and shakes the place it's crazy!!!the only thing was okay was the housekeeping and lobby breakfast ,thats it everything esle is  terrible!!! the pool is clean
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  We sincerely regret the disturbance.  Our location can mean extra noise activity, as much as we try to contain it.  But mostly we regret that we were unable to resolve the issue to your satisfaction while staying with us.  I hope that you will consider giving us another opportunity.   Thanks,  LQ Customer Care

Summary: Room service was good , had a great night with my girl friend on my trip , the beds were really comfortable and the breakfast in the morning was very good an good customer service ! I was very satisfied

I have always found La Quinta to be a very good hotel to stay at.  The accessible rooms work well for my wife and our dog is comfortable.  The LQ online reservation system does not work well, as it nearly always tells me that my information is incorrect ... so, I must remember to show my Elite status card at the desk to assure that I get my reward points.

This hotel is unique. I remember them building it from the  old Silos when I lived here an pass by the freeway going to college. It is a great location to hop a shutle form JW airport, visit friends and family and have friends and family drop by from the 5 and 405 freeways on their way home form work, especially if I do not rent a car. You have to try it at least once.

This hotel is an old Lima Bean silo!  They have interesting photos in the lobby of the silo. Some of the walls are cut cement, about 3 inches thick.  Very interesting!  The pool was nice, hot tub works, we had a big room and king size bed and felt like part owners.  They treated us well and we thoroughly enjoyed the stay.  Denny's and Burger-Place next to the hotel. Between the freeway and the railroad, but there was no noise problem.

This hotel is a converted bean and grain warehouse.The outside still loos like a  old warehouse but it has been converted to a hotel. It has four floors and an elevator. This is a very basic place to stay but the week day prices are much less then most Irvine hotels. I can only speak for the room I stayed in. No fancy stuff but clean and quiet. A word of caution. Ask for a room facing the front parking lot. If you get a room on the other side you will be next to the train tracks and no peaceful night sleep for you.Breakfast is included which is just enough to get you started. If you need more there is a Denny's right next door. Not bad for the price if you desire only basic lodging.

This hotel is one of the most interesting you will find in this price range!  It has rooms in converted silos - very cool.  The location is right next to a railroad so there is some sound ... even through the concrete walls.

There are 2 parts to this hotel : 1 -a traditional La Quinta, the second part of the Hotel is built in an old grain elevator. The rooms have a unique honeycomb arrangement and shape with concrete walls. Really adds some flavor. Be sure to request a room on the opposite side of the railroad tracks- trains do go past and often but you can barely hear . Conveniently located near Irvine spectrum and freeways

Summary Heading: Rooms are very depressing & dingy looking
Summary: If you like staying in a concrete room than this is the place for you.  The rooms had an odor as well as the hallway when you first get off the elevator.  The rooms are so small & depressing not worth the !$ 109.00 & $125.00 a night depending on the nights you are staying there & the availability.  When my daughter & her husband went to check in they ran her debit card without asking if that was the card they wanted to use. I would not recommend this hotel.

If I could give this hotel a zero I would. I have stayed at maybe 10 other La Quinta hotels in the US. This was by far the worst. The La Quinta chain is not upscale but this one wasn't even on the scale! Stay only if the alternative is sleeping in the car. Everything is out dated and worn out. I'd hate to think what color the carpets were when they were new. Bathtub floor was black! Carpets falling apart. Filthy windows. Saggy mattresses. Old sheets. Really, avoid at all costs. La Quinta has one of the best pet policies of any hotel chain but I wouldn't even want my dog to stay here. At the AARP weekly rate of $95/night it was very overpriced for the quality. Cleaning only twice per week at the weekly rate. Cleaning consisted of changing the towels and making the bed, not even

Filthy, in very poor condition. Breakfast was just barely anything. Waffles, bagels, cereal, unripened bananas, etc. Once was enough. Go out! Room conditions poor. Not clean at all. Weekly AARP rate we got was $95/night but they "clean" only twice. Cleaning meant making the bed and changing the towels. Nothing else. Please, stay elsewhere!

We ended up in the "regular" building and were disappointed in the rooms.  They are older and need some refurbishment.  The historical cement building rooms are awesome.  They are large and in much better shape  building.  Hence the lower rating, since this stay was for the older room.

This is a little older older establishment despite this fact.  The room were clean.  Housekeeping was great in responding to us, e.g. when we needed more towels.  Our stay (3 nights) was both comfortable, quiet, and restful. It is by a train track but we hardly notice it.  We would not hesitate to stay here again.

After a very long day my family was ready for bed. When we checked in the clerk was pleasant, but that was the only good thing about this hotel. When we entered it smelled horrible,  like it used to be smoking room and they sprayed perfume to cover it up.  The floors had stains all over.  I went to put kids in bed, the top comforter had stains.  Ok, I just wanted a shower, nope.  It was disgusting. The bathtub was right, but the floor of tub was stained a nasty brown. It looked so gross didnt shower.  Beds are old. Freeway is right there and it is super noisy all night, especially with the gap in the door. So 6 hours later with little sleep we had some cereal, and a muffin. Other LaQuintas I have been to had eggs, and bisquits and gravy. Not here. This hotel needs updates bad. I

This is a great hotel. I have been having som many great experiences staying at La Quinta Inn in all my travels that I decided to become a member.  It is a pet friendly hotel and its staff is always very friendly and attentive to all my requests.  Clean rooms, easy check in and always good locations near my travel business needs.

Summary Heading: Great staff at an Inn that needs renovations
Summary: We have stayed here several times in the past, always in the Silo rooms. Our stays with children have always been enjoyable. This trip I reserved a Silo room, and when we checked in found it had no refrigerator or microwave. I called the front desk and Tim relocated us to Room 108 in the other building. Had I known about the problems there I would have stayed in the first room. Room 108 is an ADA Room that is located in between the the front lobby and the Housekeeping area. The noise level in the room was so high from outside that I thought it was because our window was wide open. As it turned out, there was a significant gap all the way around the outside of the door on the top, bottom, and sides, so much so that it brought in all the noise from outside just as if the door was

We have stayed here before, but this trip was unbelievably bad experience... When we turned down our bed, we found long black hairs and pubes... YUCK!!! My wife is blonde and I have a shaved head, do the math... The front desk said they had no housekeeping staff to take care of the problem, could they get back to us about it... Seriously???  While we waited for someone to come change the bed, I noticed someone had tied a plastic bag over the smoke detector!!! That is a criminal offense and a very dangerous thing... Two maintenance men showed up to change the bed... Neither spoke English... When I showed them the smoke alarm, they went and got me batteries... Seriously???  I'm not even going to mention the trains... ooops... Very sad business fail in every way...

We got to stay in the old part of the hotel and absolutely loved it. The staff is amazing. Last night we were greeted by Ron and he was very courteous and helpful. This AM we checked out with Clarissa and Amanda once again they were amazing. Would stay here again.

Great hotel, always quiet and peaceful, staff is always very friendly. I love to stay in the "grainery" rooms where the walls are unpainted concrete. Maybe the thick concrete walls contribute to how quite it is but it's great!

We stayed here for one night for my wife and my "date night" get away. It was priced quite a bit better than the Best Western type hotels in area and our budget was a bit tight so we thought we would try it. I agree with many of the other reviews that it is a bit dated. Room had a slight musty smell and the water faucet on bath/shower was hard to turn on and off. At first I told my wife I wouldn't stay here again but after our stay I thought for the price, I would consider it again. We got a "free upgrade" according to guy at the front desk when we checked in and our room was 3rd floor at the front of the hotel. We were prepared for the train noise which we were warned about ahead of time but in our front room we didn't hear the trains at all. Breakfast was better than some but

We always stay in the silo part of this La Quinta Inn. We have always had pleasant stay, with a nourishing breakfast to start the day, a very courteous staff and a well kept up buildings and grounds. If you are in the area, I would recommend this La Quinta Inn highly.

Summary Heading: Not what I expected from La Quinta
Summary: This hotel looks run down. When we got to our room there upon opening the door there was a bit of a stale odor in the room. I did not call front desk due to us arriving late and my choke being tired. When we woke up in the morning to shower the tub was visibly dirty I was able to rub my finger inside of it and clean it which was a sign the tub hadn't been cleaned properly. All in all I was less then pleased and I've stayed at la Quinta before. I would not recommend this place to anyone staying in Irvine

My first time staying in California and this was my hotel. Most of stay was okay minus the train going by my room window ALL NIGHT. I thought it was an earthquake originally! The location was good apart from that. I would recommend if you are desperate

Stayed at this hotel while looking at area colleges for my daughter and also attending a family baby shower. Was a great location and the service was very nice. Room was clean and breakfast was included.

Homerun hotel!  I love this hotel!  The staff is wonderful! There seems to be so many return guests that everyone knows each other and all these people couldn't be wrong.  I love this place! Oscar Romero puts the "bright" in bright side! If you don't know about the train by the Silo building and it bothers you, just ask for the other building.  Many people come here for that train and the nostalgia it brings.  If you are not one of those guests just ask for a different room.  They are more than accommodating. The staff is worth it and the breakfast is awesome! The pool is always clean and the new kitchen remodel was done in an incredibly fast rate of time and the builders blended in like nothing was going on.  Thank you La Quinta Irvine Spectrum for a human kindness that is

Summary Heading: Good Hotel if you need to be in Irivine on the cheap
Summary: Free Internet, relatively new rooms & spacious rooms, comfy beds. Clean and quiet if you make sure to get a room away from the train side.  I also like the styling of the new wing.  Breakfast was included, didn't try it.  A nice touch was a trolly next to the elevator to help you move your stuff from the car. Free Parking also.

Great hotel and perfect location for our family visits. The grain silo rooms are fun. The staff is friendly and do there best to accommodate us. Usually stay once a year. We appreciate all the help to make my fathers 80th birthday a great one.

Summary Heading: Only hotel I'd recommend in Irvine
Summary: We actually live in Irvine and fairly close to this hotel. Whenever we have a special occasion we try to stay a night at La Quinta. We adore the round rooms and the look of the old silo. The beds are extremely comfy, and breakfast is alright! Its location can't be beat. Its right next to everything and the freeway.

I have numerous stays at this property and have always found the staff to be efficient, friendly, and responsive.  The property is in need of some attention (could use a good cleaning & painting) but, it is clean and comfortable. It is very unique as how they used a 'historical' facility and made it into a very useful Hotel.  You get to sleep in a round silo room!

Summary Heading: Not very appealing and can use customer service training
Summary: The second building is secluded from the front and the inside of the second building is not very appealing . The better room allocation is a matter of luck . I also ended up losing something on the stay , definitely an inconvenience and no one reached out to assist . The front desk could use some customer service training . It was quite an experience to stay here .

Summary Heading: Train tracks & Passing Trains Only Steps Away!
Summary: We arrived late due to weather and found our room had been given to a complaining guest then given the exact kind of room the guest had complained of without having been advised of the acute nature of the problem, that of trains passing by only steps away throughout the day and night.  There are non "train side" rooms that are probably fine but I would not take a chance, given my experience.
Manager Response: Thanks for sharing your experiences at Our La Quinta Irvine Hotel. We appreciate you taking the time to post your comments about your stay, and we are sorry you did not get a great nights sleep with us. We'll be working with our team to make sure they are informing guest that have booked on the train side, about the noise upon check in. We want all of our guest to have a great nights sleep when staying with us and we're hoping you'll come back and give us another try.

Summary: This hotel was great for the price. It was very clean and the housekeeping came in every day to make beds and replace towels. The only thing I did not like was the breakfast. It was very limited and did not appeal to our family.

Summary Heading: Improvement under way, subsequent stay went well
Summary: This LaQuinta is really close to family in the area and is preferred. We have stayed here before, yet found the property not up to speed. Took a chance over the holidays and improvements are nearing completion. This trip we stayed in the "silo". Frankly, these rooms are nice. We were on the I-5 side, not the railroad track side. We heard highway noise, but not one train. So slept well. Concrete wall decrease the decibels it appears.  The only drawback this trip is the breakfast room. It was really crowded, no place to sit, with quality and quantity lacking. One day we just went to Denny's next store. However, a new breakfast room is being completed in two weeks by the hotel lobby. Much larger. Management has heard the critiques! Due to this we made a reservation for our next

I want to give a better review because the staff was so pleasant and helpful, and it's such a unique property. The rooms appeared clean but the fixtures are worn and could use freshening. The first room we were assigned smelled of smoke and poop. We asked for a different room and the desk staff was very apologetic and accommodating. The second room was better but during the night we discovered the bathroom had a sewer smell. It was OK if we kept the bathroom door shut. Since we had our cats with us, who were settling in, we didn't ask to be relocated a second time.   The breakfast options were sparse but it's included in the price of the room.

Our 5th time staying here for the Xmas season.  Usually we stay in the silos but this time opted for the other side on 3rd floor.  Much quieter.  Consistently good stay. The silo rooms are huge but even this one in the building is pretty large.  Breakfast is yummy.

Had a concert at the Coach house so rented a room wow alittle bit of Irvine history what a surprise! Bean and grain mill converted to a fabulous hotel. Silos have the rooms around it even echoes. the concrete from silos still decorate the walls little but of history in each room what a gem and beds comfortable rooms clean! Staff very friendly and even let us check in early.

I've stayed in other La Quinta properties in different locations, and have found that they are a good value in services provided. Not so with this location!!!   A dirty bathroom (fecal matter? smeared on floor and side of the bathtub) and a Motel 6 style breakfast is what you'll get if you stay in this property. Wedged in between the Interstate 5 and the Metro train tracks, hardly a restful night.   Avoid at all costs!!!
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback regarding your stay at our La Quinta Inn & Suites Irvine. We're very concerned about the issues you've mentioned and are sorry that we dropped the ball as we did during your stay. You should expect a room that is clean and well taken care of, and  we failed you here. We're very sorry and we'd like to chat with you further about your specific situation. Would you reach out to us at lq0663gm@lqreviews.com. Thanks again for your review, and we're looking forward to chatting with you soon.

Summary: Business travel on  tight budget might consider this for Irvine Area however cleanliness and breakfast have opportunities to improve. Make sure you ask to stay away from any "pet friendly" rooms. Have stayed at better and worse La Quinta Inns. The franchise needs to be more consistent in their execution.

Dirty bathrooms, air conditioner/heater not working nor repaired when reported.  Call center misrepresented the type of rooms available, so room booked on misleading information resulting in additional costs.

One of the buildings is an old, converted grain silo.  The only parts really left are the concrete silos, which are where the rooms are located.  So your walls are 6" think concrete!  To me this is cool and give the room a unique feel.  The rooms themselves are relatively modern and clean, as are the common areas.  Service was polite and helpful.  The exterior is not always amazing. Two restaurants across the parking lot, a Denny's and another spot that is great for casual dining.  One fast food across the street.  I have stayed here a few times and no complaints.  Close to the freeway and between south and central OC.

Room was not clean, bathroom floor was dirty, the duvet cover was dirty. Light bulb missing from lamp over nightstand, requested a new one and never received it. Not enough tables and chairs in the breakfast area.

Summary Heading: Good value for a nearby event
Summary: I chose this property for its proximity to an event I had tickets for, and although it needs a few "millennial" upgrades, knowing the property a bit better helps the room choice.   Not a bad place to stay... The staff is first rate and seeks to help at every corner.

My beautiful 42 year old daughter passed away suddenly in CA.  My husband and I had to travel to CA to make funeral arrangements and attend to business related to her death.  This La Quinta was conveniently located to where we needed to be.  The nice lady that cleaned our room, Sylvia, always made sure to clean our room first so we could leave our doggies and then go take take care of the many sad details that we had to do.  The front office staff was also most accommodating.  This La Quinta was also a quiet place where I could try to regroup.  Thank you to everyone at La Quinta who helped us through this most difficult time.

Summary Heading: Excellent! Excellent!  Excellent! Love all of the staff!
Summary: What a pleasant surprise for our first stay at La Quinta.  If you stay here you will feel welcomed and like family.  Thank you Oscar (George) and Patti for the wonderful conversations and breakfast!  John, Justin, David, Amanda, housekeeping and maintenance employees were absolutely fantastic!  They have a Gym in the basement that is clean, private, very climate controlled  with everything you need for your workout.  The pool was always spotless! The people made the place feel like home.  Thank you again!

Summary Heading: Want a good deal while in Irvine? Look no further, this is it
Summary: Great pool, laundry, friendly staff. Clean, quiet, relaxing. Close to all eateries, movies, beach, attractions. Good morning - Breakfast mmmm tasty make your own waffles, juice, and more. An overall good buy. I have always loved La Quinta's and this one when flying into John Wayne Airport is a good one.

Summary Heading: Two nights next to the train tracks.
Summary: Stayed two nights while in town for work training.  This location is definitely different from most La Quintas I have used.  I have not researched the history of the one building, but it is certainly quite old.  The room had a nice TV, good heat and cooling, comfortable bedding and a good sized bathroom.    Yes, I was unfortunately placed on the top floor, right next to the Amtrak tracks.  These were the only rooms available at the time.  The trains come by frequently and are quite loud and extremely fast.  A couple times, I actually felt the building shake a little.  They will offer free ear plugs if you need them.  I can't let the trains influence my opinion of the hotel, though.  I have lived near trains in the past, and knew what I was in for.  The staff, room, and breakfast

We have stayed at this La Quinta many times since our oldest daughter and family live in Orange County. We have always been pleased with the staff, the facility, the limited breakfast and the willingness to be able to take our dog, Legend, with us. If you stay in the silo building, I would suggest staying on the side away from the train tracks, otherwise, the train noises might be irritating. Enjoy lunch/dinner at Knolwood restaurant or Denny's restaurant, both located adjacent to this La Quinta. Enjoy this La Quinta Hotel.

It was not our first time staying in this facility. The last stay (in the other building) was decent but not this time.  The room was smelly the toilet is stinky worse than some public rest rooms. The bath tub drainage was clogged and by the time you finish shower the tub was half full. We were just too tired and have no time to deal or report it as we were in a hurry (late) for our appointment. They put us in a bad room and this is the review that they get. This is just an honest review, nothing against LQ as a corporation. Just the quality of the room that we stayed in.

Summary Heading: Historical hotel that is fairly average
Summary: I wanted to love this hotel because of it's historical importance and while I did enjoy the old silo and our room in it, I was disappointed with everything else. The rooms were dark and in need of updating, the air condition was off in the common areas, the food was terrible at breakfast, and everything was dirty. Also as a mom traveling with her kids I was a little uncomfortable with the clientele. There was pot being smoked in the parking lot and there were a bunch of guys around the pool all night getting drunk. I definitely didn't want my kids out of the room. Also if you get a room by the tracks be prepared for the noise. The hotel is right on the tracks, so it is hard to avoid. On the positive side the girl at the front desk was very pleasant when we checked it and very

Love it, the room was great suite,   the front desk are wonderful friendly people.  They make sure you have everything you need.
