I stayed in the brick building, I love the unique design, breakfast, I had room service yes. The best part everything is walking distant. See you next week on my next business trip.

Summary Heading: Interesting historic site, but those trains!
Summary: The location used to be a silo storage facility for fava beans and grain. There are regular rooms in the main building, but the silo‚Äôs are in a honeycomb layout and made of concrete. As a historical building, they could not paint the exposed concrete, so the look is very unique. How they cut the concrete to create the guest rooms is also quite appealing. Try to get parking lot side rooms though (they charge more for these). The trains passing by on the other side are LOUD. They say it‚Äôs not so bad, and they end at 11pm. No they do not. And because it‚Äôs so quiet usually, the trains are especially loud when they go by. Breakfast was skimpy compared to the Best Western we just left.

This is the second time I have visited this La Quinta Inn & Suites. YES.... It used to hold grain in this restored building.. NOW complaining patrons. When you want a bargain.. yes,- you will be on the metrolink train side- PAY MORE & get the quiet side. I am a native Orange County female (same age as Disneyland).. Kids love to stay here, because you are sleeping in a grain storage structure. I love it because it is close to my hospital & away from mobs of Disneyland crowds. Breakfast is complimentary in the morning until 9:00a & weekends,longer hours & yes the price is far better than the Anaheim area hotels!!! To address the complainers.... They got what they paid for!!! I'm a Flight Attendant who stays @'Luxury Hotels around the world, this isn't going to be that type of

very convenient hotel--relative bargain for the area. uniqe structure as many of the rooms are a repurposed grain silo.   half an hour from disneyland, ten minutes from the airport and fifteen minutes from laguna beach.  if you're a light sleeper stay off the 'train side'...

Summary Heading: Cute in an Old Silo Mill
Summary: After reading prior poor reviews I was hesitant to reserve a room; however, our experience was excellent.  Dogs can stay free in any room!!  You must choose a room facing the parking lot, they are remodeled inside the old silo's.  The beds are pillow tops, flatscreen tv, cute furnishings, very clean, desk, two extra chairs and ample space made our deluxe king room a A+ in quality.  We did not hear the trains nor any noise.  Our corner, second floor unit was close to the elevator and stairs.  Also a great gym in the basement.  Six machines and flat screen tv!!  Also, Located less than a mile from The Great Park, we took our dog for a great run/hike.  Heading East out of the parking lot and taking the second right, off of Sand Canyon, you will enter Marine Drive, and proceed to

Seriously, do not stay here unless you are desperate. The room we stayed in is depressing as the walls are bare concrete. Additionally it overlooks railroad tracks which is made worse by the frequent trains that come through so fast you have to wonder if it is going to make you go crazy. It is very, very loud. The only saving grace is the fact that it is pet friendly. Our little dog managed to get herself wedged in a small space behind the bed. Getting her out was no small feat however, we were rewarded by finding someone's bra that was clearly overlooked by housekeeping. No, I am not naive enough to think hotel housekeepers actually clean behind beds but cannot they at least look to see if something is there? Its pretty disgusting to find  something like that. There is nothing

Heavy furniture wear and tear and areas look very tired and worn out.   Bed mattress are worn out and deep dips in the middle area - very noticeable.... La Quinta HQ need to focus in this place and have the consideration to modernize the room furniture and bedding.

This place needs a complete overhaul.  The fact that it was a Silo does not necessarily mean it has to be unattractive.  The gray concrete walls and electrical wires showing are not conducive for good sleeping and relaxing.

Summary Heading: Bait and switch.  High Speed rail line 20 feet from window.  Found out at check in.  Cheap for a reason.
Summary: Part of this hotel is a converted grain silo.  Even though the building is solid the noise still travels, so you are aware of slamming doors.  AC was noisy.  The real problem is not so much the noise but the vibration of the high speed trains that shake you awake through the night.  I cannot believe that the other higher ratings are from real travelers.  Go to nearby Denny's for breakfast.  Do not stay a second night.

You definitely get what you pay for.   Breakfast area set up drove me crazy!  The layout is not efficient and causes a lot of traffic jams.  I would love to redo that area!   Breakfast staff was always nice.  Check in people were okay.  Friendly but not helpful in the evening.   Housekeeping was lacking but not all their fault.  They had 2 people call in sick while were there (and it was completely booked).  They didn't show up one day to clean our room (and all we asked was that they change out the towels).  We had to go down and get new towels.  We were on the top level of the grainery but the windows actually opened (would have made me nervous if I had young children).  Windows were dirty so you couldn't see out unless you opened up the windows.   Not much to see so no big

The historic building is really neat.  We couldn't even hear the train! Good ac nice tv.  Close to spectrum shopping plaza but too far too walk.  Breakfast waffle maker is yummy!  Clean rooms.  We couldn't figure or how to plug the bath.

I stayed here only because my daughter's soccer team decided to stay here and the fields were in close proximity.  After reading the reviews, I came with low expectations, which is helpful.  The hotel is very dated but relatively clean.  The staff was nice, the price was cheap (especially with AAA discount), and breakfast, wifi, and parking are free.  The concrete walls were cool but my girls thought it was cold and dungeon like. We were given a suite on the train side with bird poop stained windows.   Yes, you will hear the train at least every hour.  I used the complimentary ear plugs but everyone else was not so well rested.  Though it has a lot of positives, I would not stay here by choice.  For those on a budget and who are heavy sleepers, this place is decent.

This is a budget hotel. However, adequate for a couple of nights stay, easy parking, washing and drying facilities. It is a dated building, but they keep it clean and the staff were efficient and very friendly.  The free breakfast is continental style buffet, which is a small but of good quality - especially the orange juice.

Our room wasn't ready upon our arrival on a Saturday evening at 6:30. We were told it would take 20-30 minutes to get the room ready. 25.00 wasn't taken off the first night's stay. We should have gotten that first night for free.

Hotel was dirty.. Owner only wants profit. Not spending money on keeping it clean.  Would not stay there again...Run away fast!  Staff was very helpful and pleasant.  Entrance areas filthy. Elevators dirty..  Carpets in halls and rooms were awful..(dirty).. Dirt and trash everywhere.

Major overhaul needed for this rusted concrete silo.  Entrances need a good washing and some paint.  Dead plants should be discarded, and if you are lucky to sleep past the 6:45 AM gardeners' wake-up session (blowing debris in parking lot), you may find a decent breakfast awaiting you.  Oh, and there is a gym in the basement, in case you were wondering.

Summary Heading: If you Love Trains, this is the Best Place to Stay!!!
Summary: This establishment is located next to a Metro Rail Line ~ just incredible!!! The room was decent and fairly clean, but somehow it smelled musty. The staff was friendly and the continental breakfast was good.  There are better hotels in the area for your buck, but if you Love Trains - this is most Definitely the place to stay!!!

Nice enough. Stayed on consecutive weeks. One one main building. GREAT room. Second was on "silo" that was next to train tracks. Train during night only passed once.  Will stay again, but will try to not be on train side of the building.

dont get yer bang for the bucks. Way too expensive but i dont have a choice. I have a big machine and this hotel is right by the jobsite with parking for my truck. It has a dennys next door and a jack in the box across the street with a 76 station close also to get snacks.

Half the hotel is in an old concrete silo. The room was dirty, and smelled very(!) musty. To top it off, the train passes just 10 feet from the hotel (I'm not exaggerating!). We got a new room on the 4th floor which was more bearable, but our 4 night stay turned into one. I was insulted that such a room was even listed and given as an option.

I love staying at this place, very nice and clean and people are friendly. I would recommend it to anyone that is in the area to try this hotel. Price is about average as other hotels. I have stayed at other locations when in the area and this is one of the best

And the entire family is wide awake. Folks, this hotel is RIGHT next to a Metro rail line... And I mean RIGHT NEXT TO IT. We always choose La Quinta hotels.... No where on the website for this hotel does it state it's near a Metro line.   I went downstairs at 11pm to ask the manager for an additional pillow and pillow. I was told that there were no more pillows. I said okay, could I get another blanket to "make" a pillow for the pullout couch?? The worker replied with "no, you only get one blanket".   So, now my 15 year old is sleeping without a pillow on the pullout couch.   Shameful.... And a horrible experience. I'm saddened that we had such a horrible experience at a La Quinta hotel.

always a pleasure to stay here, the city has gotten pretty crowded it seems to grow everytime we go, i like that it is not too far from anywhere. comfortable rooms love to hear the trains go by. love it here

Spent the day running around with 2 teenagers, was too tired to drive back to Perris so we decided to spend a night.  The front desk service was very nice and helpful.  Our room was very clean and nice.  The beds were clean and comfy. The free breakfast selection was great. We are looking forward to staying for a few days in the future. Thank you.

This location was convenient for me, but definitely over priced.  It is an old property and not well maintained.  One example was the door to my room would not shut completely tight against the door jam. There was light coming through from the outside in addition to sound.  The carpet had numerous stains, and it was all shredded and coming up from the floor near the entrance to the bathroom.  For the kind of money they were charging, you can find a much better property than this. On one particular day, I left for most of the day and when I came back late in the afternoon, my room still hadn't been made up.

Summary Heading: Lowest Filthiest Facility in Irvine and Orange Co.
Summary: I would not recommend this location or facility to any family or traveler. Filthy bedding. Full of smokers and drinkers in the hallways and out at the doorways all nights. Loud all night and in the parking lot as well. Very ugly concrete rooms that smell and unclean. Worst hotel ever stayed in.

Wow!  I thought this place was ultimate & awesome when it came to hotels.  I LOVE trains, and I noticed that the choo-choo ran right behind it.  Unfortunately I was disappointed I had a front side room.  I couldn't hear them go by.  DAMN!  Anyway, I am just kidding on that.  This place gets six stars from me.  I TRULY enjoyed my stay at this hotel.  The room, parking for my bus (free) and plenty of it.  The location I felt was not that good, however they go out of their way to serve you.  They have a continuous shuttle that they run every hour.  Ok breakfast, but you expect that with Denny's and other restaurants near by.  I enjoyed staying there.  Next time I will make sure I get a room by the tracks.

It was about 1pm showed up to the lobby there was a lady behind the counter on a radio.  I was third in line when it was almost my turn she said she could help me, her radio rang again and spent about 5 minutes talking about a broken sink. When she was finally done talking asked if I had a reservation, and by the look in her eyes, It was obvious she didn't want me there.  She then told me that check in is at 3pm. to go away, and come back at 3. Cause there had been already way too many early check ins, and that if she had a room later on it would be next to  the train trax. In other words get out and don't come back. Came back at 3 took my chances and a  Latino guy Ron I think was his name. Took care of me without any drama. This lady needs to be told that you can't be a picker

I am extremely dissatisfied with this hotel.  I will never stay here again.  I was not familiar with the hotel's location prior to arrival and there was no disclosure of the proximity of the high speed train track.  From my room's window, the train passed by just 20 feet away at 60+ mph 24 hours a day.  It was so close I felt like I could reach out and touch the train.  I woke up no fewer than 10-20 times between 11pm and 8am.

Old rooms in front building, trains next to rear building. Remodel on old building was done a long time ago.Towels looked dirty and stained, small television,bath tub drips constantly during California drought emergency ! Enough said

Generally an OK property, but it's beginning to show its age and attention to detail. If you're not expecting much, it's OK for the price. The "breakfast included" is not much of a breakfast. No hot food to speak of and limited selection of some bakery items. No real value in what's offered.

The hotel is located near a train track and on sand.  There is excessive noise and vibration when the trains go by (possibly a commuter train).  So unless you plan to wake up early in the morning before the first train go by, do not stay here.  The hotel is for the price otherwise.  The breakfast selection is not as good as other La Quinta's I have stayed at.

Stayed three nights and had a very good experience.  Unique large rooms with great beds & very clean.  There are trains that pass to the back of the building so if you are a light sleeper request rooms in front.  Would return, great family fun. Good food walking distance.

Summary Heading: Cool building, next to the TRAIN!
Summary: They are in the process of converting an old grain silo station into an expansion area for the motel.  Unfortunately, the coaster train screams by between the hotel and the grain silo.  They have a note at the counter that the hotel is "built" on sand to assist in absorbing the movement caused by the train.  It does, but does nothing for the sound.  Buyer beware!

we had to request another room as the t v did not work and the bathroom was rusty and not clean, also the towels are not soft and the jacuzzi was out of service as well. very disappointing to say the least.

Summary Heading: Average stay, good for 1 night while traveling
Summary: Stayed here while traveling through and needing just a place for the night.   Pros: all staff was very friendly; good rate for the area; convenient highway access; very clean; plenty of parking; a Denny's and a hamburger restaurant in the same parking lot.  Cons: very firm mattress; smoking room; room on 4th floor on 'train side' - very fast trains passed very closely to hotel...I was so tired I didn't care, but the sound and vibration would likely bother most people; very short shower head; poor breakfast selection/quality.  I wouldn't stay here for an extended period of time, but it fit our need for a one night stop ever just fine.

Had to find a room on one day's notice and this was cheapest/closest available at $99 for a King room. On the National Registry of Historical Places, it is really two hotels. If you want ANY sense of Historic/Architectural, make sure you ask to stay in the Lima Bean Silo side. I got the Very Dated Exterior Door Hotel side of the property. I could hear EVERY noise in the parking lot, the door didn't quite fit in the frame- looked like it had been kicked in long ago and not replaced. Pool/Hot Tub was "Out of Order", soda machine didn't work and breakfast was sub-par. Denny's sharing the same parking lot solved breakfast.  Room had been updated and was OK. Free WiFi and decent TV. Overall, Meh. You get what you pay for...

While the hotel has a lot of architectural and historic appeal, and while this hotel chain is usually a good place to stay, rooms facing the railroad tracks are very noisy every time a train passes, the in-room coffee maker was missing components and was not useable, and the breakfast service was poorly maintained and items typically offered at La Quinta hotels (such as cereal, yogurt, hardboiled eggs, apples and bananas) were not stocked or otherwise available; breakfast items were very limited.

Good room and comfortable but remember they cater to animal owners so you should be prepared to listen to dogs barking at all hours of the day and night.  The breakfast is almost purely high carb so if you are on a low carb diet, the breakfast is not for you.

This la quinta is nice, nothing fancy. The location is great right off the 5, and close to the area colleges. They have a nice breakfast in the morning with ample seating area. The only negative i hve i see the train goes by quite often and it is loud

I was just amazed with the high level of service and nice rooms.  This property is located in Old Town Irvine just off of Interstate 5.  Has great access to Irvine Spectrum and Interstate 405 as well.  3 restaurants in walking distance.  Rooms are very reasonable in price for the value.  Free breakfast included.  Great for business trips!!

This particular La Quinta is well worth the stay! The historic features of the building were kept beautifully in tact, while keeping the rooms appealing and modern. Inside you can take a walk down memory lane of how the surrounding community once looked from the photographs and captions. Beautiful Hotel!

Summary Heading: My stay was right out of a horror movie.
Summary: When I checked in after 10 hours of flights, I was told I was getting the last room available cheerfully.  I noticed a big fishbowl of earplugs prominently placed in the middle of the front desk.  A sign on the bowl says something about a train.  The clerk tells me that this is a 'train hotel', but since I'm on the 4th floor, I should not hear the occasional train.  Boy was he wrong!  I'm writing this right now lying awake typing at 4AM while trains come by within feet of the window.  They shake the room and are sometimes deafening.  I insert the earplugs but they barely help.  I haven't slept more than 15 min straight since I arrived at 11PM.    I'm booked for 2 nights, but I'm checking out immediately to move to somewhere quiet.  The long list of business meetings today are

They offer good rates on their rooms and do daily cleanup of rooms and bath. Breakfast has lots of varities to choose from to work all day long. Customer service as its best, Rosendo (maintenance/driver) a good driver and builds good friendship on guests, same with Amanda, Franky, Frankie and Oscar which are all very helpful and accomodating.

Like staying at this La Quinta Inn.  Nearby I 5 Fwy and 405 Fwy makes it easy to get to all the places you need to go in Orange County.  Also have access to nearby restaurants and shopping.  Fashion Island and South Coast Plaza Malls are close as well.

Good location for where we were going to. Spent 2 nights, room was clean and on ground floor easy to take pets out for a walk. The down side we were next to the stairs and it was very noisy, would stay again.

The hotel accommodations and staff were great. The historic significance of the hotel added to the enjoyment of the stay.  Having two restaurants within walking distance made it even better.  As a retired veteran, I greatly appreciated the military discount.

Summary Heading: Too creepy...too close to train track and too many pet
Summary: Loud trains are not my thing....would not stay there again...didn't sleep at all....if you like creepy and dark things this is the place for you...the hotel is very close to train tracks....very odd location.

This place is great -- we love the train silo side and stay in it every chance we get.  The breakfast is great and it is convenient to the freeways and such. The people are warm and happy to work here.

Summary Heading: needs upgrading an much better staff
Summary: Hello, I liked the manager in the office when I was there. The bathroom was old and run down looking and the bathtub had a big black stain inside of it. The coffee maker was right out of the 1990s with only coffee, no sugar or creamer, and didn't look very clean so Ididn't use it or the bathtub. The service in the breakfast room was poor

Love the place - very nice breakfast and good service overall.  Rooms have concrete walls because it is historic from the 1800's - very nice and great beds.  very close to places to eat and stores - right off highway.

Summary Heading: Ridiculously loud trains within 15 feet of hotel window
Summary: Avoid this hotel and La Quinta I suppose.  The room that was booked said nothing about trains and ridiculous noise. I checked in and went to the room. Almost right away after getting to the room the building starts shaking and about 10 seconds later a train rips by shaking everything. The trains are ridiculously loud too... like they would scare you awake to hear it while you're sleeping.   I went to talk with the front desk and the gal told me that she has no other rooms and there's nothing she can do so I checked out and she said they would refund me because I didn't do a single thing to the room and left right away.  2 days later my card is charged & I call La Quinta and I'm told I have to talk with the manager. The manager calls me back and tells me that it's La Quinta

Summary Heading: Don't stay here if you need sleep
Summary: I have stayed here before 4 years ago. That visit was fine. It's in a great location as in next to the freeways and yes its next to a train track but that's not the problem. There is construction going on. During day I understand but as I'm writing this at 3 am in the morning, machinery is beeping so loud, you know that annoying back up sound? I picked this place again because I'm recovering from surgery and its a mile from my Dr office. The rooms are nice and beds are comfy but dealing with trains AND construction is ridiculous. Wait til they are done with construction on the street. It's not the hotels fault but not a place to stay right now. I even have a sound machine I brought because I knew of the train which works for three train noise but not the stupid beeping noise.

My family are LaQuinta fans as their hotel never disappointing us. We were travelling LA a week and this is the first LaQuinta we picked. I love the hotel building shape (a bit special then other hotel). Also, I like the colourful breakfast area but their breakfast serving time finished a bit early then other LaQuintas or hotels. Room was clean and big. It is a good value hotel to stay.

OK I have to admit, I am just enamored with the grain silo conversion.  Just so cool!  I loved the concrete walls, the decor, just everything.  Yes, we stayed on the side of the hotel with the train tracks.  Yes, a LOT of trains went by. Yes, they are noisy, but my entire family ran to the window every time one went by to watch them (providing we weren't sleeping). I suppose if you are a light sleeper it may bother you, but we sleep with white noise, and none of our family of four was bothered by the noise. Unless you get the freight train it's like five seconds of noise. I heard no other noise from other guests at all and the hotel was packed.  I was willing to overlook the few things I would have picked on if it were a more expensive hotel. There were a few hairs in our

Nice & clean. Friendly staff.  Only negative is quality of  food at Bight Side Breakfast. Should have items like sausage or bacon and cooked eggs & variety of danish like other hotels offering FREE breakfast at the same price point as La Quinta Inn.  This hotel offered none of the above and very difficult finding a place to sit as there were very few tables available. Noticed people pushing each other out of the way to get to a table.

Great location for our destination. Was here for a family event. Rooms comfortable. We were there with two other couples. Didn't try to accommodate  request for rooms close to family and were located on 3 separate floors. Would recommend blankets located in rooms for sleeper sofa. All in all the experience was pleasant and met our needs.

I travel a lot on business on a budget and often stay at La Quintas for the free wi-fi and breakfast.  This one happened to be halfway between the customer and the airport so it was the obvious choice for my trip.  Part of the hotel is in an old grain elevator and it's pretty cool.  The breakfast area still has the old feed chutes.  The best thing about this hotel is the friendly and helpful staff. Frankie will pick you up at the airport, take you to the Spectrum mall and provide great company along the way. The front desk organized a  car to take me to my business meeting, which made it alot easier for me.  Breakfast was typical hotel breakfast, but hey, it's free.  If you want a gourmet breakfast, go to a restaurant. My room was clean and the bed was comfortable.  The fridge

My wife was hospitalized on an emergency at Hoag hospital so I wanted to stay close by her. I stayed two nights at the Candlewood suites but they were full the next two nights so I moved to the La Quinta. The La Quinta is only about three minutes from the hospital so that was a good place to stay. The hotel is compromised right now because of extensive road construction in the front of the building. It was easy to get in and out of the area it was a bit challenging to see it upon arrival. My room was clean. The bathtub was stained from wear. Slept well there was virtually no external noise. The elevator is a bit slow. They have the USA today every morning and you could get waffles in the room by the pool. The staff that I dealt with was very nice. All in all it was an okay place

La Quinta Irvine Spectrum has the most professional, friendliest, accommodating staff I have ever encountered. Rooms are clean modest, very pleasant. Sleeping in the  historical concrete grain historical is unique but after the first few times, we enjoyed the traditional rooms, GREAT rooms on fourth floor above the silos, doubles, spacious, kind of have to get used to large door opening into bathroom and sink area. Prefer the sink, counter and coffee maker outside bathroom, (but realize one would be foolish to attempt to get a drinkable cup of coffee out of those ridiculous coffee makers all the value oriented hotels offer. NOT to worry at the La Quinta with their very nice Brightside breakfast offered every morning FREE!! We have stayed in 4 or 5 value hotels in the area and

I stayed here because I needed a pet-friendly hotel and this was one of the few in the area.  Here is my Pros/Cons critique:  Pros: - Friendly Staff - Very Affordable Room Rates - Dogs Allowed - Easy Parking - Early Check-in (when available)  Cons: - My shower appeared to have black marks near the drain that looked like feces.  I am not sure if it was feces, but I was so turned-off by the marks that I did not even use the shower during my stay. - The outside doors on the side of the hotel do not automatically lock and anyone (i.e. a violent criminal) could enter the hotel easily without having to go through the lobby first and be on camera - The hotel is advertised as "dog-friendly" but there are not very many grassy areas near the hotel's side exit to let your dog go to the

very clean. everything was great except there was no ice in the ice machine and no do not disturb sign. Breakfast until 9AM but it would've been better if extended to 10AM but that's a personal issues.

This hotel was quite nice at one time but no longer. We stayed there a month a go and the room was dirty. The bathtub looked like it had never been cleaned and carpet a mess and what looks like blood on the curtains. See pictures. Will never stay again. There are other hotels in the area any one would be better than La Quinta Spectrum.

Interesting building, inside an old concrete grain elevator.  Very nice staff, but cleanliness of room was sub par.  Carpet in rooms is old.  Railroad tracks are very close, so ask for room on the other side of the building from the railroad tracks.  Some Laquintas are very good, some horrible.  This is somewhere in the middle.

80 year old lima bean farm building.  Very drab. Service good but breakfast was very, very limited. Advertised pictures do not show how bad this old farm building looks.  Most continental breakfasts provided have more items to choose from.

I have stayed here many times. The Silo section of the hotel is really cool. The walls are industrial and the room is in an octagon shape. Will definitely continue staying here on my trips to So. Cal.

I had stayed before at this Hotel LQ , and breakfast was excellent, but this time it was "good", I went over for  breakfast at 7:30 am and there was no coffee, so they finally got around to making some around 8 am.

Summary Heading: Nice Room but Didn't Like the Trains....
Summary: I have stayed here a few times but this is the first time I had a room facing the train track and while the window was double glazed, the trains passing 20 ft away every 10 min from 5 am were still very loud (plus the freight train at 3am). These rooms made from old wheat silos are very interesting and spacious and if you get one not facing the train tracks you can't hear the trains. The location was convenient for meetings I had in the Orange County area and price reasonable but you should certainly avoid rooms facing the train track (one whole side of the silo building).

Fun, beautiful atmosphere with silo-cornered rooms...same La Quinta experience, but in a unique location...easy to make reservation...hot tub under Orange County sky...easy access to freeways...close to Irvine and Tustin

My company put us up in this hotel for 2 weeks. My first impression of the hotel was immediately bad. When I got to my room, the first thing I did was use the bathroom and I found that the sink had obviously not been cleaned in weeks. The amount of toothpaste build up on the faucet was horrendous. A second look at the bathroom revealed that 1 of 3 towels was dirty, yet hanging on the clean rack. Every day when returning to my room there were two very sketchy guys standing outside the building. Not sure if they were staying in the hotel but gave off the vibe of drug dealers which would make sense given the potent smell of weed on the 4th floor every single day. As if the hotel couldn't get worse there was a "Mandatory Power Outage" in which the hotel staff stated would be from

This is a very interesting place. Unfortunately it does have a musty smell and the breakfast was a disappointment. However, there is a Denny's and a hamburger restaurant that are just next door. Overall, it was very quiet and fun to enjoy some history.

We have stayed in this La Quinta numerous times and never had a problem, but this time was a real deal breaker.  Check-in day we were greeted by the desk clerk who informed us that the hotel room requested was unavailable as he had just rented them all out and we had a choice of fourth floor or the train side.  We had specifically asked for the parking lot side in the silo like three weeks ago so we had to choose the fourth floor.  The next day we arrived back at the room to find everything nicely done.  Except for the bathroom.  There was no bath mat for the floor outside the shower and the bottom of the tube was slick like unclean or just dirty, the material put in the tube to keep people from slipping was just plain dirty.  There were splotches of something on the walls and

Choose the converted grain silo rooms - very large rooms - really nice! Location is near the highway down to Laguna Beach and a few blocks away from the open air Irvine Spectrum shopping district with lots of good restaurants.

When we got to our room the toilet paper was half used (who knows what kind of germs were on it) and the tiny bottle of shampoo was almost empty. The room key cards would keep loosing their program, had to got to the lobby 3 times out of 4 days to have them reprogrammed. Grounds crew woke us every morning with leaf blowers going. The swimming pool and hot tub was very dirty. (I never saw the pool filter ever on).

It was my first time ever staying at a hotel where there were not enough towels or soap.  The tissue box was empty, and it was like the dirty things were removed from the room and not replenished.  The longer we stayed, the more I noticed.  A mirror missing from the wall, dripping shower, fridge leaking water from the over frosted freezer that must have been neglected for a while.  We had stayed here before and liked the location enough the stay again.  It was a big mistake and we won't be back.  Breakfast was blah as well.

This hotel is top of the line, friendly service, clean rooms, excellent service.  I needed extra towels and they gave me as many as i wanted with no problem.  Their beds are so comfortable, you feel like your sleeping on a cloud.  The breakfast is free and it is tasty.  You will enjoy your stay, so book your stay today!!!

This hotel has some very cool rooms, my favorites are the king suites in the old grainery. The walls are solid concrete with rough texture and no paint. It is very different than anything else I've ever seen. The rooms are very large and comfortable as one expects. Great place to stay, one of my favorites of the chain. This property and its rooms have always been clean and very quiet, especially in the grainery.

Location was perfect to visit with family and access to freeway.  The history of the building is fun and interesting, especially like the silo rooms.  The hotel is dog friendly!  The staff is friendly and knowledge about the area attractions and available to give accurate and easy to follow directions.  The burger place and Denny's across the parking lot complete the picture.

While La Quinta allows pets, the City of Irvine has posted 'No Dogs Allowed' signs throughout the grounds. NO pet designated pet area. The carpet in the room was dirty enough to turn the my bare feet black. The tub's tile surround had two significant patches of mold/ mildew and the bottom of the tub appeared dirty. The lobby is located in one building while the 'suite' rooms are in another. Despite the lack of hotel staff inside the doors to the 'silo' building, the doors remain unlocked. I only encountered one member of the hotel's staff. He was extremely pleasant. Construction on the main road by the hotel clogs the intersection which makes getting in and out of the parking lot extremely time consuming.

Converted grain silos, make it an interesting stay.  It was very warm outside, but the concrete walls kept the temperature nice and cool at all times.  Even though was are concrete, the room was comfortable and well appointed.

I am a former General Manager of a boutique hotel in Pigeon Forge, TN, and trust me when I say, the Silo Building of the La Quinta beats all I've ever seen.  We slept is a concrete grain elevator!!  All I could think of was how creative the designers were - no paint, no wall paper to replace!!  The decor was simple and creative.  The room was very clean and quiet.  I found the trains to be charming.  The staff works very hard, and we appreciate them.  When in the area, I will definately stay there again.

I have stayed at this hotel many times on business trips and although some may complain about the trains, I find them charming and the small amount of time they make noise isn't bothersome. I found the staff to have been there a while and trying the best they can to be hospitable. This place is very convenient to my business locations and allows those businesses ease in giving me a ride to their locations. I love the price...it's just right for me and I'm not really into being pampered at the hotel. I just want to bathe, sleep, do a little computer stuff and eat close by. This hotel has it all. Thanks La Quinta

Summary Heading: Live in workers out of control
Summary: what do the people who live in your hotel do in the morning my family and I were there 3 days and witnessed the people who live in this hotel take up a table at breakfast take multiple large containers of Milk and Juice as well as Fruit, cereal, coffee, condiments and the complementary newspaper back to their room. On the last day we were there we watched the Lady take the last bagle from the warmer. What about the paying customer ??? We also watched a woman cleaning up a milk spill on the floor that her husband had made, when the old lady tenant walked up to her and just pointed out the different locations that milk was spilled on the floor not a word just stood there and pointed at the spill didnt offer to assist didnt get a rag or a mop just pointed at the spills. Ok maybe

Summary Heading: One of my favorite La Quinta
Summary: It's one of the cleanest and well maintained La Quintas. I especially love the old silo building renovated to be hotel rooms, the style is very cool. I especially like the circular room.  I love La Quinta because they are so pet friendly and when I travel with my dog a lot, it's great not to have to pay for that pet deposit all the time other hotels request it.

The staff are pleasant, the hotel is clean, the free breakfast is a very welcomed feature, located in one of the best cities in the US, getting there is easy- right off a freeway. I have stayed there numerous times and will continue to do so in the future. I am very picky where I stay. I recommend staying here. There is also a clean and well maintained pool and Jacuzzi.

Located in Old Town Irvice, CA and constructed by conversion of a former grain silo, you sleep in cement walled circular rooms nicely decorated and quiet of the parking lot side. Metro-link trains to San Diego run at high speed close to the south side of the hotel and althoough brief, the noise can be startling. Unique and fun hotel to spend the night.

Summary Heading: let me know I will be sleeping next to the train tracks!
Summary: Read the reviews before booking..2 buildings one in the front and the other in the back.don't stay in the one in the back it used to be a lima bean storage building next to the train tracks. the staff will notify you and warn you about the train when you  get there but it might be to late to find another motel room. stay away from the gray building unless you want to hear the trains all night!

I like this hotel.  Value is good and now that I have a little dog I really appreciate this hotel.  The rooms are clean and they do not charge for animals.  This is an older hotel but it is well maintained and improvements have been made in cafeteria.

my bike group has been making this their staging ground for cycling trips for years. many of the rooms are in a converted grain silo--sleep where the lima beans slept...  only proviso is try to keep out of the train side--noisy at night though the joke is if you time nocturnal activities correctly you can make a lasting impression if you wind up trainside.....;->  clean comfortable convenient and reasonable--good place to use laguna, irvine, anaheim services with no fuss...

The staff is friendly, but the owner takes short cuts in service.  Convenient, but not my favorite place to stay. A/C drips a lot.  W-fi is horrible.  Even at 3am, you could barley get a real signal.  Pool was okay.  Train goes by a lot, but you get used to it.  Parking is easy.  Convenient intersections

Summary Heading: I tried, but the train and construction noise was too much
Summary: Very polite staff and a clean property.  But if you get an outside room like I did, the train noise is far worse than expected (and I live by railroad tracks at home).  But add to it the constant beeping of construction vehicles from 5AM on, and the situation is unbearable.  The staff was very polite, and I changed hotels.  Maybe I'd try again once construction was done, if they offered me a "try before you buy" arrangement.

If you like the color gray this is the hotel for you. Or wi-fi that is slower than dial-up. Or better yet a TV service that keeps losing it's connection. Then this is the place for you. I'll never stay at this one again.

Terrible noise from high speed railroad tracks below half of guest room windows. Cast concrete construction absorbs and holds in humidity and sealed windows make interior humidity worse. Very unpleasant experience.   Disgrace to La Quinta brand.

Summary Heading: Very small rooms in concrete building
Summary: Stayed here one night. Had to stay in a room with 1 double bed. It was my hubby and I. We were directed next door to a cement building. It was a very cool building but rooms were very small. The desk clerk did let us know that we would hear a train. We were right next to train tracks and they did pass by about every 10-15 min or so. Very small room. No closet. One small window. Pool was average, right in front of breakfast area. Waffles, cereal and coffee for breakfast. Room was clean and location is right off 5 freeway.

Have stayed many times in La Quinta hotels. Mostly in Texas and have found them excellent in their value.  But this La Quinta was noisey and the bath and beds were not clean,  Hair in tub and beds.  Hotel is near freeway which accounts for the noise, but the housekeeping is not forgivable.  Outside around the hotel was not well kept either.  trash was around the walkways to the hotel rooms. breakfast offering was minimal for a La Quinta. Seating for morre than two was not available. This La Quinta is in bad shape.  when we complained at front desk, we had to stand in line behind other complainers.  A very dissapointing and bad experience.

Train sitch is the worst. Incredibly loud throughout the entire night. Not cool.  The bean mill feels like rundown dorm rooms.  Walls are thin and the staffs isn't that forgiving when discussing the cancellation policies. If he were more apologetic or understanding, i would maybe given 2 dots.     If you like sleep, don't stay here.

it is a hotel in ok condition. Hotel is a bit dated and pool is 2 stars at best. Our room was fine but some friends had mold in their bathrooms.  The positives include the hotel staff. All were very professional and helpful in a timely manner. It was nice to be close to Great Park for sports tournament but hotel is right next to the train tracks. You hear train and train whistle a couple of times through the night. Continental breakfast in the morning was standard and included in the price.

Summary Heading: Great rate and convenient stay in Irvine
Summary: If you like trains and great rates with a 24-hour Denny's available, this is perfect. Much preferred over the high-rate places near the airport. It is centrally located between the airport and the Irvine Spectrum so there is plenty to do!

Summary Heading: We stayed in a Bean Mill
Summary: I have been traveling to Irvine for 4 years on business and always wondered what the strange grey building was that was sitting next to the railroad tracks.  On my last trip, a friend suggested the LaQuinta Inn and I reserved two rooms for two nights. When we arrived, it was the strange gray building. They had taken a building was storage silos for Lime Beans, back in the 1940s and converted it to a hotel, building right out to the silo walls. What a great idea.  I am not the flashy hotel type and we immediately fell in love with this destination. We stayed on the east side of the hotel, away from the train tracks. I asked some others if the train bothered them and they said that after a few went by, they didn't seem to hear them anymore. Kids, however, would love it.

Avoid it at any cost! It is right next train tracks, so even noise cancelling headphones wouldn't help, since everything that is holding this miserable building together starts to tremble. There is no room service, the neighborhood is shady, and the coffee maker is screwed to the wall next to toilet.

Avoid this hotel if you want to get any sleep at all.  I had requested a room away from the train tracks when the reservation was made but was informed upon arrival that "we are all sold out" and this is the last room we have.  Simple planning of room assignments each morning and noting special requests would have prevented this.  I will never stay here again.

This hotel is built along the Amtrac train route and when the train goes by it felt like it was barreling right through the room.  You were unable to sleep during the train schedule making it a  very distressing stay.

The worse hotel I stayed. So noisy! The room was between freeway and train track.  Bathtub and bathroom curtain were disgusting. Internet connection was so slow. You cannot browse a text page. The coffee machine and cups were in bathroom.

Summary Heading: noisy place, average service and facilities
Summary: pros - this was closer to the business location I had meetings cons - 1. noisy -next to train tracks.  you can feel the vibrations and noise all time.  certainly impacted my sleep quality. 2. service - My room was in the block at the back and the key card did not help me to get in. There were 4 other guest waiting for same reason. I went to front desk. it took at least 10 minutes for him to attend the issues and 30 minutes to resolve it  3. this is a pet friendly place, expect the rooms to have some not so good smell.  my mistake i had not checked this before booking :(. sorry, no offence to pet lovers.   had booked this place for three nights, but decided to move out after one night.

We drove in early from Texas and of course couldn't find a hotel (that took dogs) in the central/north part of Orange County. But La Quinta Irvine had availability. I was beyond excited because of the nostalgic quality of this hotel. Being from OC I knew the history of the building and expected the train sounds. It was very nicely done. Love everything about the location. If you don't want history, location and need it to be quiet I recommend paying the obscene prices of Laguna/Newport beach. Lighten up people the train isn't that bad and our room was right over the tracks. It's all in the perspective.

Summary Heading: Comfy, amenable to pets, nice staff, but smoky-smelling room
Summary: This place has kind staff and great, roomy rooms with nice decor and double windows that open for air or close against the train/freeway noise (with windows closed and earplugs, you can't even hear the trains). Comfy beds, good mini-fridge and microwave, a fine shower, a clean bathroom, no pet fee, no problem with our 2 dogs, enough parking, easy access to restaurants. But this was a non-smoking reservation, and the room reeked of cigarette smoke--it was in all the linens and saturated all my clothes and my own sheet that I brought. I'd give it 5 stars except for the smoky smell which followed me home and the fact that the hotel allows people to smoke right outside non-smoking rooms, so smoke comes in the fan/air conditioning unit. If the hotel steps up its non-smoking policy,

Excellent motel with extremely clean rooms and wonderful and helpful staff.  The free breakfast  served a nice variety of cereals, bagels, and yogurts as well as a waffle maker. The motel is within three minute walk to three different restaurants which meet most family needs.

Summary Heading: A well located, historic, pet-friendly GEM!
Summary: We had a little trouble finding this La Quinta because of road construction around it (June 2014) but it is VERY convenient, just off I-5.  It is an old grain mill and the building has very thick walls so we had absolutely no noise problems, but there are train tracks on one side and freeway on the other.  They had a really inspired idea of turning this historic old mill into a hotel, and when you first drive up you wonder how good it can be because of the original building.  But it is a wonderful hotel, and parking is very plentiful.  Breakfast was ok, lots of carbs, nothing special but that's not what we were there for. We loved the hotel and will be back.

This hotel is very unique! The suite was spacious and comfortable and the staff was very helpful. The restaurants are just across the parking lot and, being right off I-5, it's very convenient to anything you want to see and do in Orange County. Anyone who stays here is in for a real treat! (Don't pay attention to reviews that complain about the rumble of passing trains--my family had no idea what those reviewers were talking about; this is probably one of the quietest hotels we've ever stayed in.)

Best La Quinta Hands down. My family and I have been frequenting many  La Quinta locations across Southern California  for about 8 years now, as summer weekend or vacation getaways.This hotel is in one of those ‚Äúold town‚Äù areas that just have so much charm. Right from the get go, our stay was pleasant: simple, easy parking and a comfortable, wonderful looking lobby with a smiling face to greet us upon check in., which was quick and easy. They accommodated my family, made sure any questions we had were answered, and just offered us great service overall. Customer service is important in any business, but it is imperative when it comes to a hotel. The rest of the staff was just as friendly, always greeting us with a smile, and seeing to anything that we needed, or answering any

Summary Heading: Trains and hotels are not a good mix
Summary: Unfortunately this hotel is next to a railroad (I'm talking about 20 ft away). So when I checked-in, the first thing they gave me was ear plugs. That was enough for me to know the kind of night a was going to have. It was too late at night to look for another hotel otherwise that would have been my best option to go somewhere else.

Nice hotel but was unaware of the train that runs on the west side of hotel. If you stay on the east side of hotel you can barely hear it. Otherwise, a nice hotel.  Close to freeway - but there was construction on Sand Cyn and could only go one way. But that should be done within the month. Starbucks and strip mall within walking distance.

Summary Heading: Of you have small children who love to watch trains, this is the place for you!
Summary: This quaint hotel was a grain silo, and is right next to a set of RR tracks. The noise didn't bother us, and the trains are primarily short, commuter trains. Our kids loved watching them pass. I think the prices are slightly lower than other comparable hotels in the area, due to the noise. The room was clean. Beds comfy. Breakfast was adequate, though seating in the breakfast room was not.

Inexpensive, clean, centrally located to our grandchildren, next door to other food choices if you decline to eat the provided free continental breakfast at the hotel. The best rooms are in the "silo" the others are clean, but not as roomy.

Summary Heading: Room not clean when we arrived
Summary: Arrived at 10pm and when we went into the room we found it was not cleaned. Looked like the housekeeper stopped halfway through. The front desk person was very apologetic and tried to fix things by cleaning the room himself. There was a strong cigarette odor in the bathroom that was never resolved. The location was nice and price was fine. My guess is that someone else staying here would have a better experience than we did.

Bring your OWN Soap AND Shampoo Get ready to have  an AWESOME BREAKFAST with great service This is an UNIQUE CONVERTED BEAN SILO. the rooms are soundproof. As a travel agent I rate it 3 stars. they have a pool and fair workout center. there are 2 close restaurants and a gas station

Love the pet policy at La Quinta!  This hotel in particular is so unique. We stayed  on the third floor, king suite. The room was a part of a bean silo at one time.  It's amazing what they have done. The room is large and the walls are concrete, obviously no neighbor issues here. The decor is great! The hotel is between the fwy and the RR tracks. We requested a room on the opposite side of the tracks.

Would not recommend this hotel, due to bathtub is dirty, humming noise in the bathroom and the air conditioner works off of a sensor (motion movement) - therefore at night the air conditioner would stop.

service was great but my "non smoking" room smelled like a ciggarette, plus i didnt know pets were allowed,  my suitcase had to be cleaned because now it smells like a cigarette, everthing else was fine but,,, man that smell was with me each and every day, i should have complained, they probaly would have moved me but.. i will just not use them again, they should have known

This hotel was a great price, location and such friendly staff!  The building is an old silo so the rooms are unique.  Very clean place. There is a train that goes by one side quite often  I didn't mind the noise but some might.  Make sure you ask about this.

This hotel is convienently located close to Irvine spectrum, has comfy beds, i loved the sheets. A/c worked which was awesome. Only wish they had more for breakfast instead of the standard and boring continental breakfast.

Summary Heading: Don't judge an Inn by its Cover
Summary: I genuinely enjoyed my stay. I had a room on the second floor away from the train tracks. I don't know what people were talking about when they said the train schedule was annoying, but during my four day stay, I hardly heard the train at night/morning. It looks weird from the outside, but trust me when I say that the rooms themselves don't look so bad. If you're looking for a place that will do that will have nice service and decent accomodations, LQ Inn will do the trick for the price.

I checked in and I saw a lot of cops in front of my room. There were heavy noises in the hallway. I asked them to change my room, and they moved us to the second floor. The rooms were old feeling, and the building was banged up on the outside. The train didn't let us sleep all night. I complained to the desk clerk. The desk clerk was extremely rude and not apologetic. She said that it is a regular routine of the train, and that is something you get used to there. Some Indian people own the place. They are very unprofessional. Breakfast was very poor. I can't believe how these people got a La Quinta franchise licence.  It is too much for me to adjust to. Sorry, this is not the hotel you would want to go to when you pay 105.00 dollar every night.

Summary Heading: I do not reccommend for couples
Summary: We have stayed in other La Quinta inns in California that were fine but I do not recommend the one in Irvine, Spectrum. I think someone was trying to be creative with converting a grain mill next to railroad tracks into a hotel. Because the train is outrageously close to the back rooms and ridiculously loud, we did not have a restful 2 days. I could even hear it with my ear plugs in.  Luckily, I think it only came by once after midnight. Also, pool and spa were full of splashing kids every time we wanted to use them so we didn't. Low price wasn't worth it.

Friends car got broken into.  Very low water pressure in bathroom sink. Carpet in the rooms stained & dirty.  Went to Breakfast at 9am and all bagels & waffles were gone...waited 30 minutes to see if more would come and none did.  The breakfast area was a complete mess.  Was told by the front desk that I could not have late check out because "she had already given too many away".  I have AAA and no one offered or suggested that I would get a discount if I mentioned it.  Will not be back.

Summary Heading: next to high speed train track
Summary: unless you are okay with sleeping right next to a train track at night, look at other places. The breakfast is not like other La Quinta Inn, where they have scrambled eggs, etc. The bathroom, gives you a old motel feeling. The best part of the stay was a speedy checkout.

Summary Heading: Why put a hotel right by the train tracks!!??
Summary: Just returned from an overnight stay at this hotel, and I would not stay here again.  The biggest problem is the location - my room was very close (less than 50 feet) to the train tracks, and I was disturbed repeatedly during the night by the loud rumble and whistle of passing trains.  Whoever decided this was a good place for a hotel should have their head examined.  In addition, the breakfast was very basic, and the coffee was weak and tasteless.  Finally, the shower had one of those trendy but impractical bowed curtain rods that made it impossible to keep the water from spraying out onto the bathroom floor, so there was a nice puddle when I stepped out of the shower.  Not a place I will return to.

Summary Heading: Don't stay here unless you have no choice
Summary: We had a flood in our home and were looking for a place to stay that was convenient to our home and husband's work, and also were able to take our 65 lb. golden retriever.  We booked the place sight unseen because we had to make a quick decision.  We managed to stay here for 5 days before we had to find something else.  We gave it two stars because the people at the front desk were nice and there was no extra charge for the dog. Everything else left a lot to be desired.  Location was poor because it's right next to metrolink tracks, which would have been fine during the day, but we had no idea so many freight trains sped by during the night  with horns blaring.  Housecleaning was spotty...had to leave wastebaskets and dirty towels outside on mat in order to get staff's attention

Will never stay here again. Have been to this location in the past on several occasions. A/C is hit or miss.  It stays on for only a few minutes, then stops and blows the air around the room.  This trip, it was 92 degrees outside and we were on the 3rd floor.  Difficult to sleep when the room remains at a pretty stead 87 degrees all night.

Summary Heading: Rosa must be blind, but other than that it was decent.
Summary: Even with lowered expectations, this was a bad experience.  I checked in on a Wed night, and found a black T-shirt on the floor in the corner of the closet.  Rosa's name was on the card saying who cleaned my room.  I called the front desk to let them know.  I was offered a change of room, but declined, as long as the t-shirt would be removed the following day.  Disappointed, I decided to draw a bath....but found soap residue and hairs in the bathtub!  This time, I did accept a different room....also cleaned by Rosa (I checked the card).  This room looked clean, except for the gum wrapper on the carpet near the entrance to the bathroom....in plain sight.....you can see it from the doorway, for Pete's sake.  I didn't say anything and lo and behold, it was there the next evening as

Room on top floor was large, comfortable and quiet. I stayed in the silo and had no problems with the train - could hear it in the distance but it didn't interfere with hearing the TV, conversation on the phone or with visitors. Air conditioner was quiet and kept room comfortable. Everything in working order. When I left in AM for short time, came back to find room cleaned (good experience) Wifi strong.  Only complaints was had to call housekeeping over items left from previous guest and took a while for them to show up. Didn't use pool or breakfast - seemed popular, and a number of people hanging out at times in parking lot.

Summary Heading: Best hotel to stay with pets.
Summary: A very positive experience to stay in a hotel room with my large dog and cat. We stayed for 10 days and only have good things to say. They don't charge extra for pets either.   My room was a lot larger than I ever expected.  Terrific staff.  They all love pets also.  A bit noisy from the trains passing but the double glass windows help.

This La Quinta is unique in that they refurbished an old Silo building that gives it a unique character.  I stay in La Quintas because they are usually fairly priced, they accept dogs, and are family friendly.  II prefer hotels with inside access because I usually travel with my family and this La Quinta has both rooms that access from the outside for quick stays and rooms that access from an inside hallway, if you prefer.  The rooms were clean, the beds were comfortable and it was a good value.

Your manager is the friendliest we have had the pleasure to meet! Very professional. Motel nice rooms, extremely comfortable beds. quiet rooms except for the train that went by about every twenty minutes or so. By and large we both enjoy our accommodations and our stays at this La Quinta Motel.  Sincerely,  Mr. & Mrs. Gil & Gayle Montalvo

We stayed for two nights in the restored bean silo section of the hotel.  It worked great for us, two adults and two high school girls. Despite close by freeway and rail, it was quiet.  Breakfast was good, but don't be late or it's packed up and gone.  Overall, it was a really good value.

My family which consists of my husband, two sons and two daughters, have just returned from our Spring Break vacation in Southern California.  We stayed at The La Quinta Inn and Suites in Irvine, California.  We always stay at La Quinta Inns when we travel.  We have been to quite a few locations.  This location in Irvine was by far a wonderful surprise.  When we drove up to the Inn we were all a little freaked out because the outside appearance of the Inn is an old Mill next to the main hotel.  My kids were actually scared.  When we checked in I asked about the Mill and the hotel personnel said we were staying there...My kids called it "The Tower of Terror".  As we entered the building we were quite surprised at how modern but also historic the building was.  We reserved two

This was my boyfriend and I first time staying at La Quinta Inn. The bed and pillows were so comfortable.  The staff was really nice. We loved everything abut our stay except for the train.  But the good thing was that it was less frequent at night. If it weren't for the train we would have rated everything as 5.

highly recommend la quinta sand canyon, irvine spectrum.. staff, room comfort, cleanliness and amenities. wonderful breakfast welcome each morning. pleasant lobby, fireplace tv etc.  location is great, near the freeway, and many popular destinations in the area. walk across parking lot to knowlwoods hamburgers, great food, dennys (one of the nicest ive been in) gas station with little store, and jack in the box. lobby and breakfast area very inviting. staff friendly and knowledgable.

It was first time to me to book in a motel and it was great expreince to and my wife and we enjoy it The motel was clean an quiet such acosy place .breakfast was good . Location was close to city center . Thanks for nice staff overthere.

We spent the night in a grain silo. Yes thats right a grain silo and it was so cool the way it was set up. If I lived neer by it would be my family's fall out shelter. Going to take God to knock this building down.

We have stayed at this La Quinta before and have found the value, the service and the room the best in the area. The breakfast could be a little better, but otherwise this experience was Grand. We will continue to stay at this La Quinta again when in the area.

Solid hotel with good staff.  Rooms maintained pretty well and clean.   Location is noisy and one upgrade that would make a big difference would be replacing the windows to improve sound proofing.   Typical breakfast variety for LQ and nice breakfast area.

Summary Heading: best hotel for pet owners with children
Summary: Good location, best value and good for people who otravel with their pets. I defintely will return. Come with breakfast, you can make you own waffle, my daughtere loved it. This is not our first time w/La Quinta. We always go to Ski trip in Tahoe but stay in Reno LaQuinta because we travel with our 2 dogs and always satified.

I was very happy with this hotel, I liked the cleanliness & the efficiency of the staff; check in was speedy & was  happy with how well the breakfast continued to be stocked. Very nice selection of breakfast, makes traveling with kids very pleasant-happy kids=happy mom. Very clean room & spacious too.

Always clean. Fast and friendly service. Good Price for the quality. Not too high not too low. Usually my first choice unless there are no rooms available. I joined the rewards membership after staying at the hotel twice and have finally earned enough points for a free room!

Our stay at LQ irvine Spectrum was as enjoyable this time as our previous stays there were. The staff is friendly, accommodating, and efficient.  The charming, well-kept rooms, extremely comfortable beds,and the hot and cold breakfast choices are quite satisfactory.

Upon arrival, I was shocked to see the back portion of the hotel was a converted grain storage building. I must have missed that on the reservation. However, we were pleasantly surprised once we got inside. It was kind of like staying in a museum. The rooms were modern, clean and comfortable. The ac unit in our room was a little slow, but nothing unbearable.   Our room was on the street side, rather than the train track side so we never heard the trains at night. My biggest complaint would be that the pool heater was not functioning during our stay and the water was frigid. There were no signs indicating that it was malfunctioning so we found out the hard way. The spa was hot and clean though, so we made use of that instead. You can definitely hear the trains from the pool area.

Great facility excellent staff. Room was a little noisy by the train tracks, could not get another room, got there late and hotel was full. but the next day got moved to the quiet side and all was good.

We loved the character of the hotel.  The rooms were clean and comfortable.  I really liked that building found new live as this hotel and not just torn down.  We will definitely stay at this hotel again.

I love the unusual design of part of the hotel, with the hexagonal rooms.  Location is also great, close to I-5, Airport and major attractions, such as Newport Beach, Disneyland, etc. The only draw back could be trains passing close by, but I understand they'll be running underground soon.  I have already stayed at this hotel twice and will certainly do so again. Loved it!

We stayed at this hotel because we were playing a soccer tournament at OC Park, literally 2 minutes away, we could have actually walk to the fields... I read all the reviews regarding the train. I'm unsure if I was too tired or just didn't care about the train. Yes, the train is literally in the backyard, you can feel the breeze of the train passing by. Loved - pet friendly hotel at no extra charge!!! I was thanked for my military service, all personnel that I contacted was always helpful and with a huge smile. Usually is a hustle to check-in with a dog, not the case, the check-in went smooth and fast, as well as the check-out. Cons - TRAIN!!!! if you a light sleeper this is not the hotel for you, however friends staying literally at the train tracks said they couldn't hear the

This is a great hotel : converted from a bean and grain warehouse with unique rooms built in a lima bean silo, this three-story hotel is listed in the National Registry of Historical Sites. Rooms are very large and comfortable. Internet works great. Near lots of restaurants. Easy freeway access.

Summary Heading: If you love trains and prison chic decor this place is great!
Summary: The lobby and front desk were average and seemed clean but the red flag arose when the desk clerk pointed out the fact that no matter where my room was I would hear the train.   Upon getting to the "silo" building I was greeted by a sketchy elevator. When I got to my second floor room I was alarmed to see that my room was adjacent to the elevator, vending machine and ice machine. The thought of these things keeping me awake was quickly dismissed once I got into my room. My prison chic room.   The walls are poured concrete with all of the electrical conduit exposed. There was one large dust tapestry hanging on one wall in an attempt to soften this cold, industrial room. When I flipped the light switch on then off a spark startled me ( I guess I won't use that light). Then it

The outside of the building is a little odd until you learn that the larger of the two buildings is an historic grain silo.  It was interesting to learn about the history, and the room was great.  It was roomy, clean, easy to access, quiet, and the king bed was very comfortable.  Wireless internet was great.  The continental breakfast was decent, with 3 cereals, waffles/pancakes, toast, bagels, yogurt, fruit, juice, and hard boiled eggs.  It was very nice to have it in a room separate  from the reception area.  The breakfast attendant, Oscar, was exceptional in his service and riendliness.  The hotel had a nice exercise room, outdoor heated pool, and hot tub.  It was within a few steps of two restaurants for other meals and parking was commodious.  Though the hotel is located

I stayed here on two separate occasions during the month of January. Both were business related.   What I love about this place is the great value for a very nice/large sized room. My rooms (during both stays) had two double beds. The room was large enough for me to have 5-6 fully grown adult males to hold business meetings there.   None of the whistles and bells. No nonsense, simply the goods and essentials - free internet, free continental breakfast, tons of plugs (for your phone, computer, pad, etc.), great water pressure, friendly staff, and clean room.   I will definitely return if/when I have lectures at Irvine, CA.

Summary Heading: Hope you don't have any issues
Summary: I've stayed at this location before, but it was probably ten years ago. I love the location to my family, friends, and freeways. The fact that they allow dogs is a bonus. This stay was not so good though. I reported a few issues, and had to remind the staff about them. I was promised a bill credit and a call from the manager.....3 days later and no word of either.

Summary Heading: Great location , convent and private quiet room right off the 5 freeway.
Summary: I really liked the location , the bed was comfortable the room was big , the towels could be better but we're not bad. The maids forgot to clean my room one day so the manager gave a credit on my bill which was acceptable because these things do happen.overall I was very happy and will be coming back in March to stay there again !

From check in to check out, I would rate our experience as excellent. very courtious, knowledgeable and friendly. Really like the converted concrete silos to super quite rooms. The room decorations accented the the structure.Will definately stay again.

The hotel management was very accommodating to our pet needs: there was grassy areas, close by walking areas, outdoor restaurant facilities close by...all these accommodations are necessary in order to travel with family and pets (we had three large dogs).

Summary Heading: Just clean enough, not enough to stay longer than one night.
Summary: I recently stayed in this hotel for one night as I was only in town for a one day business meeting. Upon my arrival at 1:30am from a delayed flight I was exhausted and glad that the bed and sleeping area was satisfactorily clean and ready for as much sleep as I could fit in before my morning meeting. The bed was comfortable and the room was quiet, despite being on the ground floor with a window looking out into the parking lot.  The bathroom, however, was sub-par. When I got there the toilet seat was up (weird) and there was noticeable dried pee on the outside of the toilet bowl. I covered the seat entirely with multiple layers of toilet paper before squatting to use the toilet. The shower was the kind that is at the same level as the floor with a drain in the floor, I covered

Staying in Irvine for the Southern California Half Marathon and booked this hotel based on it's location to the event and the price.  The only thing I was concerned about was that it is located next to the railroad tracks and I had read from previous reviews that it might be bothersome. My expectations were not very high and I am happy to say that I was very surprised how wonderful the place turned out to be.  The property and room were very well maintained, clean and nicely decorated.  The room was huge, by my standards, with a very comfortable bed and even a reclining chair.  I requested and was accommodated with a room further away from the tracks and never even noticed the train.  In my opinion, I definitely got more than I paid for....would not hesitate to stay again.

We travel a lot for our daughters volleyball tournaments so we like to stay within our budget. Well we've been staying at La Quinta for many years and it's because they fullfill all our needs. They always have comfortable beds/pillows, have a free decent breakfast, free wifi, free parking. The rooms have always been clean and staff friendly. This La Quinta was all of that and right off the freeway! We will continue to stay with La Quinta as they never disappoint. Prices are always fair so why would we go anywhere else??

I always sleep good when I stay at this La Quinta.   Breakfast is also good.  I love the historic building. It is close to both the 5 and the 405.  The rooms are spacious.  Plenty of parking.  Internet connection is good.  Overall a great hotel and worth the money.

Summary Heading: Staying in the silo is a great experience
Summary: I love this hotel and staying in the silo is a unique experience, I will come back again and again. It is a good value and the location is ideal. If you do stay in the grain silo building, the east side is away from the train tracks and much more quiet.

I lately was a participant in a ride and drive event held at the el toro Marine base Great park. I selected this location as it was the closest to the venue. Upon my arrival I wasn't sure if I had made the right decision but once I checked in it turned out great. The staff was great and extremely helpful, rooms were clean and well maintained. There are ice & vending machines at all floors for convenience. There are facilities within walking distance for getting a bite as well as a few cocktails if you fancy. Gas station is around the corner and the 5 freeway is right next to you and so is the 405. A very convenient location, over all a 10 from 1-10.

Summary Heading: An interesting room at a comfortable price
Summary: Overall a very good value; parking was convenient and free.  Breakfast is included but it is a simple continental.  If you need protein - visit Knowlwood Restaurant next door for some slightly greasy corned beef hash or other options.  If you're into fast food - Jack in the Box is just across the way or Dennys can dish up some of their junk food for you. The key is that you have options nearby.  As for the room, I was lucky enough to get a room in the "Silo" building on the ground floor, away from the train tracks. It was peaceful and practically soundproof due to the concrete walls.  If you keep your drapes closed, you won't even notice the cars parked outside. The bed is awesomely comfortable  - one of the best beds to be found in a reasonably priced inn/hotel. Their TV is

Very unique room decor and layout.  You are sleeping inside the original agriculture concrete silo.  Staff was very accommodating, found a room ready before noon, and checked me in earlier than normal.  Silos are adjacent to the active commuter railroad line.  I was concern at first.  Checked the window and it was quadruple pane.  The noise is more like rumbling, and the duration is very short as the train zoom by at, i guess, 60 mph or more.

Summary Heading: Solar Expo stay at Great Park
Summary: I was looking for a hotel that was affordable and close to the Great Park - I found both in La Quinta.  My whole stay exceeded my expectations as I hadn't stayed in any La Quinta hotels before.  The rooms were clean and comfortable - the staff were helpful and friendly.  The courtesy van was a godsend.  The breakfast was fresh and generous.  The situation is rather industrial and sandwiched between motorways and rail lines so not very pretty, but its an historic part of town and there are some fast food providers right next door.  Good value for money and I would definitely recommend this hotel as somewhere to rest your head - its not a holiday destination in itself but serves its purpose beautifully - well kept pool and spa too!

Summary Heading: Unfortunate slide in quality - no longer recommended
Summary: It has been a couple years since I stayed at this La Quinta, which I like for quick access to the highway and it's in a nice expensive neighborhood with many food and retail options nearby.  But, boy, has this property slipped. And, as a pretty frequent flyer of LQ hotels (read my other reviews), I have a pretty good idea of what LQs are supposed to be like.   The one thing I can (until last weekend) always count on at LQ is clean bathrooms.  Not here.  My room had mold on the tub, on the wall and on the ceiling.  Yuck.  That really made me doubt the overall cleanliness of the entire bathroom.  On top of that, when we got to the room, clearly the previous guests had smoked in the room.  The front desk refused my request for a room change, so we were stuck.  But, that aside,

I am in Irvine for an event at the "Great Park".  Booked five nights at the La Quinta Inn & Suites Irvine Spectrum.  I am a very deep sleeper, I have slept in cars, buses, trains and airplanes.  But, every night I am awoken at the La Quinta Inn & Suites Irvine Spectrum when the trains go by.  The hotel is positioned between the 5 and train tracks.    I am staying on the side of the hotel opposite the train tracks on the forth floor (top floor) and still the bed shakes every time a train goes by. It reminds me of the scene in the "Blues Brothers", and Elwood's Hotel room.    The rooms are okay, but not too clean.  Will pick a different hotel next time, either the Double Tree, Extended Stay or Quality Inn, all are near.

The room was very clean, the bed was good, the pool area is quite nice considering cramped quarters, and the front desk service was pleasant, but the exact location was visually shocking: wedged RIGHT between the I-5 and the railroad track. Literally! Why would anyone put a hotel there? Given the location, even with the decent room, this place is overpriced. Side note: the Sunday breakfast doesn't open until 7 am, so don't rely on that if you have an early start.

clean and comfortable for a one-nighter business trip. I didnt realize the hotel was right next to the Amtrack train.  As long as the A/C unit is running, you will not hear the Amtrack train crossing by.  I slept right through it.  I would stay there again, because it was priced very reasonably, clean and comfortable, right off of the 5 fwy and 405 fwy.
