We would definitely recommend  this hotel for anyone visiting Verizon Amphitheater. This hotel is located within a few miles and there are plenty of restaurants within driving distance. More importantly the bed was the best hotel bed we have ever slept in. We will be back.

Summary Heading: Nice Room. I would Stay again
Summary: The room was very nice.  Everything worked perfectly.  Very comfortable.  I enjoyed the stay.  There is a Denny's next door and a Jack in the box across the street.  Room was very clean and the bed was very comfortable.

We were going to an event at Irvine Meadows and were led to believe this was around the corner when it was actually 5 miles away...no biggie and thankfully they put us on the other side of the bldg away from train tracks on the top floor...it was okay for 1 night but the customer service is kinda whatever....they did not tell us breakfast was only from 6 - 9 am, or even tell us about breakfast in the first place, so when we walked down at 9:30, which is a reasonable time, they were all packing up plus my man booked and allegedly paid for this room on the phone and upon arrival they had no idea what I was talking about meanwhile he had booked and spoken with a manager the day before. Also windows do not open which was a lil strange.

When I booked a room at this hotel, I asked for a quiet room.  When I checked in, I was given a room right next to the train tracks.  I was told that because I was on the third floor, that It would be quieter.  Wow, was that a lie!!!  When the train passes by, it is extremely loud and it even shakes the building a little.  It is very sad when employees have to lie to customers to get them to stay at this hotel.  Just tell the truth so you won't lose customers forever.

Just spent 2 nights.  The room was good size and clean.  The beds were comfortable. The morning breakfast was a cold buffet in preparation for a long bike ride--a hot buffet breakfast would have been appreciated.  The comment about the trains is correct--they are quite loud wnen passing by in the middle of the night and if you are a light sleeper prepare to be awoken.  Good burger and breakfast restaurant right across the parking area.  All in all, a basic accomodation that will meet your needs.

The hotel is comfty..... If u stay by the "train rooms" the Amtrak passes threw if u don't mind that noise Wich isn't much ., & it's only for litarly 20seconds .... I like those rooms there cemented walls... & the rooms are super clean......

Summary Heading: Great get away place, just fix the plumbing
Summary: We have stayed here more than once to get away from the heat and noise of the neighborhood.  It's nostalgic and rustic and has a great pool and quiet rooms; but the plumbing was leaking and no one could fix it... The free continental breakfast was dull and limited in variety and flavor but appreciated...

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel and very friendly, helpful staff
Summary: This is a great hotel, it's a fun and is a unique experience. Love the beds, they're so comfortable.  The bedrooms are very large almost like mini suites and the location is excellent. We travelled on business twice and another time with our family, we all enjoyed it. The pool was fun and the breakfast really adds value especially when you're travelling with hungary teenage grandkids.

Summary Heading: What Happened to My Favorite La Quinta?
Summary: Our family has stayed at this La Quinta many times over the years because it was an affordable and clean option close to Disneyland. We stayed last December 2012 and the room had a whole bunch of issues. There were stains on carpet, drapes, lamp shades and the bathroom was not very clean. We also could not access a single power outlet in the room for a friend's CPAP machine and had to pull a bed out from the wall to get to one. As an apology for all the issues the manager sent a certificate for a free stay and let me know that the whole inn was being renovated at the beginning of 2013. I waited until August 2013 to go back, hoping the renovations would be complete and the issues resolved. There was some problem with making the reservation because no one could figure out how to

Room was clean, comfortable with cold AC and premium bedding. Front desk was helpful and met all our requests with a smile. The south side of the building is up against train tracks and during our stay, we would jump out of bed and rush to the window to see fast, quiet, 7 car passenger trains whiz by in 3 seconds... amazingly quiet and no horns were blown at night. The south building is made from concrete silos so any outside noise is hard to hear. Double windows have been installed. We loved it!

The hotel exceeded my expectations! Freeway and train noise was not a problem at all. The staff was all wonderful, from the front desk to the maids and handyman...all where great! This hotel is a great value for all that you get.

clean rooms, friendly staff. only thing that sucks is the train is close and if youre a light sleeper it would wake you up. THere is a dennys and some other restaurant right next door. They offer a continental breakfast and they dont charge extra for dogs! they also have a small grass area to take your dogs out.

Summary Heading: Good but avoid train side building
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for one month. The hotel has 2 buildings. One very close to train you would wake up 5 times each night and the other building is on the street side which is quiet.  Pros:  1- We got a good deal by contacting the manager of this specific location directly.  2- The staff are friendly and helpful (the ones we dealt with David, Oskar, and Jessica) 3- The beds are comfy and big  4- Rooms are fair in size  5- Close to high way 6- A gas station with small shop and 2 restaurant are walking distance  7- Parking is free and always you find place  Cons :  1- Again, avoid train side building. They call it " Silo "  . Its a nightmare. I bought ear plugs to avoid such noise 2- The breakfast dinning room most of the time is very crowded that we would wait 10-15 minutes

The train noise was the main reason that I had to leave after the first night. The train basically runs sometimes at night and every 20 mins in the daytime. It was my fault that I did not see the comments in the reviews. But I hope others won't make the same mistake. Yes, there is free parking, free breakfast, free internet, and it is in general a 2 stars motel. If you like the train sound, I mean some people don't mind because it might actually keep them entertained!

My husband and I loved the room, the King bed, the large mirror, the sink outside the bathroom! We were relatively close to our conference we attended,and were quite comfortable.  I would suggest that you rethink the arrangement of your breakfast buffet and try to figure in more seating.

Rooms are very large but are in desperate need of updating. Beds should be thrown out!! Huge pits in the middle of them. Very clean rooms, slow elevators and the free breakfast is just that free.....so I can't complain. Staff is very nice!

We decided to do a spur of the moment beach trip.  In the movies everything goes so well but little did we know that the US Open surf championship was at Huntington Beach.  My wife found the La Quinta Inn and we found it was located nicely for our needs.  The next time we would like to stay in the converted grain storage area.  It looked interesting.

Do not stay here. We got 2 rooms here. One room, the sink wouldn't drain, low pressure water when taking showers and the other room had a dirty washcloth hanging from the shower. Most of all you will have the train run right by your room ALL night. The staff said it's quiet. It's not! Too bad I didn't read the reviews before I booked this hotel.

Summary Heading: Tough to review: Rooms on train side are LOUD, service was good
Summary: Geesh, I'm not quite sure what to do with this review: The personnel, room quality and service was just fine and very typical of other LaQuinta hotels I've stayed in‚Äîbut the room was so noisy due to the commuter (mostly) and freight trains throughout the night that we had to check out after one night because it was so difficult to sleep. So, I'll give it an "average" rating, but know that your results may vary if you get a room that has a better location.  There are two buildings at this facility; one, a standard motel-type and the other, perpendicular to it, which was created from an historic concrete lima bean storage/silo. This review is for the "lima beanery" rooms.  FWIW, the concrete walls make for an interesting room decor, but both rooms our party stayed in were large

Summary Heading: An excellent location near Hwy 5 and 405.
Summary: An excellent location near hwy 5 and the 405 and easy to get to airport.  The only drawbacks in an otherwise very conmortable stay were there was only one chair for two people and the carpet could have been vacuumed cleaner.

Summary Heading: LQI can be a good choice for athletes & families to stay for out of town competitions
Summary: Two weeks in a row we stayed at the LQI on Sand Cyn in Irvine because it is the most convenient place close to where the basketball tournament we had to go to. It was a pleasant stay the 1st time we were there although we would have loved it if we were able to use the Jacuzzi that was not working. The following week, we stayed again for the basketball tournament, the Jacuzzi is still not working (ordinarily not a big deal) but the athletes would have loved to be able to use it. Unfortunately, around ten pm when we are about ready to turn it, we realized the sofa bed is busted. Housekeeping came up but unable to fix it so a couple of the kids had to sleep on the floor. Even the housekeeper agreed that the sheets on the sofa bed doesn't look fresh at all so he offered to bring us

Redone vegetable processing plant sandwiched between Metroliner tracks and freeway = noisy. Plus street construction.  Room was clean with a good bed.  Very lame breakfast with too little seating.  I won't be back.

I'm just curious whose brainchild it was that thought that someone going on vacation wanted to stay in an abandoned warehouse-feeling room.  Seriously??  The outside hallway looked as if it was under construction, and the room was dark and dingy with raw cement walls, exposed conduits and oh wait, a wall quilt to make it all better.  It felt as if I was squatting in an old warehouse on the seedy side of town, or in a prison cell.    The room appeared clean, and the bed was nice, but the decor was atrocious and has become the running joke of my company.  I doubt we will ever choose LaQuinta again.

Summary Heading: Great location if you train with Gracie Barra Irvine
Summary: Breakfast is mediocre and the front desk staff inflexible. I stayed for over 12 nights and they would not extend my check out time to accommodate. Had to pay for an extra night! I would look for different options in Irvine next time

Great hotel, Great location!!  Rooms have been updated, nicely!  Exterior needs to be updated.  I thought maybe it was old inside, but was pleasantly surprised.  Conveniently located for easy access to all our family orientated destinations!  Will definatly return in the future!!!

This hotel is built in part in a lime bean silo.  The first floor rooms have the rounded concrete walls and are very nicely sized.  Had a king bed.  Very comfortable.  We are retired military and they gave us a great rate.  They also made a point of acknowledging military service.  Big choice in the  free breakfast.  The room itself is worth the stay.

I chose this hotel for the location, price, breakfast, and free parking. My family and I were pleasantly surprised with the spacious , well appointed rooms and comfortable beds. Other reviews mentioned the train but it zipped by quickly and we hardly noticed it. We will definitely return for future family visits!

Summary Heading: Very Rustic - different kind of place
Summary: I recently stayed at this hotel while I traveled for my annual visit for my son's birthday/mother's day. I initially chose this hotel because of the location and the other good reviews. It was very easy to find right off of the 5. Warning - lots of road construction right in front of the hotel. The person at the front desk was very helpful. He apologized for the inconvenience and even gave me a choice of what floor I wanted my room on. I have to say, the rooms in the older building are different. The rooms are round with concrete walls. Very rustic. My main complaint is that the rooms are supposed to be non-smoking but when I stepped through the door, the smell of stale cigarette smoke hit me like a brick. I also noticed a cigarette burn on the side of the bathtub. The toilet

My stay was very enjoyable. Room was on the train rail side, but it didn't bother me at all, despite the rails being about 30 feet outside my window. (Incidentally, my wife said it woke her in the night but that it wasn't a deal breaker.) breakfast was nothing special as far as free hotel breakfasts go..but the staff was so helpful, so courteous that we didn't mind at all.

We have stayed at this LQ Inn three times in the past four months. Each experience has been very positive. I believe it is a great location to any point in the LA/OC/SD areas [freeways get you there pretty quickly]. They have a large area to walk our small dogs and provide bag stations for picking up what our traveling companions [Miniature Schnausers] leave behind. We will stay there again.

If you are working or visiting near Sand Canyon this hotel is in a great location.  The breakfast is limited.  Oatmeal, yogurt, waffles, boiled eggs, coffee, etc...  Plenty of loud noise in the area.  I5 and a train.  The main hotel building seems better than the auxillary building.  The lobby is small and basic.  The hotel does have a pool and hot tub.  Plenty of free parking and very easy access to I5.  A few places to eat are a short walk through the parking lot.  Our rooms have been clean and beds comfortable.

I love the Train It comes out of no where horn blasting and room shakes back and forth  i love that damm train i dont go there to sleep just party,the dinning is the best close by and the free breakfest is the best of all the other lq locations

there is a train that goes by the rear of the hotel four times an hour.  The room is literally shaking.  i assume that you, like me, are looking for a hotel to provide you a solid environment to rest.  this place doesn't cut it.  i checked out at 11p and found a much quieter hotel closer to the airport.    if you have business down in the office park, i would suggest braving the traffic in the morning rather than sleep here.  because you won't.

I checked in here for business early February for an event in Irvine just down the street. The gentleman at the front desk was very accomodating, as I checked into the hotel pretty late. The work that they have done making an old Historic Building that was used in WW2 was awesome. It gave you a different experience in regards to a hotel that you generally don't get. The weight room was awesome and very spacious in the basement, and the breakfast was what you would expect at a general hotel. The pool, breakfast area, and weight room are all in the silo building, so I'd recommend trying to get a room there on the first floor, as it's super close to everything. The room was a good temperature, the TVs are nice, and the beds are just as comfy! Highly suggest visiting La Quinta if

La Quinta in Irvine has rooms made out of an old silo. Very nice and a good value. There non-silo rooms are nice and comfortable and also a good price. I stay there when ever I in Irvine. It is also close to the Spectrum shops and restaurants. You won't be disappointed.

We stayed at this hotel because there was a huge convention in Anaheim and everything was sold out.  When we checked in we were very tired.  The first room that we were assigned to was on the third floor of the concrete building in the back.  The building was an old grain storage, so our first impression inside was cold, creepy and strange.  The decor and treatment of the building was cold, not industrial cool.  When we opened the door, the room was dirty, not serviced and smelled gross!  (Beware, this is a pet friendly hotel!!!) We went back to the registration desk and were assigned another room on the first floor of the the same concrete building in the back.  This time my husband laid on the bed and fell asleep.  I was going to get our luggage when three workmen opened the

Summary Heading: In some ways, not so good, in all other ways, not even close..
Summary: Stayed here under the Government Employee rate for a training class.  Check in was with an incredibly non personable young man, but seemed to be without hiccup.  The room was something..uhh..different.  Its an old grain storage facility that the rooms are built into, so they are slightly rounded with bare grey concrete walls, kind of like being in prison, but with flat screen tv's.  Bed was comfy, the A/C unit sounded like a 747, nd the room was OF COURSE about 40 feet away from the train tracks..NICE!!  The cool thing is there is a note about how the hotel is built on sand so it doesnt vibrate with the train, and complimetary ear plugs are available!!  SWEEEET!!!  The train didnt so much bother me as the "dog friendly" floor I was apparently on.  It sounded like a kennel.  No

Summary Heading: In some ways excellent, in some ways pretty poor.
Summary: I have had several occasions to stay at the La Quinta at Irvine Spectrum and I have really mixed emotions about it. I have returned which says a lot but I usually return because of the convenient location and the good price. Still, if I had a better option I would take it. This hotel is definitely not a bad place to stay but it certainly has some issues.  On the good side, the service is excellent. In my multiple visits to this hotel, I have never been disappointed by the people or their friendliness. The hotel staff are all top notch. I also find that the breakfast is really decent considering the typical thing you get for free in these kinds of places. Last, the fitness center is clean and well maintained. It's nice to be able to work out when on the road.  While rooms in the

Summary Heading: Everyone is so nice and friendly.
Summary: I love coming to this location. I go here for kia training. Everyone here is so nice. David is the nicest guy and VERY professional. He even gave me his own water just because I was thirsty. Don't worry it was a new unopened bottle. You barley even hear the trains and they don't even come by at night so you will rest easy. Definitely love this location

Freight trains are going by every 30 minutes 25 yards from my window.  Other than that, clean hotel and free wifi.  Who builds a hotel so close to a rail line?  I feel like Joe Pesci in My Vousin Vinny.  Trip advisor wants me to type 200 words so I will continue to blather about this forgettable hotel.  The parking lot here is also very dark.  The outside of the hotel is going through some sort of rehab, or preferably demolition.

What a nic find! This old grain silo is an unlikely but incredible conversion to a contemporary and industrial hotel. The lobby and more traditional facade don't hint at the potential of this place. It is almost a shame that La Quinta didn't carry this theme throughout. The comfortable entry Porte Cochere and lobby are what you might come to expect in withers California but be sure to ask about a quiet room. The old silo wing sits next to the railroad tracks among historic renovated older buildings in a contemporary old west. The room was the only place that I could find online near the station at a reasonable price. Despite the map it was almost odd the way the cab got there. Expect to pay 10-15 buck as the hotel is a little off the track. An area of Irvine call the Spectrum is

stayed wile visiting family, good location, close to freeway. Both fast food and sit down dining within walking distance. unique building grain silos re purposed into rooms, old feed mill buildings and businesses in lot. everthing was great. only problem was a noisy commuter train nearby noisy in daytime O.K. at night

We stayed at the la Quinta for a 1 night stopover between San Diego and Los Angeles. The check in process was smooth and efficient, rooms were spacious but not overly nice (tv is really small and far away from the bed), and the bathrooms were small as well. The hotel was exactly as expected - average in every way. It would be perfect for someone wanting a good nights sleep and nothing more, but don't go expecting anything luxurious.

We had a very pleasant 3 day stay over Christmas to visit family and friends. It was a great location with nicely appointed rooms, a real continental breakfast and they accept pets.  The on-line registration was easy and the check-in was very proficient.  The staff was friendly, courteous and answered all of our questions. With the railroad tracks so close we were worried about the train noise, but outside of a few train whistles, the train noise was minimal in the southeast 2nd floor of the silo building. We will definitely stay at this La Quinta again.

Since my dog was my "travel companion" this trip, I chose this hotel since it's pet friendly. I read other reviews about the train noise but I barely noticed. My room was very clean, quiet, and it was nice that the hotel had a grassy "poddy" area for pets and furnished bags for pickup. Rate was extremely reasonable and I will definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Dont rent rooms next to active construction
Summary: Have stayed here 3 prior times and enjoyed the stay.  This last time was not so enjoyable.  They put us in a room right next to ongoing construction and we got the hammer show until 6 and then again at 8:30 am.   Thermostat did not work nor the bathroom light.

Love this place stay yearly it is under renovation right now but did not know till check in/.  Thought maybe price could reflect parking issues detours and random noise.  But will stay again next year.  Just a little inconvience not the end of the world.  Dog friendly nice hotels are few this is one of the best.

Summary Heading: new experience at a La Quinta Inn
Summary: Dog friendly! Could be better at People Friendly! Courteous and friendly staff in the most part. Staff multi-task in various capacities. Not a good idea. Better trained for specific jobs would be more quality. Rooms are clean.  Some are better than others. Pet friendly rooms should be in one area. Overall, courteous and friendly staff.  One or two outstanding people.

1. great location  very close to daughters school, easy on and off freeway.     Two restaurants in parking lot  2. rooms very clean. every thing you need already there. refrigerator ,microwave, and most importantly COFFEE pot.  3. accept small pets, which for me is HUGH plus. Have elderly Yorkie.  4. Morning breakfast.   5. Friendly staff.

Service was great, from the moment I made my reservation. The front desk staff were very helpful as well, specially Mike - he was very friendly. The hotel looks great - it has a country, barn house feel to it - and so do the rooms. Very comfortable king bed, everything clean. The view frOm the window pleased me a lot, I love the country scape, but if you have trouble sleeping and you want to get up late, beware - the hotel is sitting right next to the train line. The location seemed good

My husband and I love to stay at this particular La Quinta as it is convenient.  We usually have our dog with us and there a very nice green area to walk him.  We love staying in the silo section as the rooms are very nice.  However, we made the mistake of staying on the third floor on our last visit.  A bright roof light shone right outside our window and we had trouble sleeping as our room was never dark enough.

So I booked this hotel last minute for epicenter festival 2012, booked it through Expedia. Price seemed reasonable enough. Got to the hotel and checked in with a Mexican lady who seemed to be okay at first. The hotel is kinda spooky as you walk in, the halls are creepy, but as soon as you walk into the room it's very nice. The only bad thing we experienced was getting to the front door to our room and my bf stepped into poop! At first I was like no, check your shoe it's probably dirt, but no sure enough it was dog crap! (work with animals so I know it was dog crap!) and he quickly wiped the poop onto the bathroom trash can but it smelled so I grabbed tissue and cleaned the trash can and flushed the poop. So he called the front to see why there was poop by our door, and the guy

Great value here - rooms are simple but clean and very comfortable.  Staff is friendly, helpful, and efficient.  Nice plus - it's pet-friendly in designated rooms, so you can bring along the pooch or the kitties.

We have stayed in LaQuinta Hotels and none were like the nightmare we experienced.  I am disabled, have a service dog and asked for a room on the ground floor close to the front desk.  We gave our credit card to insure our room in the "NEW" section and I was told by the front desk "no problem".  We had traveled 14 hrs, got there about 9 pm and the front desk said they could not guarantee a room in the front building.  We were put in the silo.  All concrete walls, which makes you feel like you are in prison.  No amenities.  The shower did not have a lip and the water ran all over the bathroom floor.  The air conditioner blows directly on you in front of your bed...ended up with a sore throat.  The train was very close, a swimming pool away and went by every 2-3 hrs.  We did get a

Summary Heading: Because a owner is not allowed to tear down a building can you really call it historic??????? Worst night at La Quinta
Summary: In all other states in US, La Quinta is decent as we found out - but beware when you come-Worst stay EVER in my life----I worked in hotels for over 20 years and know my experience is good but I have simple pleasures while I travel: clean floors, pet rooms not combined pet and smoking rooms since I do not smoke, clean towels, air control, cleanliness of rooms; We just stayed at four La Quinta's across US - each was different and if you have a pet, beware of smoke smell as they think this is the same room as a chain; the desk will always deny but it happened to me five times; Next, the inconsistencies of each hotel are quite astonishing from shower curtains, bed linens, carpet stains to beautiful fixtures, laundry, comfy beds---all diffent BUT THE COFFEE IS ALWAYS BAD IN EACH

We stayed here 2 nights and were previously warned about the train being close. Even though it was close we did not mind. The breakfast could have been better BUT it was such a neat hotel. We loved to look at the pictures of the history of the hotel and thought our room was FANTASTIC. We had such a great stay

I have had better breakfast in anothers La Quinta; here it just was milk, cereal and waffles. We were in a third floor no elevator. The restaurant area was in construction, and some metal walls were with rusty appearance.  The A/C was dripping over the carpet.  Good housekeeping.

I pity the reviewer who didn't do his homework on this hotel.  Knowing what to expect, my family found it unusual and charming.  We were interested in the history and appreciated the historical photos on the walls.  The good:  Our hexagonal room was big enough for three of us to move about freely, and we appreciated the 3 beds (two doubles and a sofa sleeper).  The sink was separate from the tub/shower/toilet, and there were 5 lamps to brighten the room.  The breakfast was plentiful and tasty, and the front desk staff was friendly and helpful (especially David).  Our concrete walls, far from feeling prison-like, provided a quiet, cool atmosphere.  The flat-screen TV had many cable channels, and there is plenty of free parking.  The not-so-good:  Despite the kindly concern of the

Summary Heading: Oops, someone forgot to finish cleaning the room!
Summary: We have stayed here several times and always had immaculate room and great service.  This time, the room had a towel by the sink, soap in the sink, and trash in the trash can.  The rest of the room has obviously been cleaned and the beds made with clean linens.  We were tired so reported to the desk when we checked out.  They were concerned and wrote down the issue telling us that they would talk to the person involved.  We were satisfied.

We have stayed at this hotel a few times and generally like it. The location is great and it is a good value for what you pay. However, this time we were traveling with a 7-month-old and were surprised that they do not provide high chairs in the breakfast area. My DIL had to hold the baby on her lap and she was not able to enjoy her breakfast. I can't believe with all the families that stay there they don't have something as basic as high chairs. Also, the beds were very tiny. They were advertised as full, but it looked like an oversized twin to me.

The inn and suites is built from an old honeycomb silo.  The rooms have a hexagon shape with concrete walls.  It has an appealing industrial feel.  However, the hotel is situated 50 yards from high speed railroad tracks and the trains do run late into the night blaring their horn as they speed through the nearby intersection.   Overall it's a decent value with a good complimentary breakfast area in the morning.

Summary Heading: This hotel is basically a dog kennel inside a train station
Summary: We just stayed here for four nights and didn't sleep two of them at all. The train is 50 feet away and blows it's horn loudly when it passes every 30 minutes. Next, this hotel specializes in taking pets. Next to us was at a room full of at least three large dogs that barked all day and all night. The management wasn't very helpful, and said it would send security at times but never did anything about it. And finally, there are two construction sites adjacent the hotel, one across the street, and the second across the tracks behind the hotel. Early morning brings a lot of trucks and heavy equipment noise.   Really nothing else matters in this review but this - stay here only if sleep isn't important to you

I only stay at La Quinta Inns.  They are so consistent.  I have stayed at this hotel twice this year and enjoyed it both times.  We had a room in the historic "farm" section of the hotel.  I was on the bottom floor and never heard anyone around me.  The suites are really nice and roomy and do not cost much more than a regular room.  If you can afford it, stay in one.  The walls are concrete and stay nice and cool.  The continental breakfast was great as always.  So many choices.  They had a nice lady cleaning up after us and stocking items as they ran out.  The customer service/maid staff are wonderful as usual.  There is a 24 hour Denny's in the parking lot next door to the hotel.  Close to freeway access.  I will stay at this hotel again.

Summary Heading: Good place to sleep if you get right floor/wing; unique historic building
Summary: First of all this is a typical La Quinta-- clean rooms, decent free breakfast. What makes this a unique stay is this was a converted grain silo in the past and still looks it from the outside. Inside though there are many good quiet clean rooms so long as you stay in the high floors far from the train tracks just beside the property. If you get booked into the smaller newer bldg, you will decide on whether you can handle the train that passes almost every 20 mins. I could not take it and they moved me after about 30 mins after I checked in. They moved me to the big grain silo on a high floor to the back and it was perfectly quiet since the silo has thick concrete walls also. Clean room there, clean bathroom, breakfast was hard boiled eggs, make your own waffles/pancakes, juice

Our stay was for the 4th of July.  Check-in was fast, and even though we were about an hour before the official check-in time the room was ready for us.  We stayed in the old grain mill part of the hotel - not on the train track side by request.  We could still hear the trains coming by and one train felt it needed to lay on the horn as it passed, but it wasn't loud enough to be truly disturbing and it didn't prevent us from falling asleep and we never awoke in the middle of the night due to a train passing.  The room was on the first floor and it was nice and roomy with a couch, coffee table, a desk, fridge, microwave, etc.  The carpet was a little wavy in areas, but that doesn't bother me, and the air conditioner dripped water onto the carpet.  We stay at La Quinta because

What to expect:  You will find all the basic  amenities that you usually find at every other La Quinta, in-room coffee maker/refrigerator, flat-screen TV with descent number of channels, free Wi-Fi, etc. While some people may like the thought or feel of spending the night in a room modeled after a grain mill, it was somewhat creepy. The walls in the room were undecorated cement, which I can only imagine is the overall feeling of being in a prison cell. It would have been a lot better if they covered the walls with sheet rock and given them the standard white or off-white color. As it stands, you are surrounded by gray cement walls with a few pictures and some type of small quilt hanging from one of the walls.   I am not sure that most hotels are made in such a way, using what

La Quinta Inn & Suites in Irvine is a delightful variation on a clean, well run, well staffed mid priced Inn.   A three story concrete storage building has been cleverly transformed into an inn, resulting incredibly quiet, inherently cool, industrial cozy rooms.  To add to the eclectic feeling, the LA commuter train runs behind the property - but within the granary rooms you are unaware of the whistles. The property is just off  I-5 freeway, close to University of California Irvine, and a reasonable dive to Disneyland.  A number of fast food options and an acceptable hamburger restaurant edge the parking lot. Rooms are clean, property attractive, staff cheerful and courteous, and the inclusive breakfast sufficient.  To pet owners, four legged friends are welcome without an

Summary Heading: Good value, good location, good god there is a train
Summary: I'm sure many others have mentioned the train passing within 10 yards of some rooms, personally I didn't think it was that bad and my sleep wan't disturbed by bedtime.  The location close to the Spectrum, the District, and even Costco close by keeps the girls happy.  The proximity to UCI was also very convenient.  Our very clean room was larger than most other places, refrigerator/microwave in room, decent breakfast really added to the value.  We have stayed here a number of times when dropping off or picking up our UCI student for school.

I have stayed at some very nice La Quinta hotels and this surely wasn't one of them.  Upon check-in we strictly requested a non-smoking room and were clearly given a smoking room that had dirty towels.  We requested o be moved rooms and they graciously obliged, but the second room had fruit flies flying everywhere.  not a pleasant stay but great location.

This was an unexpected gem of a hotel.  Who knew we would find something so neat in Irvine!  We were looking for a decent but cheap place for the night to stay after going to a concert.  The rate was extremely affordable, and half of the rooms are in an old converted granary building.  It's in the middle of a little complex of historic buildings called "Old Town Irvine."  It appears to be the only place in Irvine that hasn't been razed for commercial buildings or housing subdivisions.  The rooms in the granary are built in what would have once been grain silos, so they're hexagon-shaped with concrete walls.  Room was neat, finishes felt pretty new.  The public areas looked a little worn, but nothing extreme.  The staff is very casual and informal--to be expected at a La Quinta.

Great centrally located hotel with friendly staff and an excellent continental breakfast.  Great value for your hotel dollars.  I've stayed at this hotel a few times in the past and my experience has been consistently good, no complaints.  Restaurants on property and fast food within walking distance.

Summary Heading: Will always want to find a room here
Summary: I have stayed here several times, sometimes with family, and that alone ought to tell you it is a good place. Yes, there are train tracks right next to it, but that is part of it's historic quality and at night, they are very few and very short. They don't bother me, but I thought I would mention it. I am really torn between encouraging others to see how nice it is and keeping it a secret.

We stay at this location frequently.  My husband loves the historic building and how it was converted.  The front desk employees are always so helpful and really go out of their way to make your stay the best.

Summary Heading: Great value and really comfy beds!
Summary: I wasn't sure how quiet the place would be with the freeway on one side and train on the other. But it turned out to be very quiet and very comfortable. Nice pool and hottub and decent breakfast bar. The burger joint next door was also good, but otherwise, there isn't much in walking distance which was ok. The location was central so it was easy to get around. Next time I'm in Irvine, I'll definitely stay there again!

Summary Heading: this hotel should have a higher rating
Summary: the beds were the best, jacuzzi, wonderful staff, beautiful look, homie but vintage rooms, only 61 dollars wonderful deal. would go back if in town in a heart beat!!!

Summary Heading: NOT for light sleepers, but otherwise O.K.
Summary: Both buildings at this hotel are VERY close to the Amtrak train tracks. Weekends aren't so bad, but weekday/night commuting trains are frequent and loud. You would have to be nearly comatose to sleep through the blasting train horns when they pass.  Adequate room, although we reported an inoperative telephone immediately after check-in and it was still inop after 3 nights at this hotel. Isn't that a potential safety/liability hazard?  The Guest services Directory does not inform you of the ice and vending machine locations--nor does the facility map handed to you at check-in (a ridiculous omission!).  The Guest Directory lists a number of restaurants in the area, including Denny's immediately next door. Yet it omits Knowlwood's, an excellent casual restaurant (open for Brkfst,

We initially chose this hotel for its location to our son's apartment.  Since we needed lo ging for 8 nites I wanted someplace that would be easy on the budget.  I never dreamed that for $65.00 a nite I could find a place that was as comfortable and clean as LaQuinta Inn.  The breakfast assortment was wonderful; hot waffles, oatmeal, cold cereals, yogurts, bagels, juice, coffee & tea; what more would you need!!  The shuttle service took us to the train station where we were able to catch the MetroLink down to San Juan Capistrano, to the Irvine Spectrum shopping mall, and to the airport.  Absolutely the best place to stay for your money.  Will definitely return.

Very dog friendly - the way to go for travelling with the pups.  most everyone picks up their dog crap too, which is nice, good grass in back for that.    Cool look and feel to the historic building.  We stayed in the Silo part - the concrete wall part - i liked the personality of the room - even a quilt up on the wall to offset the cold concrete.  AC was kind of blowy, hate that, but managed ok with the allergies.  Complimentary breakfast was alright - hard boiled eggs nice for those not wanting starchy stuff.  Coffee was bleh.  Front desk was cool,  but we didnt need them for much anyways.
This is a good inn. I use it all the time.  The staff has been very helpful. The La Qunita chain is a good value.

I traval a fair amount for business and I was in town for business and stayed here for a week.  My first room was literally 10 ft from high speed railway line.  All through the night the headlamps from the trains kept lifting up the room, even with the drapes closed.  Everytime a train went by, it sounded like a bomb went off outside.  Next morning I went to the front desk and asked to be moved to another room and the front desk person asked me if I was a light sleeper!  I'm not a light sleeper, there is a high speed rail line 10 ft from my bed!!!  I was moved to the 4th floor, which was a lot better and away from the tracks.  By Thursday, my room key stopped working, to add to that the elevator was broken.  So I had to walk 4 flights of stairs 3 times, because it took that many

This motel gives you all your average La Quinta gives but with a twist.  It is built into an old grain storage silo.  One wing of the hotel has octagonal walls in the rooms.  The rooms are clean and the cement walls give it character.  They also keep it quiet.  We are right on the train tracks and never heard a train go by.  Breakfast was plentiful and the staff was very helpful.  We will definately stay here again the next time we come into town.

We stayed at this hotel this past week and seriously found nothing to complain about. Our room was clean, the staff was friendly and helpful and the bed and pillows were so comfortable. The only time I heard the train was when I was outside in the parking lot in broad daylight.  The history of this place is pretty cool and it is located within a few minutes of just about everything you could need or want.  I am particular and was leery based on some of the comments here but we gave it a try because of it's location and I am so glad we did. I would definitely stay here again.  If you are looking for 5 star accommodations you clearly need to look elsewhere but if you want a place that is clean, safe, friendly and comfortable... this will definitely fit the bill.

A group of us stayed at this hotel for a week and the hotel was average but clean. We were very happy with the staff. Everyone was so helpful and they even kept the hot tub open a little longer so that we could enjoy it after long days of hiking. We stayed in the Silo section of the hotel. We faced the parking lot so we really didnt hear the train at night. The breakfast area is really cool looking since they kept so many parts of the silo intact. Overall it was a great stay and I would recommend it to everyone

Starters:  For all you Fallout video game fans, if you get a room in the rehab'd silo, you'll have fun.  Its like living in one of the vaults before the time lapse doors open.  Literally, a seperate building is a converted barley and lima bean silo back from the 50's.  Kitchy....the walls are cement and untreated, only 1 wall is done and this is to make the bathroom.  We were given a ground floor room (#125 to be exact) and it was close to the entrance/lobby/breakfast area.  Since the walls are cement and thick, it dampens the noise, but you could still hear the breakfast crowd gathering, but it wasn't bad.    I thought the bed was comfortable and it had ample pillows.  TV was nice and new and plenty of outlets for all your gadgets.  The bathroom....well it was a handicapped

Summary Heading: Nice rooms in an old lima bean silo
Summary: I've never had much luck with La Quinta.  But I went ahead and booked this one as it was only about 1/2 mile from where I would be working.  Finally, I was not disappointed by La Quinta.  The train tracks that run by - there is a sign about it at the front desk.  I heard one train pass by at about 9pm, but after that heard nothing.  My room was in the old lima bean silo on the highway side.  I heard neither train nor highway.  The room itself was quite large - the size of a silo, of course.  The bed was a bit soft, but comfortable.  The bathroom - no door except to the toilet/shower.  The shower had decent pressure and temperature.  The room had the concrete walls of the silo with some framed art hanging.  The hotel has a fairly standard breakfast area - bagels, toast, cereal,

this hotel is about 5 feet away from a high speed Amtrac line.  A very busy line.  The hotel clerk said it would come by twice an hour and stop at 10:00 PM.  we figured hat would be OK. After all we actually live in the vicinity of a freight train line so how bad could it be.  The train went by 3 to 4 times an hour along with 1:00 AM and 4:00 AM runs.  At least those were he ones we heard.  Whoever thought it was a good idea to build at this location should probably be looking for another line of work.  Rooms were very nice and clean, just a very stupid place for a hotel.

Every La Quinta Inn and Suites Irvine Spectrum employee exceeded our expectation of excellent customer service. The complimentary breakfast menu offered an abundance of choices. Overall, an incredible deal for the price.

Summary Heading: Right for the price and location
Summary: We have friends up in Camarillo and sometimes meet halfway to hang out for the night.   This La Quinta is just right location wise and the beds were nothing special, but we slept through the night. It is your basic hotel and the staff is extremely friendly!

Summary Heading: Pleasant experience, but needs some renovation
Summary: I have stayed at this property a number of times in recent years.  It is a unique place stay, although it needs some renovations.  It has been updated somewhat, but it needs some work especailly in the bathrooms.  They are clean, but lots wear and tear.

Summary Heading: It met all of our needs.
Summary: We stayed at the La Quinta because it is pet friendly.  I had read some reviews of people complaining about the noise from the MetroLink and a night club, but neither of those was a problem at all, for us. We stayed in the part of the hotel that is converted lima bean and grain silos made of concrete.  I found it to be very unique and interesting and would recommend it to others and would also stay there again. It only has a couple of places to eat that are walking distance, but it is less than a block from a freeway on/off ramp (I-5) and there are many places to eat within 1-2 miles..

The rooms facing east are bigger and pretty cool, the west ones are more standard.  Two of my team noticed a bad smell when they checked in.  The second night it was really bad, so they finally found a large pile of dog poop just under the edge of the bed. The previous renter was a slob to allow this, but to consider it was "Cleaned" for 2 days and the staff didnt vacumn under edge of bed or smell the poop is riduculous. More ridiculous was that when they called office they said they couldn't do anything about it for awhile and it was a couple hours before they got to it and picked it up.  Still didnt wash or spray anything.  I just cant recommend this with the average rooms and poor unapologetic customer service.

Summary Heading: Disappointed in the "old" section of the La Qunita
Summary: This is the first time that we stayed in the "old" section of the La Qunita.  Only availability when you need two beds for four adults.  Queen size beds are the preference and not double beds.  The carpet was old/spotted and patched.  The adjoining neighbors were not considerate of other guest, talking on the balcony at 3:00 AM. My son and his wife were in the silo section, and had to call the front desk as there were kids running up and down the halls at 3:00 AM.  We have stayed here numerous times, but this time we were disappointed.  Additionally, our room was continually stocked with three bath towels. Daily, we had to request  an additional towel.  If we require space for four, no I would not make a reservation here again.   M. Gutzman

Summary Heading: We loved the LQ Irvine Spectrum for its unique historical setting!  A former Lima Bean silo, a must see and stay!
Summary: Convenient, off the Interstate 5 and very close to the 405, is a Most unique inn in "Old Irvine," the LQ Spectrum was a turn of the century lima bean and grain silo.  The "silo" rooms are carved out of the solid concrete and in the round of the actual original silo. The original processing bldg. still exists and contains a great eatery and bar.  A must see and close to beach cities.

Do not let them put you in the back building. The room I am in sits twenty feet from the railroad tracks and it's like something out of a bad movie--the room shakes, the horn blares, and the trains come through every half an hour to forty-five minutes all night long. The bed was also old--the middle was really sunken in. The room was nice, big, though old and in need of some updating.   I won't come back.

Summary Heading: Great Property for family and pets
Summary: If you are traveling with a pet, there are two restaurants next to the property with patios for "feeding fido".

Summary Heading: Like LQ -- not sure I'll stay here again....
Summary: There are 2 buildings.   One is the ''old'' LQ and it looks like it from outside.    Check in was great, front desk helpful, professional.    Went to the old building first, by mistake, and a loud barking dog in the end room, top floor, and an ash tray sitting on the exterior room window left a bad impression.   So, ''newer'' building is an old commercial bean warehouse that's been converted.   My room, 340, faced the railroad tracks to the West.     The train will be VERY disturbing to some guests.     The train sounds it's horn as it's approaching and it's possible to spit out the window and hit the train.    The train is LOUD, and passes A LOT!     No matter what building you're in, you'll hear the train.      The interior door handle of the room door punched a large hole in

I visited a friend in Irvine and didn't want to pay a fortune; the price was better than most of the other motels in the area.  The location was an easy access from I-5.  Overall, it was a good experience.  The staff was friendly & helpful with directions.  The room was clean & spotless.  The bed was comfy.  Breakfast was "make your own" waffles, toast, yogurt, bagels, muffins, hard boiled eggs, cereal, juice, milk & coffee.  They even had peanut butter for my toast!  I would definitely stay here again and recommend it.

Summary Heading: Is that Train going to come through my room?
Summary: Checked into this hotel late and when I got out of the car I was amazed how loud and noisy the restaraunt/night club was next door. Undeterred and tired, I went to my room which was funky and neat as the hotel is made out of an old lima bean railside depot. I got settled, put my head on the pillow and then suddenly began to think based on the noise I was hearing that the end of the world was upon us and the world was blowing up. A horn so loud blew that had to have woken every person in the hotel and then a whoosh so loud and frightening went by the outside of my room that the door in my room rattled back and forth. I ran to the window to see a freight train running by the outside of my room a mere 5 feet from the wondow. The train itself had to have been 3/4's of a mile long

Summary Heading: Great for the money - Very unique
Summary: We go to this area a few times a year - usually we stay in an upscale hotel - thought we might try saving some money. This motel was a pleasant suprise for us. Front desk was great - happy to see us and had us on our way to the room in a minute. Our room was in the silo -  Funky in a cool way. It was clean and comfortable. Everything worked. If there was a train, we didn't hear it. I was a little worried after reading some of the negative reviews. They were definitely not our experience. We plan on using this motel again.

Summary Heading: Kooky looking, noisy hotel, but with great history and stories
Summary: Driving to this hotel I was thinking 'that is one awful looking building I hope thats not our hotel' but it was.  It looked like a derelict farm, and it turned out, thats just what it used to be.  Reception were friendly, and it looked very clean.  They made sure they told us how close we were to the railroad tracks, and asked us if we were sure we wanted to stay, and told us the train times when we would be woken!  We went to out room and were shocked, but kind of happily surprised to learn it was an old grain silo!  How cool is that?  The rooms were hexagon shaped, and unpainted concrete, and there was a paper telling you how and why the hotel was built.  Breakfast is included and was rather basic, and it was fun to see pictures of the hotel when it was a working

We have stayed at this hotel numerous times and have always enjoyed it.  The breakfast is great, the rooms are clean and up to date.  The fact that it is an old silo is a great thrill to children as is the high speed train that runs behind the hotel.  There are a few places to walk and eat.  All rooms have wifi.  Very pet friendly and the staff is great.

Summary Heading: Convenient, and good value for money
Summary: The rooms are clean, decent sized, and seems to have been renovated not too long ago. Within a few minutes walking distance are several food outlets and a gas station, so if you're suffering from jet lag and feel very hungry in the middle of the night, you can just walk out an grab a bite at Denny's. The complimentary breakfast can be boring if you're staying more than a couple of days, but then it's complimentary, and there are other choices just across the parking lot. Overall, very good value for money. Will definitely stay here again when I'm next in Irvine.

Summary Heading: Was a great price until I found out the shuttle stops at 7 pm and we had to pay $25 for a taxi
Summary: We flew into the Santa Ana airport and needed a ride to the hotel which they advertise on their site.  What they don't advertise is that the shuttle stops running at 7 pm and it costs $25 for a taxi ride.  That made our $44 a night (on AAA) hotel, more than the 4* hotel we got on Hotwire.  Definitely not worth that price!!  If you use this hotel, make sure you get there before 7 pm or that you are driving. The room had a distinct ODOR, not sure what it was, if it was just a musty smell or what.  The room was fairly clean but the shower had mold in it.  Surprisingly, the beds were actually comfortable which I wasn't expecting with the experience I was having so far.  The pool and hot tub area did not look inviting like they do in the pictures.  The breakfast was all carbs except

Found the staff professonal and pleasant. Breakfast in AM was adequate - would have desired better pastries, but ok. Clean and tidy room, Quiet and acceptable. Mattress was hard, but for one night I handled it. WOuld have loved a pillowtop.  Restroom was clean and no mold or dirty corners, etc.  Stay was adequate for the price - bertter tan most in that price range.

I realize I was only spending 53 dollars to stay here, but this hotel was just stinky.  The carpets were filthy, the paint needs to be refreshed, and the room & bedding all smelled like smoke-trying-desperately-to-be-disguised-by-some-nauseating air freshener. Just smelly. I think I breathed through my mouth the entire night, trying to avoid smelling anything.  Just to give you an idea, I showered with my flip flops on.  As for the bedding? It was beyond pathetic, Thee thinnest blanket known to man, with a shiny, 70s quilt as back-up (which I didn't use because I couldn't get Matt Lauer's black-light expose from Dateline out of my head). My room was in the front of the property, so I got to listen to I-5 all night (I pretended like it was the ocean, didn't work) and also the

Drove in Horrible traffic for 5.5 hours to arrive at the Irvine La Quinta, and was pleasantly suprised!  Nice little updated rooms.  VERY comfy beds (sweet matress I wanted to take home!) and a nice clean shower.  There was also a little fridge and microwave.  Parking was a problem at night because of the bar/club.  Just us girls went on this trip and while we were walking the (long) distance to our room from the parking lot, a weird guy went running through the parking lot growling and ripping his tank top to shreds.. haha!  Entertainment included!    Check in was easy (not super friendly) and because we were la quinta club members, we were able to check out at 12 (like the old days!).  We stayed in the main building (not the silo) so we didnt hear a peep out of trains.. Loved

Summary Heading: Quality offering in the price range in historic building, convenient location.
Summary: For¬†a¬†hotel¬†of¬†this¬†price¬†level,¬†I¬†was¬†very¬†pleasantly¬†surprised.¬†They¬†charged¬†us¬†$89¬†for¬†a¬†room¬†for¬†2¬†adults¬†&¬†one¬†canine¬†with¬†no¬†pet¬†deposit.¬†The¬†room,¬†while¬†moderately¬†sized¬†was¬†well¬†appointed¬†with¬†plenty¬†of¬†towels,¬†good¬†linens¬†&¬†nice¬†pillows.¬†It¬†ain't¬†the¬†Four¬†Seasons,¬†but¬†it¬†was¬†well¬†beyond¬†$89¬†in¬†value.¬†¬†  What's¬†really¬†unique¬†&¬†fun¬†about¬†this¬†La¬†Quinta¬†us¬†that¬†it's¬†built¬†in¬†a¬†historic¬†grain¬†&¬†bean¬†warehouse/silo.¬†¬†They¬†put¬†us¬†up¬†in¬†one¬†of¬†the¬†warehouse¬†rooms,¬†and¬†the¬†walls¬†were¬†finished¬†in¬†raw¬†concrete¬†and¬†metal.¬†¬†A¬†lot¬†of¬†the¬†original¬†structures¬†are¬†still¬†intact¬†in¬†the¬†common¬†areas,¬†including¬†a¬†grain¬†elevator¬†and¬†lots¬†of¬†industrial¬†pipping¬†and¬†whatnot.

This hotel was better than I expected.   Part of the rooms are in an old Lima bean warehouse...I'm not kidding.   Its location is not fantastic.  It is a reasonable drive to shopping.  Really not bad for an overnight stay.  A Denny's and Jack in the Box are adjacent.  The breakfast was adequate and well attended.  The staff was very professional and friendly.  My only complaint would be not being able to open my window (on the top floor of the lima bean mill)   And the air freshener was way too strong!!  Trains do go by the property but did not disturb me.  If you are a light sleeper it could be a problem.   Don't expect a upscale hotel.  Just a clean place to sleep and a decent value.

Summary Heading: Not as bad as the reviews led me to expect
Summary: I read all the reviews and almost passed on this, but the location, price and availablility won over. I made sure, based on what I read, to ask for a room on the side away from the train tracks.   The staff was fine, the round room, with the bare concrete walls was different, but not bad at all. I liked the bathroom, the tiled tub was a nice feature. The window faced east and the morning sun lit the room up pleasantly. The frequent trains made the room vibrate slightly, and the sound of the horns sounded distant and did not bother me at all.   The best thing about the free breakfast was the waffle iron, if you are into that. Otherwise the pickings were kinda slim. There is a GREAT restaurant next door, Knowlwood. Thier fish tacos were amazing and inexpensive!  For somebody that

Summary Heading: resonable place to stay close to irvine spectrum
Summary: Our clients stayed here for 2 nights and  all the feedback was good. It is only 5 minutes from the Sears Corp plaza and our staff can pick up the guests.  It was easy check in and the reception was friendly.  Our managers Mike and Steven Sears pay for the stay close by  Irvine.

Summary Heading: Take my word for it: SKIP IT.
Summary: First of all, let me say that my expectations aren't really that high. Especially within the price range of La Quinta. I know that they're clean and generally accommodating and that's why I chose this one. Convenient location and clean and within a decent price range for the area. Boy, was I wrong. Was I ever. If you don't believe me, drive around the property a few times before going into the office. A train runs RIGHT BEHIND IT *(I'm talking like 10 feet behind the entire building) and THAT'S where you'll be staying. Close enough that you could reach out and touch it from your window practically. If it's not enough that you have to listen to it rattle by on a regular schedule through the night and early in the morning, IT RATTLES YOUR ROOM...the whole building rattles when the

We recently spent 2 nights at the La Quinta Irvine.   This hotel is right off the freeway and in a business area.  Irvine Spectrum is about five minutes away.  The hotel is divided into two buildings.  There is a main building attached to the office and another building that was a former grainery.  We stayed in the former grainery on the third floor.  The room had one king bed and was very large.  We also had a microwave and refrigerrator.  It was clean and the bedding was good.  There are restaurants within walking distance and they offer a modest continental breakfast.  There is a train track that runs very near the hotel but we only heard trains a few times.  I am sure the concrete walls helped to insulate the noise.  The only noise we heard was from the parking lot late at

Summary Heading: From Great to Mundane... through the years
Summary: We began staying here five to six years ago and were members of the "club."  Always stayed in the "silo" and knew to ask for "king, non-smoking, parking lot side, second or third floor."  Even had room numbers memorized.  Remodeled in last few years, better beds, nicer amenities.  Very large rooms in silo if you get the KING size bed. Only a single window, stuffy at night as noise prevents leaving the window open and no "cross breeze" anyway. Concrete, unpainted walls which might turn some people off.  Easy to hear footsteps upstairs.  Drainage of tub/shower molasses slow on third floor or higher - avoid.  Used to be easily able to redeem our "frequent flyer" nights. Now almost impossible or later told that additional charge for silo, though that is where we always stayed.

Summary Heading: Horrible Service and a Great Room
Summary: We started staying at the Laquinta in Irvine at the Spectrum on July 10th and stayed for 14 nights. This stay was secured by CC from my assistant, after we paid cash for the first night. Upon preperation for our departure we were met with extreme resistance from the hotel manager, Gabriel CaBianca. We were accused of credit card fraud in a lobby full of other guests. The hotel manager insisted on receiving cash for our stay. We finally settled that dispute, or so we thought...   We had an occassion to come back to Irvine and since the kids loved the pool area, we decided, reluctantly, to stay there again. When we called to make our reservation, we were told by Jose that if we booked online, we would get the Weekend Impulse rate of $59 per night. However, the hotel we were trying

My daughter attends college at U.C. Irvine, so I've spent many nights in Orange County area hotel rooms.  This time I looked for a moderately (rather than high-end, which are easy to find in "the O.C.") priced room.  There's a reason this place is moderately priced!  There is a little model train on the reception counter with a sign that says, "Ask us about the train."  Some advice:  ask!  Or, better yet, if you're very sensitive to noise and vibration, choose another place to stay.  This hotel is absolutely right on the railroad tracks.  These tracks service Amtrack, the Metrolink (commuter trains), and a freight service.  The trains go through all day & night.  The building is a cool, old, remodeled granary, with rooms actually built into the old silos, but the rooms that are

Some might enjoy the ‚Äúcharm‚Äù of this motel built within a converted lima bean silo, but I didn't.    When I made the reservation online I requested as quiet a room as possible.  I already knew this motel was between the freeway and the train tracks so I wasn't expecting much, but the indifferent front desk clerk ended up putting me in a 1st floor room right on the train tracks.  When I opened the curtains the tracks were not 10 feet from the window.  Also, the area around the window was littered with broken screens, beer bottles, and cigarette packages.  The trains were very loud and shook the room.  During peak hours they ran every 15 minutes.  For the most part the trains stopped at 11 pm, although one came through at 3 am.  They started back up at 6 am for another round of

STayed here two nights. Was clean and friendly. Pro's: Cheap for the OC, Clean, Friendly staff, good parking, Free WIFI. Cons:Trains, and I mean within 20 feet.. startled the hell out of me but kind of funny, and they stop after 10ish, nothing close, you need to drive to everything and its about 1-2 miles.   Like I said its decent enough, nothing great but not bad. I would stay here again if I needed to.

Just returned from staying 4 nights.  Although the trains are close (they make no mistake in telling you this) they are short trains and by the second night I never bothered with them.  The room was spacious, clean, and staff were kind and courteous.  We observed staff always busy with the care of the hotel and guests.  Our hairdryer did not work the first morning and was replaced in 5minutes of our request.  Would highly recommend this property.

Summary Heading: Don't pay attention to bad reports!
Summary: Freeway ramp 5 south & north at the corner.  15 minutes to Disney and way better in price.  The square is called "Old Town" part of the hotel along with a unique restaurant and other neat business's are built in the Lima Bean & Grain Warehouse.  It is cute!  Fun for the family. A Denny's restaurant is also on property. I stayed in the regular part of the hotel.  I wish I had a room in the warehouse it looks awesome.  Yes there is a train that runs every so often, it is not a big deal.  I have heard worse noise in downtown San Diego or L.A. with the traffic roaring all night long and sirens. It is clean, the bed is comfortable, not like some of those beds that feel like cardboard.  The mattress being soft and comfortable and the room being clean meant more to me. Another nice

I was showing my dog at a dog show in San Juan Capistrano and needed a place to stay.  Unfortunately, I procrastinated in getting a reservation and couldn't get anything near the show site that was affordable.  I reluctantly made a reservation at this motel but everything turned out wonderful.  This place was a joy to stay.  I had a huge corner room in the main building on the third floor.  Being on a corner, the room had windows on two sides, which made the inside nice and bright.  Trains did run close by, but the sound wasn't bad at all.  The room had a mini-fridge and a microwave.  I picked up a couple of extra juice and pastries from the complimentary breakfast bar and stored it in the fridge for "emergencies".  The motel is right off of a freeway ramp, which made access

Summary Heading: Worst Hotel Stay I have ever had
Summary: Noisy? an understatement; Trains run all night? yes, definitely; If the hotel offers you a $10 credit "for the noise"? tell them you wouldn't stay there if they offered you a free room plus $100 cash.  This was the worst stay of any hotel I have ever been to, anywhere, EVER, period. surreal.  thank you.  George Marquez

This stay ended up being the WORST HOTEL STAY I HAVE EVER HAD. The blonde woman in the office lied about being a manager and was more than mean to my seven year old son and I. After my arranged extended stay at this hotel I was 1/2 of an hour late getting to the office to pay for my final week stay. The office called the police FOR NO REASON to escort us out. I have NEVER BEEN TREATED THIS WAY IN MY LIFE and after spending over $600.00 at this hotel found it to be an awful way to be treated. There are many better places to stay in this beautiful area and recomend the embassy suites or anywhere else.

Stayed here in April 2005, after tirelessly searching on-line for an affordable lodging in the Anaheim/Buena Park area.  This hotel is in two buildings, one is the usual La Quinta layout/style, the other is a renovated grain silo!  After reading reviews on this site about the railroad tracks nearby, I requested a room away from the railroad, which automatically puts you in the regular part of the hotel.  I was very satisfied with the accommodation and didn't hear a train passing whilst in my room.  The breakfast is taken in the silo building which is the usual complimentary breakfast, cereals, bagels, coffee, muffins etc.  Although it meant a longer drive to the Theme Parks, it was more than offset by the price of the accommodation, which came in around $60 cheaper per night

Summary Heading: Love it, love it, love it
Summary: The room was beautiful! They are round and spacious. The two sets of double pained windows and the beautifuly finished concrete walls completely block noise from the trains. The don't run at the wee hours, besides it's perfect for the theme.   Everything about this hotel and it's location is great. The views and sunsets from the west facing, non-smoking rooms are the added bonus.

Not bad! Yes, the trains can be a bit noisy, but if you need e-mail access during your stay and you've got a laptop along, the free DSL makes up for nightly noises. Rooms are clean and nice. The fridge, coffemaker with coffee, and hairdryer are also appreciated. Bonus- the burger joint next door serves cold beer, good burgers, and huge slices of cake!
This hotel sites behind train tracks and the train runs late in the night and you will be woken up by the noise. We did and it was not a good thing.
